	<main class="flex flex-1 flex-col"><div class="SVELTE_HYDRATER contents" data-target="DailyPapersBannerSubscribe" data-props="{&quot;isLoggedIn&quot;:false}"><div class="-mt-px flex h-9 w-full justify-center text-gray-600"><svg class="hidden h-9 flex-none text-gray-100/80 dark:text-gray-800/40 sm:block" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 110 41"><path fill="currentColor" d="M110 0H0c39.1 0 44 9.6 49 19.5C54.6 30 60 41 108 41h2V0Z"></path></svg>
	<div class="flex items-center justify-center gap-3 bg-gray-100/80 text-sm dark:bg-gray-800/40 max-sm:flex-1"><div class="rounded-md bg-blue-500/20 px-1 text-xs font-semibold uppercase text-blue-600">new</div>

	<div class="SVELTE_HYDRATER contents" data-target="DailyPapers" data-props="{&quot;canSubmit&quot;:false,&quot;dailyPapers&quot;:[{&quot;paper&quot;:{&quot;id&quot;:&quot;2511.12884&quot;,&quot;authors&quot;:[{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;691bea4f6bfd5965c0fd3837&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Worawalan Chatlatanagulchai&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;691bea4f6bfd5965c0fd3838&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;62b4f3b7464e664268bf4e85&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/62b4f3b7464e664268bf4e85/atFIscmB37aur0a1zuQ2o.jpeg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Leo&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;hao-li&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Hao Li&quot;,&quot;status&quot;:&quot;claimed_verified&quot;,&quot;statusLastChangedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-11-18T14:07:56.453Z&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;691bea4f6bfd5965c0fd3839&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Yutaro Kashiwa&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;691bea4f6bfd5965c0fd383a&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Brittany Reid&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;691bea4f6bfd5965c0fd383b&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Kundjanasith Thonglek&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;691bea4f6bfd5965c0fd383c&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Pattara Leelaprute&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;691bea4f6bfd5965c0fd383d&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Arnon Rungsawang&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;691bea4f6bfd5965c0fd383e&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Bundit Manaskasemsak&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;691bea4f6bfd5965c0fd383f&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Bram Adams&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;691bea4f6bfd5965c0fd3840&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Ahmed E. Hassan&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;691bea4f6bfd5965c0fd3841&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Hajimu Iida&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false}],&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-11-17T02:18:55.000Z&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyAt&quot;:&quot;2025-11-19T00:32:43.060Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Agent READMEs: An Empirical Study of Context Files for Agentic Coding&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;62b4f3b7464e664268bf4e85&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/62b4f3b7464e664268bf4e85/atFIscmB37aur0a1zuQ2o.jpeg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Leo&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;hao-li&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Agentic coding tools receive goals written in natural language as input, break them down into specific tasks, and write or execute the actual code with minimal human intervention. Central to this process are agent context files (\&quot;READMEs for agents\&quot;) that provide persistent, project-level instructions. In this paper, we conduct the first large-scale empirical study of 2,303 agent context files from 1,925 repositories to characterize their structure, maintenance, and content. We find that these files are not static documentation but complex, difficult-to-read artifacts that evolve like configuration code, maintained through frequent, small additions. Our content analysis of 16 instruction types shows that developers prioritize functional context, such as build and run commands (62.3%), implementation details (69.9%), and architecture (67.7%). We also identify a significant gap: non-functional requirements like security (14.5%) and performance (14.5%) are rarely specified. These findings indicate that while developers use context files to make agents functional, they provide few guardrails to ensure that agent-written code is secure or performant, highlighting the need for improved tooling and practices.&quot;,&quot;upvotes&quot;:5,&quot;discussionId&quot;:&quot;691bea4f6bfd5965c0fd3842&quot;,&quot;projectPage&quot;:&quot;https://agents.md&quot;,&quot;githubRepo&quot;:&quot;https://github.com/openai/agents.md&quot;,&quot;githubRepoAddedBy&quot;:&quot;auto&quot;,&quot;githubStars&quot;:11986},&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-11-16T21:18:55.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Agent READMEs: An Empirical Study of Context Files for Agentic Coding&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Agentic coding tools receive goals written in natural language as input, break them down into specific tasks, and write or execute the actual code with minimal human intervention. Central to this process are agent context files (\&quot;READMEs for agents\&quot;) that provide persistent, project-level instructions. In this paper, we conduct the first large-scale empirical study of 2,303 agent context files from 1,925 repositories to characterize their structure, maintenance, and content. We find that these files are not static documentation but complex, difficult-to-read artifacts that evolve like configuration code, maintained through frequent, small additions. Our content analysis of 16 instruction types shows that developers prioritize functional context, such as build and run commands (62.3%), implementation details (69.9%), and architecture (67.7%). We also identify a significant gap: non-functional requirements like security (14.5%) and performance (14.5%) are rarely specified. These findings indicate that while developers use context files to make agents functional, they provide few guardrails to ensure that agent-written code is secure or performant, highlighting the need for improved tooling and practices.&quot;,&quot;thumbnail&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-thumbnails.huggingface.co/social-thumbnails/papers/2511.12884.png&quot;,&quot;numComments&quot;:2,&quot;upvoted&quot;:false,&quot;submittedBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;62b4f3b7464e664268bf4e85&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/62b4f3b7464e664268bf4e85/atFIscmB37aur0a1zuQ2o.jpeg&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Leo&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;hao-li&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;isHf&quot;:false,&quot;isHfAdmin&quot;:false,&quot;isMod&quot;:false,&quot;followerCount&quot;:2},&quot;isAuthorParticipating&quot;:true},{&quot;paper&quot;:{&quot;id&quot;:&quot;2512.11253&quot;,&quot;authors&quot;:[{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;693f75c3f516c693246811ed&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Zhiyuan Pun&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;693f75c3f516c693246811ef&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Chen Cun&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;vinthony&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Xiaodong Cun&quot;,&quot;status&quot;:&quot;claimed_verified&quot;,&quot;statusLastChangedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-12-15T08:08:36.497Z&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false}],&quot;mediaUrls&quot;:[&quot;https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/6039478ab3ecf716b1a5fd4d/Dqr8Qb2QmiTS3fnJWMGgC.mp4&quot;],&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-12-12T03:24:40.000Z&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyAt&quot;:&quot;2025-12-15T00:14:55.766Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;PersonaLive! Expressive Portrait Image Animation for Live Streaming&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6039478ab3ecf716b1a5fd4d&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/6039478ab3ecf716b1a5fd4d/_Thy4E7taiSYBLKxEKJbT.jpeg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:true,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;taesiri&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;taesiri&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Current diffusion-based portrait animation models predominantly focus on enhancing visual quality and expression realism, while overlooking generation latency and real-time performance, which restricts their application range in the live streaming scenario. We propose PersonaLive, a novel diffusion-based framework towards streaming real-time portrait animation with multi-stage training recipes. Specifically, we first adopt hybrid implicit signals, namely implicit facial representations and 3D implicit keypoints, to achieve expressive image-level motion control. Then, a fewer-step appearance distillation strategy is proposed to eliminate appearance redundancy in the denoising process, greatly improving inference efficiency. Finally, we introduce an autoregressive micro-chunk streaming generation paradigm equipped with a sliding training strategy and a historical keyframe mechanism to enable low-latency and stable long-term video generation. Extensive experiments demonstrate that PersonaLive achieves state-of-the-art performance with up to 7-22x speedup over prior diffusion-based portrait animation models.&quot;,&quot;upvotes&quot;:20,&quot;discussionId&quot;:&quot;693f75c3f516c693246811f2&quot;,&quot;githubRepo&quot;:&quot;https://github.com/GVCLab/PersonaLive&quot;,&quot;githubRepoAddedBy&quot;:&quot;user&quot;,&quot;ai_summary&quot;:&quot;PersonaLive is a diffusion-based framework for real-time portrait animation that enhances speed and efficiency through multi-stage training, hybrid implicit signals, appearance distillation, and autoregressive micro-chunk streaming.&quot;,&quot;ai_keywords&quot;:[&quot;diffusion-based framework&quot;,&quot;implicit facial representations&quot;,&quot;3D implicit keypoints&quot;,&quot;expressive image-level motion control&quot;,&quot;appearance distillation&quot;,&quot;autoregressive micro-chunk streaming&quot;,&quot;sliding training strategy&quot;,&quot;historical keyframe mechanism&quot;],&quot;githubStars&quot;:341,&quot;organization&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;69402e7fa7c562569cd809c2&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;GVCLab&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;GVC Lab at Great Bay University&quot;,&quot;avatar&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/63184c517ca1b876d99b7e0e/0mQ2Re10Y0HKnD878FGiU.png&quot;}},&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-12-11T22:24:40.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;PersonaLive! Expressive Portrait Image Animation for Live Streaming&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Current diffusion-based portrait animation models predominantly focus on enhancing visual quality and expression realism, while overlooking generation latency and real-time performance, which restricts their application range in the live streaming scenario. We propose PersonaLive, a novel diffusion-based framework towards streaming real-time portrait animation with multi-stage training recipes. Specifically, we first adopt hybrid implicit signals, namely implicit facial representations and 3D implicit keypoints, to achieve expressive image-level motion control. Then, a fewer-step appearance distillation strategy is proposed to eliminate appearance redundancy in the denoising process, greatly improving inference efficiency. Finally, we introduce an autoregressive micro-chunk streaming generation paradigm equipped with a sliding training strategy and a historical keyframe mechanism to enable low-latency and stable long-term video generation. Extensive experiments demonstrate that PersonaLive achieves state-of-the-art performance with up to 7-22x speedup over prior diffusion-based portrait animation models.&quot;,&quot;mediaUrls&quot;:[&quot;https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/6039478ab3ecf716b1a5fd4d/Dqr8Qb2QmiTS3fnJWMGgC.mp4&quot;],&quot;thumbnail&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-thumbnails.huggingface.co/social-thumbnails/papers/2512.11253.png&quot;,&quot;numComments&quot;:2,&quot;upvoted&quot;:false,&quot;submittedBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6039478ab3ecf716b1a5fd4d&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/6039478ab3ecf716b1a5fd4d/_Thy4E7taiSYBLKxEKJbT.jpeg&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;taesiri&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;taesiri&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:true,&quot;isHf&quot;:false,&quot;isHfAdmin&quot;:false,&quot;isMod&quot;:false,&quot;followerCount&quot;:185},&quot;organization&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;69402e7fa7c562569cd809c2&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;GVCLab&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;GVC Technical Report&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;5df85abada6d0311fd3d5408&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;/avatars/2331cf703c1b5d3a62e2050b1a6eb108.svg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Li Dong&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;unilm&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;This report presents VibeVoice, a novel model designed to synthesize\nlong-form speech with multiple speakers by employing next-token diffusion,\nwhich is a unified method for modeling continuous data by autoregressively\ngenerating latent vectors via diffusion. To enable this, we introduce a novel\ncontinuous speech tokenizer that, when compared to the popular Encodec model,\nimproves data compression by 80 times while maintaining comparable performance.\nThe tokenizer effectively preserves audio fidelity while significantly boosting\ncomputational efficiency for processing long sequences. Thus, VibeVoice can\nsynthesize long-form speech for up to 90 minutes (in a 64K context window\nlength) with a maximum of 4 speakers, capturing the authentic conversational\n``vibe'' and surpassing open-source and proprietary dialogue models.&quot;,&quot;upvotes&quot;:130,&quot;discussionId&quot;:&quot;68ae6a0f364411bea07df71c&quot;,&quot;projectPage&quot;:&quot;https://microsoft.github.io/VibeVoice/&quot;,&quot;githubRepo&quot;:&quot;https://github.com/microsoft/VibeVoice&quot;,&quot;githubRepoAddedBy&quot;:&quot;user&quot;,&quot;ai_summary&quot;:&quot;VibeVoice synthesizes long-form multi-speaker speech using next-token diffusion and a highly efficient continuous speech tokenizer, achieving superior performance and fidelity.&quot;,&quot;ai_keywords&quot;:[&quot;next-token diffusion&quot;,&quot;continuous speech tokenizer&quot;,&quot;Encodec&quot;,&quot;audio fidelity&quot;,&quot;computational efficiency&quot;,&quot;long-form speech&quot;,&quot;multi-speaker synthesis&quot;,&quot;conversational vibe&quot;,&quot;dialogue models&quot;],&quot;githubStars&quot;:18200,&quot;organization&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;68151d0f51add3813f3f7d1b&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;MicrosoftResearch&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Microsoft Research&quot;,&quot;avatar&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/6529a4f2f1205983224fa513/PeuVr7jSuJflmDBBGxoDX.png&quot;}},&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-08-26T13:09:12.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;VibeVoice Technical Report&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;This report presents VibeVoice, a novel model designed to synthesize\nlong-form speech with multiple speakers by employing next-token diffusion,\nwhich is a unified method for modeling continuous data by autoregressively\ngenerating latent vectors via diffusion. To enable this, we introduce a novel\ncontinuous speech tokenizer that, when compared to the popular Encodec model,\nimproves data compression by 80 times while maintaining comparable performance.\nThe tokenizer effectively preserves audio fidelity while significantly boosting\ncomputational efficiency for processing long sequences. Thus, VibeVoice can\nsynthesize long-form speech for up to 90 minutes (in a 64K context window\nlength) with a maximum of 4 speakers, capturing the authentic conversational\n``vibe'' and surpassing open-source and proprietary dialogue models.&quot;,&quot;mediaUrls&quot;:[&quot;https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/5df85abada6d0311fd3d5408/6tNh2DlU1e_nu7eznNjy1.png&quot;],&quot;thumbnail&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-thumbnails.huggingface.co/social-thumbnails/papers/2508.19205.png&quot;,&quot;numComments&quot;:6,&quot;upvoted&quot;:false,&quot;submittedBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;5df85abada6d0311fd3d5408&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;/avatars/2331cf703c1b5d3a62e2050b1a6eb108.svg&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Li Guo&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6938e671dfc35938ba129fd8&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Xubin Ren&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6938e671dfc35938ba129fd9&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Chao Huang&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false}],&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-12-08T16:07:13.000Z&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyAt&quot;:&quot;2025-12-10T00:48:19.359Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;DeepCode: Open Agentic Coding&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6039478ab3ecf716b1a5fd4d&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/6039478ab3ecf716b1a5fd4d/_Thy4E7taiSYBLKxEKJbT.jpeg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:true,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;taesiri&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;taesiri&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Recent advances in large language models (LLMs) have given rise to powerful coding agents, making it possible for code assistants to evolve into code engineers. However, existing methods still face significant challenges in achieving high-fidelity document-to-codebase synthesis--such as scientific papers to code--primarily due to a fundamental conflict between information overload and the context bottlenecks of LLMs. In this work, we introduce DeepCode, a fully autonomous framework that fundamentally addresses this challenge through principled information-flow management. By treating repository synthesis as a channel optimization problem, DeepCode seamlessly orchestrates four information operations to maximize task-relevant signals under finite context budgets: source compression via blueprint distillation, structured indexing using stateful code memory, conditional knowledge injection via retrieval-augmented generation, and closed-loop error correction. Extensive evaluations on the PaperBench benchmark demonstrate that DeepCode achieves state-of-the-art performance, decisively outperforming leading commercial agents such as Cursor and Claude Code, and crucially, surpassing PhD-level human experts from top institutes on key reproduction metrics. By systematically transforming paper specifications into production-grade implementations comparable to human expert quality, this work establishes new foundations for autonomous scientific reproduction that can accelerate research evaluation and discovery.&quot;,&quot;upvotes&quot;:25,&quot;discussionId&quot;:&quot;6938e672dfc35938ba129fda&quot;,&quot;githubRepo&quot;:&quot;https://github.com/HKUDS/DeepCode&quot;,&quot;githubRepoAddedBy&quot;:&quot;user&quot;,&quot;ai_summary&quot;:&quot;DeepCode, a fully autonomous framework, addresses the challenges of document-to-codebase synthesis by optimizing information flow through source compression, structured indexing, knowledge injection, and error correction, achieving state-of-the-art performance and surpassing human experts.&quot;,&quot;ai_keywords&quot;:[&quot;large language models&quot;,&quot;coding agents&quot;,&quot;document-to-codebase synthesis&quot;,&quot;information overload&quot;,&quot;context bottlenecks&quot;,&quot;DeepCode&quot;,&quot;channel optimization&quot;,&quot;blueprint distillation&quot;,&quot;stateful code memory&quot;,&quot;retrieval-augmented generation&quot;,&quot;closed-loop error correction&quot;,&quot;PaperBench&quot;,&quot;autonomous scientific reproduction&quot;],&quot;githubStars&quot;:12568},&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-12-08T11:07:13.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;DeepCode: Open Agentic Coding&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Recent advances in large language models (LLMs) have given rise to powerful coding agents, making it possible for code assistants to evolve into code engineers. However, existing methods still face significant challenges in achieving high-fidelity document-to-codebase synthesis--such as scientific papers to code--primarily due to a fundamental conflict between information overload and the context bottlenecks of LLMs. In this work, we introduce DeepCode, a fully autonomous framework that fundamentally addresses this challenge through principled information-flow management. By treating repository synthesis as a channel optimization problem, DeepCode seamlessly orchestrates four information operations to maximize task-relevant signals under finite context budgets: source compression via blueprint distillation, structured indexing using stateful code memory, conditional knowledge injection via retrieval-augmented generation, and closed-loop error correction. Extensive evaluations on the PaperBench benchmark demonstrate that DeepCode achieves state-of-the-art performance, decisively outperforming leading commercial agents such as Cursor and Claude Code, and crucially, surpassing PhD-level human experts from top institutes on key reproduction metrics. By systematically transforming paper specifications into production-grade implementations comparable to human expert quality, this work establishes new foundations for autonomous scientific reproduction that can accelerate research evaluation and discovery.&quot;,&quot;thumbnail&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-thumbnails.huggingface.co/social-thumbnails/papers/2512.07921.png&quot;,&quot;numComments&quot;:2,&quot;upvoted&quot;:false,&quot;submittedBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6039478ab3ecf716b1a5fd4d&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/6039478ab3ecf716b1a5fd4d/_Thy4E7taiSYBLKxEKJbT.jpeg&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;taesiri&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;taesiri&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:true,&quot;isHf&quot;:false,&quot;isHfAdmin&quot;:false,&quot;isMod&quot;:false,&quot;followerCount&quot;:185},&quot;isAuthorParticipating&quot;:false},{&quot;paper&quot;:{&quot;id&quot;:&quot;2407.04051&quot;,&quot;authors&quot;:[{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;668b611fa9ee6373c751c9b6&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Tongyi SpeechTeam&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false}],&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2024-07-04T16:49:02.000Z&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyAt&quot;:&quot;2024-07-08T02:16:49.947Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;FunAudioLLM: Voice Understanding and Generation Foundation Models for\n  Natural Interaction Between Humans and LLMs&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;60f1abe7544c2adfd699860c&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/1674929746905-60f1abe7544c2adfd699860c.jpeg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:true,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;AK&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;akhaliq&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;This report introduces FunAudioLLM, a model family designed to enhance\nnatural voice interactions between humans and large language models (LLMs). At\nits core are two innovative models: SenseVoice, which handles multilingual\nspeech recognition, emotion recognition, and audio event detection; and\nCosyVoice, which facilitates natural speech generation with control over\nmultiple languages, timbre, speaking style, and speaker identity.\nSenseVoice-Small delivers exceptionally low-latency ASR for 5 languages, and\nSenseVoice-Large supports high-precision ASR for over 50 languages, while\nCosyVoice excels in multi-lingual voice generation, zero-shot in-context\nlearning, cross-lingual voice cloning, and instruction-following capabilities.\nThe models related to SenseVoice and CosyVoice have been open-sourced on\nModelscope and Huggingface, along with the corresponding training, inference,\nand fine-tuning codes released on GitHub. By integrating these models with\nLLMs, FunAudioLLM enables applications such as speech-to-speech translation,\nemotional voice chat, interactive podcasts, and expressive audiobook narration,\nthereby pushing the boundaries of voice interaction technology. Demos are\navailable at https://fun-audio-llm.github.io, and the code can be accessed at\nhttps://github.com/FunAudioLLM.&quot;,&quot;upvotes&quot;:39,&quot;discussionId&quot;:&quot;668b6120a9ee6373c751c9eb&quot;,&quot;githubRepo&quot;:&quot;https://github.com/funaudiollm/cosyvoice&quot;,&quot;githubRepoAddedBy&quot;:&quot;auto&quot;,&quot;ai_summary&quot;:&quot;FunAudioLLM enhances voice interactions by integrating SenseVoice for multilingual speech recognition, emotion detection, and audio event detection with CosyVoice for natural speech generation across languages, timbres, and styles.&quot;,&quot;ai_keywords&quot;:[&quot;multi-lingual speech recognition&quot;,&quot;emotion recognition&quot;,&quot;audio event detection&quot;,&quot;natural speech generation&quot;,&quot;multi-lingual voice generation&quot;,&quot;zero-shot in-context learning&quot;,&quot;cross-lingual voice cloning&quot;,&quot;instruction-following capabilities&quot;,&quot;speech-to-speech translation&quot;,&quot;emotional voice chat&quot;,&quot;interactive podcasts&quot;,&quot;expressive audiobook narration&quot;],&quot;githubStars&quot;:17834},&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2024-07-04T12:49:02.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;FunAudioLLM: Voice Understanding and Generation Foundation Models for\n  Natural Interaction Between Humans and LLMs&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;This report introduces FunAudioLLM, a model family designed to enhance\nnatural voice interactions between humans and large language models (LLMs). At\nits core are two innovative models: SenseVoice, which handles multilingual\nspeech recognition, emotion recognition, and audio event detection; and\nCosyVoice, which facilitates natural speech generation with control over\nmultiple languages, timbre, speaking style, and speaker identity.\nSenseVoice-Small delivers exceptionally low-latency ASR for 5 languages, and\nSenseVoice-Large supports high-precision ASR for over 50 languages, while\nCosyVoice excels in multi-lingual voice generation, zero-shot in-context\nlearning, cross-lingual voice cloning, and instruction-following capabilities.\nThe models related to SenseVoice and CosyVoice have been open-sourced on\nModelscope and Huggingface, along with the corresponding training, inference,\nand fine-tuning codes released on GitHub. By integrating these models with\nLLMs, FunAudioLLM enables applications such as speech-to-speech translation,\nemotional voice chat, interactive podcasts, and expressive audiobook narration,\nthereby pushing the boundaries of voice interaction technology. Demos are\navailable at https://fun-audio-llm.github.io, and the code can be accessed at\nhttps://github.com/FunAudioLLM.&quot;,&quot;thumbnail&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-thumbnails.huggingface.co/social-thumbnails/papers/2407.04051.png&quot;,&quot;numComments&quot;:1,&quot;upvoted&quot;:false,&quot;submittedBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;60f1abe7544c2adfd699860c&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/1674929746905-60f1abe7544c2adfd699860c.jpeg&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;AK&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;akhaliq&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:true,&quot;isHf&quot;:true,&quot;isHfAdmin&quot;:false,&quot;isMod&quot;:false,&quot;followerCount&quot;:8928},&quot;isAuthorParticipating&quot;:false},{&quot;paper&quot;:{&quot;id&quot;:&quot;2511.22677&quot;,&quot;authors&quot;:[{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;692d12574397b1ec214f6850&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;646f1bef075e11ca78da3bb7&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/646f1bef075e11ca78da3bb7/gNS-ikyZXYeMrf4a7HTQE.jpeg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Dongyang Li&quot;,&quot;status&quot;:&quot;claimed_verified&quot;,&quot;statusLastChangedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-12-01T09:10:43.914Z&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;692d12574397b1ec214f6855&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;64379d79fac5ea753f1c10f3&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/64379d79fac5ea753f1c10f3/clfjIaMTVDTG9K04dRud_.png&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Jerry Wu&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;QJerry&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Qilong Wu&quot;,&quot;status&quot;:&quot;claimed_verified&quot;,&quot;statusLastChangedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-12-01T09:10:41.744Z&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;692d12574397b1ec214f6856&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6537e8eab01250d1d6efed3a&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/noauth/gMx73gwdfEhcCFioStGCE.jpeg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Xin&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;Srameo&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Xin Jin&quot;,&quot;status&quot;:&quot;claimed_verified&quot;,&quot;statusLastChangedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-12-01T09:10:39.946Z&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;692d12574397b1ec214f6857&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Sihan Cao&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;692d12574397b1ec214f6858&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Shifeng Zhang&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;692d12574397b1ec214f6859&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Hongsheng Li&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;692d12574397b1ec214f685a&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Steven Hoi&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false}],&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-11-27T18:24:28.000Z&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyAt&quot;:&quot;2025-12-01T01:29:35.579Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Decoupled DMD: CFG Augmentation as the Spear, Distribution Matching as the Shield&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;646f1bef075e11ca78da3bb7&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/646f1bef075e11ca78da3bb7/gNS-ikyZXYeMrf4a7HTQE.jpeg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Dongyang Liu (Chris Liu)&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;Cxxs&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Diffusion model distillation has emerged as a powerful technique for creating efficient few-step and single-step generators. Among these, Distribution Matching Distillation (DMD) and its variants stand out for their impressive performance, which is widely attributed to their core mechanism of matching the student's output distribution to that of a pre-trained teacher model. In this work, we challenge this conventional understanding. Through a rigorous decomposition of the DMD training objective, we reveal that in complex tasks like text-to-image generation, where CFG is typically required for desirable few-step performance, the primary driver of few-step distillation is not distribution matching, but a previously overlooked component we identify as CFG Augmentation (CA). We demonstrate that this term acts as the core ``engine'' of distillation, while the Distribution Matching (DM) term functions as a ``regularizer'' that ensures training stability and mitigates artifacts. We further validate this decoupling by demonstrating that while the DM term is a highly effective regularizer, it is not unique; simpler non-parametric constraints or GAN-based objectives can serve the same stabilizing function, albeit with different trade-offs. This decoupling of labor motivates a more principled analysis of the properties of both terms, leading to a more systematic and in-depth understanding. This new understanding further enables us to propose principled modifications to the distillation process, such as decoupling the noise schedules for the engine and the regularizer, leading to further performance gains. Notably, our method has been adopted by the Z-Image ( https://github.com/Tongyi-MAI/Z-Image ) project to develop a top-tier 8-step image generation model, empirically validating the generalization and robustness of our findings.&quot;,&quot;upvotes&quot;:27,&quot;discussionId&quot;:&quot;692d12574397b1ec214f685b&quot;,&quot;projectPage&quot;:&quot;https://tongyi-mai.github.io/Z-Image-blog/&quot;,&quot;githubRepo&quot;:&quot;https://github.com/Tongyi-MAI/Z-Image/tree/main&quot;,&quot;githubRepoAddedBy&quot;:&quot;user&quot;,&quot;ai_summary&quot;:&quot;The study reveals that in text-to-image generation, CFG Augmentation is the primary driver of few-step distillation in Distribution Matching Distillation (DMD), while the distribution matching term acts as a regularizer.&quot;,&quot;ai_keywords&quot;:[&quot;diffusion model distillation&quot;,&quot;Distribution Matching Distillation (DMD)&quot;,&quot;CFG Augmentation (CA)&quot;,&quot;text-to-image generation&quot;,&quot;configuration (CFG)&quot;,&quot;distribution matching&quot;,&quot;noise schedules&quot;,&quot;Z-Image&quot;],&quot;githubStars&quot;:7099,&quot;organization&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6925b20fed452d1567c012d3&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Tongyi-MAI&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Tongyi-MAI&quot;,&quot;avatar&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/64379d79fac5ea753f1c10f3/fxHO6QoYjdv9_LTyiUD3g.jpeg&quot;}},&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-11-27T13:24:28.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Decoupled DMD: CFG Augmentation as the Spear, Distribution Matching as the Shield&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Diffusion model distillation has emerged as a powerful technique for creating efficient few-step and single-step generators. Among these, Distribution Matching Distillation (DMD) and its variants stand out for their impressive performance, which is widely attributed to their core mechanism of matching the student's output distribution to that of a pre-trained teacher model. In this work, we challenge this conventional understanding. Through a rigorous decomposition of the DMD training objective, we reveal that in complex tasks like text-to-image generation, where CFG is typically required for desirable few-step performance, the primary driver of few-step distillation is not distribution matching, but a previously overlooked component we identify as CFG Augmentation (CA). We demonstrate that this term acts as the core ``engine'' of distillation, while the Distribution Matching (DM) term functions as a ``regularizer'' that ensures training stability and mitigates artifacts. We further validate this decoupling by demonstrating that while the DM term is a highly effective regularizer, it is not unique; simpler non-parametric constraints or GAN-based objectives can serve the same stabilizing function, albeit with different trade-offs. This decoupling of labor motivates a more principled analysis of the properties of both terms, leading to a more systematic and in-depth understanding. This new understanding further enables us to propose principled modifications to the distillation process, such as decoupling the noise schedules for the engine and the regularizer, leading to further performance gains. Notably, our method has been adopted by the Z-Image ( https://github.com/Tongyi-MAI/Z-Image ) project to develop a top-tier 8-step image generation model, empirically validating the generalization and robustness of our findings.&quot;,&quot;thumbnail&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-thumbnails.huggingface.co/social-thumbnails/papers/2511.22677.png&quot;,&quot;numComments&quot;:2,&quot;upvoted&quot;:false,&quot;submittedBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;646f1bef075e11ca78da3bb7&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/646f1bef075e11ca78da3bb7/gNS-ikyZXYeMrf4a7HTQE.jpeg&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Dongyang Liu (Chris Liu)&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Cxxs&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;isHf&quot;:false,&quot;isHfAdmin&quot;:false,&quot;isMod&quot;:false,&quot;followerCount&quot;:16},&quot;organization&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6925b20fed452d1567c012d3&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Tongyi-MAI&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Tongyi-MAI&quot;,&quot;avatar&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/64379d79fac5ea753f1c10f3/fxHO6QoYjdv9_LTyiUD3g.jpeg&quot;},&quot;isAuthorParticipating&quot;:true},{&quot;paper&quot;:{&quot;id&quot;:&quot;2511.22699&quot;,&quot;authors&quot;:[{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;692d06234397b1ec214f6788&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Z-Image Gao&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;692d06234397b1ec214f678d&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Steven Yu&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;692d06234397b1ec214f679a&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6440b7c47bc3fbde138a1409&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;/avatars/d43ef8457f732c5e1753f96056b8ea8b.svg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;zhang&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;Nurburgring&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Chi Zhang&quot;,&quot;status&quot;:&quot;claimed_verified&quot;,&quot;statusLastChangedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-12-08T19:38:46.590Z&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;692d06234397b1ec214f679b&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Shifeng Zhang&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;692d06234397b1ec214f679c&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;641988978e0baaeed5a066c6&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/641988978e0baaeed5a066c6/TdCjJ63gw5gdX1RqTvy9a.png&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Shilin&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;zsLin&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Shilin Zhou&quot;,&quot;status&quot;:&quot;claimed_verified&quot;,&quot;statusLastChangedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-12-01T16:24:44.624Z&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false}],&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-11-27T18:52:07.000Z&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyAt&quot;:&quot;2025-12-01T00:38:17.269Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Z-Image: An Efficient Image Generation Foundation Model with Single-Stream Diffusion Transformer&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6285a9133ab6642179158944&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;/avatars/6e10fa07c94141fcdbe0cab02bb731ca.svg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Zhen Li&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;Paper99&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;The landscape of high-performance image generation models is currently dominated by proprietary systems, such as Nano Banana Pro and Seedream 4.0. Leading open-source alternatives, including Qwen-Image, Hunyuan-Image-3.0 and FLUX.2, are characterized by massive parameter counts (20B to 80B), making them impractical for inference, and fine-tuning on consumer-grade hardware. To address this gap, we propose Z-Image, an efficient 6B-parameter foundation generative model built upon a Scalable Single-Stream Diffusion Transformer (S3-DiT) architecture that challenges the \&quot;scale-at-all-costs\&quot; paradigm. By systematically optimizing the entire model lifecycle -- from a curated data infrastructure to a streamlined training curriculum -- we complete the full training workflow in just 314K H800 GPU hours (approx. $630K). Our few-step distillation scheme with reward post-training further yields Z-Image-Turbo, offering both sub-second inference latency on an enterprise-grade H800 GPU and compatibility with consumer-grade hardware (<16GB VRAM). Additionally, our omni-pre-training paradigm also enables efficient training of Z-Image-Edit, an editing model with impressive instruction-following capabilities. Both qualitative and quantitative experiments demonstrate that our model achieves performance comparable to or surpassing that of leading competitors across various dimensions. Most notably, Z-Image exhibits exceptional capabilities in photorealistic image generation and bilingual text rendering, delivering results that rival top-tier commercial models, thereby demonstrating that state-of-the-art results are achievable with significantly reduced computational overhead. We publicly release our code, weights, and online demo to foster the development of accessible, budget-friendly, yet state-of-the-art generative models.&quot;,&quot;upvotes&quot;:199,&quot;discussionId&quot;:&quot;692d06234397b1ec214f679d&quot;,&quot;projectPage&quot;:&quot;https://tongyi-mai.github.io/Z-Image-blog/&quot;,&quot;githubRepo&quot;:&quot;https://github.com/Tongyi-MAI/Z-Image&quot;,&quot;githubRepoAddedBy&quot;:&quot;user&quot;,&quot;ai_summary&quot;:&quot;Z-Image, a 6B-parameter Scalable Single-Stream Diffusion Transformer (S3-DiT) model, achieves high-performance image generation with reduced computational cost, offering sub-second inference and compatibility with consumer hardware.&quot;,&quot;ai_keywords&quot;:[&quot;Scalable Single-Stream Diffusion Transformer&quot;,&quot;S3-DiT&quot;,&quot;diffusion transformer&quot;,&quot;omni-pre-training&quot;,&quot;instruction-following capabilities&quot;,&quot;photorealistic image generation&quot;,&quot;bilingual text rendering&quot;,&quot;distillation scheme&quot;,&quot;reward post-training&quot;,&quot;H800 GPU&quot;,&quot;VRAM&quot;],&quot;githubStars&quot;:7089,&quot;organization&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6925b20fed452d1567c012d3&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Tongyi-MAI&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Tongyi-MAI&quot;,&quot;avatar&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/64379d79fac5ea753f1c10f3/fxHO6QoYjdv9_LTyiUD3g.jpeg&quot;}},&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-11-27T13:52:07.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Z-Image: An Efficient Image Generation Foundation Model with Single-Stream Diffusion Transformer&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;The landscape of high-performance image generation models is currently dominated by proprietary systems, such as Nano Banana Pro and Seedream 4.0. Leading open-source alternatives, including Qwen-Image, Hunyuan-Image-3.0 and FLUX.2, are characterized by massive parameter counts (20B to 80B), making them impractical for inference, and fine-tuning on consumer-grade hardware. To address this gap, we propose Z-Image, an efficient 6B-parameter foundation generative model built upon a Scalable Single-Stream Diffusion Transformer (S3-DiT) architecture that challenges the \&quot;scale-at-all-costs\&quot; paradigm. By systematically optimizing the entire model lifecycle -- from a curated data infrastructure to a streamlined training curriculum -- we complete the full training workflow in just 314K H800 GPU hours (approx. $630K). Our few-step distillation scheme with reward post-training further yields Z-Image-Turbo, offering both sub-second inference latency on an enterprise-grade H800 GPU and compatibility with consumer-grade hardware (<16GB VRAM). Additionally, our omni-pre-training paradigm also enables efficient training of Z-Image-Edit, an editing model with impressive instruction-following capabilities. Both qualitative and quantitative experiments demonstrate that our model achieves performance comparable to or surpassing that of leading competitors across various dimensions. Most notably, Z-Image exhibits exceptional capabilities in photorealistic image generation and bilingual text rendering, delivering results that rival top-tier commercial models, thereby demonstrating that state-of-the-art results are achievable with significantly reduced computational overhead. We publicly release our code, weights, and online demo to foster the development of accessible, budget-friendly, yet state-of-the-art generative models.&quot;,&quot;thumbnail&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-thumbnails.huggingface.co/social-thumbnails/papers/2511.22699.png&quot;,&quot;numComments&quot;:4,&quot;upvoted&quot;:false,&quot;submittedBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6285a9133ab6642179158944&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;/avatars/6e10fa07c94141fcdbe0cab02bb731ca.svg&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Zhen Sheng&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;ying1123&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Ying Zheng&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;650114d996ec8a5218886626&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;64763d68288784ce9aba1cc7&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;/avatars/84033af4466f5469c6264e7bff9f6819.svg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Cody E. Gonzalez&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;ProfJoeyG&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Joseph E. Gonzalez&quot;,&quot;status&quot;:&quot;admin_assigned&quot;,&quot;statusLastChangedAt&quot;:&quot;2023-09-13T07:30:30.707Z&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;650114d996ec8a5218886628&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;62d363143eebd640a4fa41fa&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/62d363143eebd640a4fa41fa/pvPwXlJ5OOb-UIfmffv4E.jpeg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Hao Zhang&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;zhisbug&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Hao Zhang&quot;,&quot;status&quot;:&quot;claimed_verified&quot;,&quot;statusLastChangedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-01-01T20:15:04.984Z&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;650114d996ec8a5218886629&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Ion Stoica&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false}],&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2023-09-12T12:50:04.000Z&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyAt&quot;:&quot;2023-09-13T00:18:09.776Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Efficient Memory Management for Large Language Model Serving with\n  PagedAttention&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;60f1abe7544c2adfd699860c&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/1674929746905-60f1abe7544c2adfd699860c.jpeg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:true,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;AK&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;akhaliq&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;High throughput serving of large language models (LLMs) requires batching\nsufficiently many requests at a time. However, existing systems struggle\nbecause the key-value cache (KV cache) memory for each request is huge and\ngrows and shrinks dynamically. When managed inefficiently, this memory can be\nsignificantly wasted by fragmentation and redundant duplication, limiting the\nbatch size. To address this problem, we propose PagedAttention, an attention\nalgorithm inspired by the classical virtual memory and paging techniques in\noperating systems. On top of it, we build vLLM, an LLM serving system that\nachieves (1) near-zero waste in KV cache memory and (2) flexible sharing of KV\ncache within and across requests to further reduce memory usage. Our\nevaluations show that vLLM improves the throughput of popular LLMs by\n2-4times with the same level of latency compared to the state-of-the-art\nsystems, such as FasterTransformer and Orca. The improvement is more pronounced\nwith longer sequences, larger models, and more complex decoding algorithms.\nvLLM's source code is publicly available at\nhttps://github.com/vllm-project/vllm&quot;,&quot;upvotes&quot;:25,&quot;discussionId&quot;:&quot;650114d996ec8a5218886638&quot;,&quot;githubRepo&quot;:&quot;https://github.com/vllm-project/vllm&quot;,&quot;githubRepoAddedBy&quot;:&quot;auto&quot;,&quot;ai_summary&quot;:&quot;PagedAttention algorithm and vLLM system enhance the throughput of large language models by efficiently managing memory and reducing waste in the key-value cache.&quot;,&quot;ai_keywords&quot;:[&quot;PagedAttention&quot;,&quot;key-value cache&quot;,&quot;KV cache&quot;,&quot;vLLM&quot;,&quot;virtual memory&quot;,&quot;paging techniques&quot;,&quot;attention algorithm&quot;,&quot;memory management&quot;,&quot;throughput improvement&quot;,&quot;FasterTransformer&quot;,&quot;Orca&quot;],&quot;githubStars&quot;:65529},&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2023-09-12T08:50:04.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Efficient Memory Management for Large Language Model Serving with\n  PagedAttention&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;High throughput serving of large language models (LLMs) requires batching\nsufficiently many requests at a time. However, existing systems struggle\nbecause the key-value cache (KV cache) memory for each request is huge and\ngrows and shrinks dynamically. When managed inefficiently, this memory can be\nsignificantly wasted by fragmentation and redundant duplication, limiting the\nbatch size. To address this problem, we propose PagedAttention, an attention\nalgorithm inspired by the classical virtual memory and paging techniques in\noperating systems. On top of it, we build vLLM, an LLM serving system that\nachieves (1) near-zero waste in KV cache memory and (2) flexible sharing of KV\ncache within and across requests to further reduce memory usage. Our\nevaluations show that vLLM improves the throughput of popular LLMs by\n2-4times with the same level of latency compared to the state-of-the-art\nsystems, such as FasterTransformer and Orca. The improvement is more pronounced\nwith longer sequences, larger models, and more complex decoding algorithms.\nvLLM's source code is publicly available at\nhttps://github.com/vllm-project/vllm&quot;,&quot;thumbnail&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-thumbnails.huggingface.co/social-thumbnails/papers/2309.06180.png&quot;,&quot;numComments&quot;:1,&quot;upvoted&quot;:false,&quot;submittedBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;60f1abe7544c2adfd699860c&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/1674929746905-60f1abe7544c2adfd699860c.jpeg&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;AK&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;akhaliq&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:true,&quot;isHf&quot;:true,&quot;isHfAdmin&quot;:false,&quot;isMod&quot;:false,&quot;followerCount&quot;:8928},&quot;isAuthorParticipating&quot;:false},{&quot;paper&quot;:{&quot;id&quot;:&quot;2503.11576&quot;,&quot;authors&quot;:[{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;67d7d1c38a15934c10b1576d&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;63c64fdd77caf00391006211&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/1673940984052-63c64fdd77caf00391006211.jpeg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:true,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Ahmed Nassar&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;asnassar&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Ahmed Nassar&quot;,&quot;status&quot;:&quot;claimed_verified&quot;,&quot;statusLastChangedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-03-18T08:09:03.445Z&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;67d7d1c38a15934c10b1576e&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;65d66b494bbd0d92b641cdbb&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/65d66b494bbd0d92b641cdbb/6-7dm7B-JxcoS1QlCPdMN.jpeg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Andres Our model comprehensively processes entire\npages by generating DocTags, a new universal markup format that captures all\npage elements in their full context with location. Unlike existing approaches\nthat rely on large foundational models, or ensemble solutions that rely on\nhandcrafted pipelines of multiple specialized models, SmolDocling offers an\nend-to-end conversion for accurately capturing content, structure and spatial\nlocation of document elements in a 256M parameters vision-language model.\nSmolDocling exhibits robust performance in correctly reproducing document\nfeatures such as code listings, tables, equations, charts, lists, and more\nacross a diverse range of document types including business documents, academic\npapers, technical reports, patents, and forms -- significantly extending beyond\nthe commonly observed focus on scientific papers. Additionally, we contribute\nnovel publicly sourced datasets for charts, tables, equations, and code\nrecognition. Experimental results demonstrate that SmolDocling competes with\nother Vision Language Models that are up to 27 times larger in size, while\nreducing computational requirements substantially. The model is currently\navailable, datasets will be publicly available soon.&quot;,&quot;upvotes&quot;:117,&quot;discussionId&quot;:&quot;67d7d1c68a15934c10b15841&quot;,&quot;projectPage&quot;:&quot;https://huggingface.co/ds4sd/SmolDocling-256M-preview&quot;,&quot;githubRepo&quot;:&quot;https://github.com/docling-project/docling&quot;,&quot;githubRepoAddedBy&quot;:&quot;auto&quot;,&quot;ai_summary&quot;:&quot;SmolDocling is a compact vision-language model that performs end-to-end document conversion with robust performance across various document types using 256M parameters and a new markup format.&quot;,&quot;ai_keywords&quot;:[&quot;vision-language model&quot;,&quot;DocTags&quot;,&quot;end-to-end document conversion&quot;,&quot;universal markup format&quot;,&quot;page elements&quot;,&quot;location context&quot;,&quot;large foundational models&quot;,&quot;ensemble solutions&quot;,&quot;specialized models&quot;,&quot;code listings&quot;,&quot;tables&quot;,&quot;equations&quot;,&quot;charts&quot;,&quot;lists&quot;,&quot;diverse document types&quot;,&quot;publicly sourced datasets&quot;,&quot;Vision Language Models&quot;,&quot;computational requirements&quot;],&quot;githubStars&quot;:46888},&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-03-14T12:44:14.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;SmolDocling: An ultra-compact vision-language model for end-to-end\n  multi-modal document conversion&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;We introduce SmolDocling, an ultra-compact vision-language model targeting\nend-to-end document conversion. Our model comprehensively processes entire\npages by generating DocTags, a new universal markup format that captures all\npage elements in their full context with location. Unlike existing approaches\nthat rely on large foundational models, or ensemble solutions that rely on\nhandcrafted pipelines of multiple specialized models, SmolDocling offers an\nend-to-end conversion for accurately capturing content, structure and spatial\nlocation of document elements in a 256M parameters vision-language model.\nSmolDocling exhibits robust performance in correctly reproducing document\nfeatures such as code listings, tables, equations, charts, lists, and more\nacross a diverse range of document types including business documents, academic\npapers, technical reports, patents, and forms -- significantly extending beyond\nthe commonly observed focus on scientific papers. Additionally, we contribute\nnovel publicly sourced datasets for charts, tables, equations, and code\nrecognition. Experimental results demonstrate that SmolDocling competes with\nother Vision Language Models that are up to 27 times larger in size, while\nreducing computational requirements substantially. The model is currently\navailable, datasets will be publicly available soon.&quot;,&quot;thumbnail&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-thumbnails.huggingface.co/social-thumbnails/papers/2503.11576.png&quot;,&quot;numComments&quot;:18,&quot;upvoted&quot;:false,&quot;submittedBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;65d66b494bbd0d92b641cdbb&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/65d66b494bbd0d92b641cdbb/6-7dm7B-JxcoS1QlCPdMN.jpeg&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Andres Taymanov&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;69266fb9243b2216fb75ca85&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Vibhav Vineet&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;69266fb9243b2216fb75ca86&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Spencer Whitehead&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;69266fb9243b2216fb75ca87&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Andrew Zhao&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false}],&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-11-24T19:56:28.000Z&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyAt&quot;:&quot;2025-11-26T00:41:03.809Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Fara-7B: An Efficient Agentic Model for Computer Use&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6039478ab3ecf716b1a5fd4d&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/6039478ab3ecf716b1a5fd4d/_Thy4E7taiSYBLKxEKJbT.jpeg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:true,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;taesiri&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;taesiri&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Progress in computer use agents (CUAs) has been constrained by the absence of large and high-quality datasets that capture how humans interact with a computer. While LLMs have thrived on abundant textual data, no comparable corpus exists for CUA trajectories. To address these gaps, we introduce FaraGen, a novel synthetic data generation system for multi-step web tasks. FaraGen can propose diverse tasks from frequently used websites, generate multiple solution attempts, and filter successful trajectories using multiple verifiers. It achieves high throughput, yield, and diversity for multi-step web tasks, producing verified trajectories at approximately $1 each. We use this data to train Fara-7B, a native CUA model that perceives the computer using only screenshots, executes actions via predicted coordinates, and is small enough to run on-device. We find that Fara-7B outperforms other CUA models of comparable size on benchmarks like WebVoyager, Online-Mind2Web, and WebTailBench -- our novel benchmark that better captures under-represented web tasks in pre-existing benchmarks. Furthermore, Fara-7B is competitive with much larger frontier models, illustrating key benefits of scalable data generation systems in advancing small efficient agentic models. We are making Fara-7B open-weight on Microsoft Foundry and HuggingFace, and we are releasing WebTailBench.&quot;,&quot;upvotes&quot;:12,&quot;discussionId&quot;:&quot;69266fb9243b2216fb75ca88&quot;,&quot;projectPage&quot;:&quot;https://aka.ms/msaif/fara&quot;,&quot;githubRepo&quot;:&quot;https://github.com/microsoft/fara&quot;,&quot;githubRepoAddedBy&quot;:&quot;auto&quot;,&quot;ai_summary&quot;:&quot;FaraGen creates synthetic datasets for computer use agents, enabling the training of efficient and high-performing models like Fara-7B on diverse web tasks, outperforming larger models on benchmarks.&quot;,&quot;ai_keywords&quot;:[&quot;FaraGen&quot;,&quot;synthetic data generation&quot;,&quot;multi-step web tasks&quot;,&quot;CUA trajectories&quot;,&quot;verifiers&quot;,&quot;Fara-7B&quot;,&quot;on-device model&quot;,&quot;native CUA model&quot;,&quot;screenshots&quot;,&quot;predicted coordinates&quot;,&quot;WebVoyager&quot;,&quot;Online-Mind2Web&quot;,&quot;WebTailBench&quot;],&quot;githubStars&quot;:3187,&quot;organization&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;5e6485f787403103f9f1055e&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;microsoft&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Microsoft&quot;,&quot;avatar&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/1583646260758-5e64858c87403103f9f1055d.png&quot;}},&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-11-24T14:56:28.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Fara-7B: An Efficient Agentic Model for Computer Use&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Progress in computer use agents (CUAs) has been constrained by the absence of large and high-quality datasets that capture how humans interact with a computer. While LLMs have thrived on abundant textual data, no comparable corpus exists for CUA trajectories. To address these gaps, we introduce FaraGen, a novel synthetic data generation system for multi-step web tasks. FaraGen can propose diverse tasks from frequently used websites, generate multiple solution attempts, and filter successful trajectories using multiple verifiers. It achieves high throughput, yield, and diversity for multi-step web tasks, producing verified trajectories at approximately $1 each. We use this data to train Fara-7B, a native CUA model that perceives the computer using only screenshots, executes actions via predicted coordinates, and is small enough to run on-device. We find that Fara-7B outperforms other CUA models of comparable size on benchmarks like WebVoyager, Online-Mind2Web, and WebTailBench -- our novel benchmark that better captures under-represented web tasks in pre-existing benchmarks. Furthermore, Fara-7B is competitive with much larger frontier models, illustrating key benefits of scalable data generation systems in advancing small efficient agentic models. We are making Fara-7B open-weight on Microsoft Foundry and HuggingFace, and we are releasing WebTailBench.&quot;,&quot;thumbnail&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-thumbnails.huggingface.co/social-thumbnails/papers/2511.19663.png&quot;,&quot;numComments&quot;:2,&quot;upvoted&quot;:false,&quot;submittedBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6039478ab3ecf716b1a5fd4d&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/6039478ab3ecf716b1a5fd4d/_Thy4E7taiSYBLKxEKJbT.jpeg&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;taesiri&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;taesiri&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:true,&quot;isHf&quot;:false,&quot;isHfAdmin&quot;:false,&quot;isMod&quot;:false,&quot;followerCount&quot;:185},&quot;organization&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;5e6485f787403103f9f1055e&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;microsoft&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Microsoft&quot;,&quot;avatar&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/1583646260758-5e64858c87403103f9f1055d.png&quot;},&quot;isAuthorParticipating&quot;:false},{&quot;paper&quot;:{&quot;id&quot;:&quot;2510.23856&quot;,&quot;authors&quot;:[{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6940ceda65f1e24a11780382&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Segev Shlomov&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6940ceda65f1e24a11780383&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Alon Marreed&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6940ceda65f1e24a11780385&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Ido Levy&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6940ceda65f1e24a11780386&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Offer Strk&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6940ceda65f1e24a11780389&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Elizabeth Koumpan&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6940ceda65f1e24a1178038a&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Yinon Goldshtein&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6940ceda65f1e24a1178038b&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Eilam Shapira&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6940ceda65f1e24a1178038c&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Nir Mashkif&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6940ceda65f1e24a1178038d&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Asaf Adi&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false}],&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-10-27T20:55:00.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;From Benchmarks to Business Impact: Deploying IBM Generalist Agent in Enterprise Production&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Agents are rapidly advancing in automating digital work, but enterprises face a harder challenge: moving beyond prototypes to deployed systems that deliver measurable business value. This path is complicated by fragmented frameworks, slow development, and the absence of standardized evaluation practices. Generalist agents have emerged as a promising direction, excelling on academic benchmarks and offering flexibility across task types, applications, and modalities. Yet, evidence of their use in production enterprise settings remains limited. This paper reports IBM's experience developing and piloting the Computer Using Generalist Agent (CUGA), which has been open-sourced for the community (https://github.com/cuga-project/cuga-agent). CUGA adopts a hierarchical planner--executor architecture with strong analytical foundations, achieving state-of-the-art performance on AppWorld and WebArena. Beyond benchmarks, it was evaluated in a pilot within the Business-Process-Outsourcing talent acquisition domain, addressing enterprise requirements for scalability, auditability, safety, and governance. To support assessment, we introduce BPO-TA, a 26-task benchmark spanning 13 analytics endpoints. In preliminary evaluations, CUGA approached the accuracy of specialized agents while indicating potential for reducing development time and cost. Our contribution is twofold: presenting early evidence of generalist agents operating at enterprise scale, and distilling technical and organizational lessons from this initial pilot. We outline requirements and next steps for advancing research-grade architectures like CUGA into robust, enterprise-ready systems.&quot;,&quot;upvotes&quot;:0,&quot;discussionId&quot;:&quot;6940cedb65f1e24a1178038e&quot;,&quot;githubRepo&quot;:&quot;https://github.com/cuga-project/cuga-agent&quot;,&quot;githubRepoAddedBy&quot;:&quot;auto&quot;,&quot;ai_summary&quot;:&quot;IBM's CUGA, a generalist agent with a hierarchical planner-executor architecture, demonstrates state-of-the-art performance in academic benchmarks and shows potential for enterprise adoption in business-process-outsourcing, addressing scalability, auditability, safety, and governance.&quot;,&quot;ai_keywords&quot;:[&quot;generalist agents&quot;,&quot;hierarchical planner-executor architecture&quot;,&quot;AppWorld&quot;,&quot;WebArena&quot;,&quot;BPO-TA&quot;,&quot;specialized agents&quot;,&quot;enterprise requirements&quot;,&quot;scalability&quot;,&quot;auditability&quot;,&quot;safety&quot;,&quot;governance&quot;],&quot;githubStars&quot;:337},&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-10-27T16:55:00.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;From Benchmarks to Business Impact: Deploying IBM Generalist Agent in Enterprise Production&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Agents are rapidly advancing in automating digital work, but enterprises face a harder challenge: moving beyond prototypes to deployed systems that deliver measurable business value. This path is complicated by fragmented frameworks, slow development, and the absence of standardized evaluation practices. Generalist agents have emerged as a promising direction, excelling on academic benchmarks and offering flexibility across task types, applications, and modalities. Yet, evidence of their use in production enterprise settings remains limited. This paper reports IBM's experience developing and piloting the Computer Using Generalist Agent (CUGA), which has been open-sourced for the community (https://github.com/cuga-project/cuga-agent). CUGA adopts a hierarchical planner--executor architecture with strong analytical foundations, achieving state-of-the-art performance on AppWorld and WebArena. Beyond benchmarks, it was evaluated in a pilot within the Business-Process-Outsourcing talent acquisition domain, addressing enterprise requirements for scalability, auditability, safety, and governance. To support assessment, we introduce BPO-TA, a 26-task benchmark spanning 13 analytics endpoints. In preliminary evaluations, CUGA approached the accuracy of specialized agents while indicating potential for reducing development time and cost. Our contribution is twofold: presenting early evidence of generalist agents operating at enterprise scale, and distilling technical and organizational lessons from this initial pilot. We outline requirements and next steps for advancing research-grade architectures like CUGA into robust, enterprise-ready systems.&quot;,&quot;thumbnail&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-thumbnails.huggingface.co/social-thumbnails/papers/2510.23856.png&quot;,&quot;numComments&quot;:0,&quot;upvoted&quot;:false,&quot;isAuthorParticipating&quot;:false},{&quot;paper&quot;:{&quot;id&quot;:&quot;2507.03009&quot;,&quot;authors&quot;:[{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6940caa065f1e24a1177fbed&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Rongxin Ouyang&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6940caa065f1e24a1177fbee&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Chang Chu&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6940caa065f1e24a1177fbef&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Zhikuang Xin&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6940caa065f1e24a1177fbf0&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Xiangyao Ma&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false}],&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-07-02T10:22:05.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;PDFMathTranslate: Scientific Document Translation Preserving Layouts&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Language barriers in scientific documents hinder the diffusion and development of science and technologies. However, prior efforts in translating such documents largely overlooked the information in layouts. To bridge the gap, we introduce PDFMathTranslate, the world's first open-source software for translating scientific documents while preserving layouts. Leveraging the most recent advances in large language models and precise layout detection, we contribute to the community with key improvements in precision, flexibility, and efficiency. The work has been open-sourced at https://github.com/byaidu/pdfmathtranslate with more than 222k downloads.&quot;,&quot;upvotes&quot;:0,&quot;discussionId&quot;:&quot;6940caa165f1e24a1177fbf1&quot;,&quot;githubRepo&quot;:&quot;https://github.com/byaidu/pdfmathtranslate&quot;,&quot;githubRepoAddedBy&quot;:&quot;auto&quot;,&quot;ai_summary&quot;:&quot;PDFMathTranslate is an open-source software that translates scientific documents while maintaining layout integrity, utilizing advancements in large language models and layout detection.&quot;,&quot;ai_keywords&quot;:[&quot;large language models&quot;,&quot;layout detection&quot;,&quot;PDFMathTranslate&quot;],&quot;githubStars&quot;:30608},&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-07-02T06:22:05.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;PDFMathTranslate: Scientific Document Translation Preserving Layouts&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Language barriers in scientific documents hinder the diffusion and development of science and technologies. Leveraging the most recent advances in large language models and precise layout detection, we contribute to the community with key improvements in precision, flexibility, and efficiency. The work has been open-sourced at https://github.com/byaidu/pdfmathtranslate with more than 222k downloads.&quot;,&quot;thumbnail&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-thumbnails.huggingface.co/social-thumbnails/papers/2507.03009.png&quot;,&quot;numComments&quot;:0,&quot;upvoted&quot;:false,&quot;isAuthorParticipating&quot;:false},{&quot;paper&quot;:{&quot;id&quot;:&quot;2512.11799&quot;,&quot;authors&quot;:[{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;693f741df516c693246811ad&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Ye Wang&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false}],&quot;mediaUrls&quot;:[&quot;https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/6039478ab3ecf716b1a5fd4d/IKbwcaT_GNej00AHtNUA1.mp4&quot;],&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-12-12T18:59:54.000Z&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyAt&quot;:&quot;2025-12-15T00:06:37.373Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;V-RGBX: Video Editing with Accurate Controls over Intrinsic Properties&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6039478ab3ecf716b1a5fd4d&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/6039478ab3ecf716b1a5fd4d/_Thy4E7taiSYBLKxEKJbT.jpeg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:true,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;taesiri&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;taesiri&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Large-scale video generation models have shown remarkable potential in modeling photorealistic appearance and lighting interactions in real-world scenes. However, a closed-loop framework that jointly understands intrinsic scene properties (e.g., albedo, normal, material, and irradiance), leverages them for video synthesis, and supports editable intrinsic representations remains unexplored. We present V-RGBX, the first end-to-end framework for intrinsic-aware video editing. V-RGBX unifies three key capabilities: (1) video inverse rendering into intrinsic channels, (2) photorealistic video synthesis from these intrinsic representations, and (3) keyframe-based video editing conditioned on intrinsic channels. At the core of V-RGBX is an interleaved conditioning mechanism that enables intuitive, physically grounded video editing through user-selected keyframes, supporting flexible manipulation of any intrinsic modality. Extensive qualitative and quantitative results show that V-RGBX produces temporally consistent, photorealistic videos while propagating keyframe edits across sequences in a physically plausible manner. We demonstrate its effectiveness in diverse applications, including object appearance editing and scene-level relighting, surpassing the performance of prior methods.&quot;,&quot;upvotes&quot;:28,&quot;discussionId&quot;:&quot;693f741ef516c693246811b6&quot;,&quot;projectPage&quot;:&quot;https://aleafy.github.io/vrgbx/&quot;,&quot;githubRepo&quot;:&quot;https://github.com/Aleafy/V-RGBX&quot;,&quot;githubRepoAddedBy&quot;:&quot;user&quot;,&quot;ai_summary&quot;:&quot;V-RGBX is an end-to-end framework for intrinsic-aware video editing that combines video inverse rendering, photorealistic synthesis, and keyframe-based editing to produce consistent and physically plausible edits.&quot;,&quot;ai_keywords&quot;:[&quot;video inverse rendering&quot;,&quot;intrinsic channels&quot;,&quot;photorealistic video synthesis&quot;,&quot;keyframe-based video editing&quot;,&quot;interleaved conditioning mechanism&quot;,&quot;object appearance editing&quot;,&quot;scene-level relighting&quot;],&quot;githubStars&quot;:45,&quot;organization&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;61e5d14f77496de0a6d95c6b&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;adobe&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Adobe&quot;,&quot;avatar&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/1645217431826-61e35e517ac6b6d06cfa8081.png&quot;}},&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-12-12T13:59:54.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;V-RGBX: Video Editing with Accurate Controls over Intrinsic Properties&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Large-scale video generation models have shown remarkable potential in modeling photorealistic appearance and lighting interactions in real-world scenes. However, a closed-loop framework that jointly understands intrinsic scene properties (e.g., albedo, normal, material, and irradiance), leverages them for video synthesis, and supports editable intrinsic representations remains unexplored. We present V-RGBX, the first end-to-end framework for intrinsic-aware video editing. V-RGBX unifies three key capabilities: (1) video inverse rendering into intrinsic channels, (2) photorealistic video synthesis from these intrinsic representations, and (3) keyframe-based video editing conditioned on intrinsic channels. At the core of V-RGBX is an interleaved conditioning mechanism that enables intuitive, physically grounded video editing through user-selected keyframes, supporting flexible manipulation of any intrinsic modality. Extensive qualitative and quantitative results show that V-RGBX produces temporally consistent, photorealistic videos while propagating keyframe edits across sequences in a physically plausible manner. We demonstrate its effectiveness in diverse applications, including object appearance editing and scene-level relighting, surpassing the performance of prior methods.&quot;,&quot;mediaUrls&quot;:[&quot;https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/6039478ab3ecf716b1a5fd4d/IKbwcaT_GNej00AHtNUA1.mp4&quot;],&quot;thumbnail&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-thumbnails.huggingface.co/social-thumbnails/papers/2512.11799.png&quot;,&quot;numComments&quot;:2,&quot;upvoted&quot;:false,&quot;submittedBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6039478ab3ecf716b1a5fd4d&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/6039478ab3ecf716b1a5fd4d/_Thy4E7taiSYBLKxEKJbT.jpeg&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;taesiri&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;taesiri&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:true,&quot;isHf&quot;:false,&quot;isHfAdmin&quot;:false,&quot;isMod&quot;:false,&quot;followerCount&quot;:185},&quot;organization&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;61e5d14f77496de0a6d95c6b&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;adobe&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Adobe&quot;,&quot;avatar&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/1645217431826-61e35e517ac6b6d06cfa8081.png&quot;},&quot;isAuthorParticipating&quot;:false},{&quot;paper&quot;:{&quot;id&quot;:&quot;2511.16719&quot;,&quot;authors&quot;:[{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6923c54bb5612535ed9558c9&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6253c57927a8414d3bbe6d50&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;/avatars/9d7cb38db7831a05e35c157a71f5be4a.svg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Nicolas
