3: Segment Anything with Concepts&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6039478ab3ecf716b1a5fd4d&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/6039478ab3ecf716b1a5fd4d/_Thy4E7taiSYBLKxEKJbT.jpeg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:true,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;taesiri&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;taesiri&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;We present Segment Anything Model (SAM) 3, a unified model that detects, segments, and tracks objects in images and videos based on concept prompts, which we define as either short noun phrases (e.g., \&quot;yellow school bus\&quot;), image exemplars, or a combination of both. Promptable Concept Segmentation (PCS) takes such prompts and returns segmentation masks and unique identities for all matching object instances. To advance PCS, we build a scalable data engine that produces a high-quality dataset with 4M unique concept labels, including hard negatives, across images and videos. Our model consists of an image-level detector and a memory-based video tracker that share a single backbone. Recognition and localization are decoupled with a presence head, which boosts detection accuracy. SAM 3 doubles the accuracy of existing systems in both image and video PCS, and improves previous SAM capabilities on visual segmentation tasks. We open source SAM 3 along with our new Segment Anything with Concepts (SA-Co) benchmark for promptable concept segmentation.&quot;,&quot;upvotes&quot;:114,&quot;discussionId&quot;:&quot;6923c54bb5612535ed9558ef&quot;,&quot;projectPage&quot;:&quot;https://ai.meta.com/sam3/&quot;,&quot;githubRepo&quot;:&quot;https://github.com/facebookresearch/sam3&quot;,&quot;githubRepoAddedBy&quot;:&quot;user&quot;,&quot;ai_summary&quot;:&quot;Segment Anything Model 3 achieves state-of-the-art performance in promptable concept segmentation and tracking by leveraging a unified model architecture with decoupled recognition and localization.&quot;,&quot;ai_keywords&quot;:[&quot;Segment Anything Model&quot;,&quot;Promptable Concept Segmentation&quot;,&quot;concept prompts&quot;,&quot;segmentation masks&quot;,&quot;unique identities&quot;,&quot;scalable data engine&quot;,&quot;image-level detector&quot;,&quot;memory-based video tracker&quot;,&quot;presence head&quot;,&quot;visual segmentation tasks&quot;,&quot;Segment Anything with Concepts benchmark&quot;],&quot;githubStars&quot;:5939,&quot;organization&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;5e63d8713071d5be688861b8&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;facebook&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;AI at Meta&quot;,&quot;avatar&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/1592839207516-noauth.png&quot;}},&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-11-20T13:59:56.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;SAM 3: Segment Anything with Concepts&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;We present Segment Anything Model (SAM) 3, a unified model that detects, segments, and tracks objects in images and videos based on concept prompts, which we define as either short noun phrases (e.g., \&quot;yellow school bus\&quot;), image exemplars, or a combination of both. Promptable Concept Segmentation (PCS) takes such prompts and returns segmentation masks and unique identities for all matching object instances. To advance PCS, we build a scalable data engine that produces a high-quality dataset with 4M unique concept labels, including hard negatives, across images and videos. Our model consists of an image-level detector and a memory-based video tracker that share a single backbone. Recognition and localization are decoupled with a presence head, which boosts detection accuracy. SAM 3 doubles the accuracy of existing systems in both image and video PCS, and improves previous SAM capabilities on visual segmentation tasks. We open source SAM 3 along with our new Segment Anything with Concepts (SA-Co) benchmark for promptable concept segmentation.&quot;,&quot;thumbnail&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-thumbnails.huggingface.co/social-thumbnails/papers/2511.16719.png&quot;,&quot;numComments&quot;:4,&quot;upvoted&quot;:false,&quot;submittedBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6039478ab3ecf716b1a5fd4d&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/6039478ab3ecf716b1a5fd4d/_Thy4E7taiSYBLKxEKJbT.jpeg&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;taesiri&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;taesiri&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:true,&quot;isHf&quot;:false,&quot;isHfAdmin&quot;:false,&quot;isMod&quot;:false,&quot;followerCount&quot;:185},&quot;organization&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;5e63d8713071d5be688861b8&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;facebook&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;AI An Automatic Prompt Optimization Framework for Large\n  Language Models&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;60381555c58b41eeda0d6ccf&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;/avatars/2c2c4b75dd0199478dc0fbc72f9bcadc.svg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;rmurthy&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;rmurthy&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Large Language Models (LLMs) perform best with well-crafted prompts, yet\nprompt engineering remains manual, inconsistent, and inaccessible to\nnon-experts. We introduce Promptomatix, an automatic prompt optimization\nframework that transforms natural language task descriptions into high-quality\nprompts without requiring manual tuning or domain expertise. Promptomatix\nsupports both a lightweight meta-prompt-based optimizer and a DSPy-powered\ncompiler, with modular design enabling future extension to more advanced\nframeworks. The system analyzes user intent, generates synthetic training data,\nselects prompting strategies, and refines prompts using cost-aware objectives.\nEvaluated across 5 task categories, Promptomatix achieves competitive or\nsuperior performance compared to existing libraries, while reducing prompt\nlength and computational overhead making prompt optimization scalable and\nefficient.&quot;,&quot;upvotes&quot;:17,&quot;discussionId&quot;:&quot;6882978a6a54dd1e77daa9cb&quot;,&quot;githubRepo&quot;:&quot;https://github.com/SalesforceAIResearch/promptomatix&quot;,&quot;githubRepoAddedBy&quot;:&quot;user&quot;,&quot;ai_summary&quot;:&quot;Promptomatix automates prompt optimization for Large Language Models, improving performance and efficiency across various tasks.&quot;,&quot;ai_keywords&quot;:[&quot;Promptomatix&quot;,&quot;meta-prompt-based optimizer&quot;,&quot;DSPy-powered compiler&quot;,&quot;synthetic training data&quot;,&quot;prompting strategies&quot;,&quot;cost-aware objectives&quot;],&quot;githubStars&quot;:434},&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-07-17T14:18:20.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Promptomatix: An Automatic Prompt Optimization Framework for Large\n  Language Models&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Large Language Models (LLMs) perform best with well-crafted prompts, yet\nprompt engineering remains manual, inconsistent, and inaccessible to\nnon-experts. We introduce Promptomatix, an automatic prompt optimization\nframework that transforms natural language task descriptions into high-quality\nprompts without requiring manual tuning or domain expertise. Promptomatix\nsupports both a lightweight meta-prompt-based optimizer and a DSPy-powered\ncompiler, with modular design enabling future extension to more advanced\nframeworks. The system analyzes user intent, generates synthetic training data,\nselects prompting strategies, and refines prompts using cost-aware objectives.\nEvaluated across 5 task categories, Promptomatix achieves competitive or\nsuperior performance compared to existing libraries, while reducing prompt\nlength and computational overhead making prompt optimization scalable and\nefficient.&quot;,&quot;thumbnail&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-thumbnails.huggingface.co/social-thumbnails/papers/2507.14241.png&quot;,&quot;numComments&quot;:2,&quot;upvoted&quot;:false,&quot;submittedBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;60381555c58b41eeda0d6ccf&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;/avatars/2c2c4b75dd0199478dc0fbc72f9bcadc.svg&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;rmurthy&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;rmurthy&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;isHf&quot;:false,&quot;isHfAdmin&quot;:false,&quot;isMod&quot;:false},&quot;isAuthorParticipating&quot;:true},{&quot;paper&quot;:{&quot;id&quot;:&quot;2512.10685&quot;,&quot;authors&quot;:[{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;693be2e99874a2a5e4ffb42e&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Lars Tsin&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;693be2e99874a2a5e4ffb439&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Stephan R. Richter&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;693be2e99874a2a5e4ffb43a&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Vladlen Koltun&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false}],&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-12-11T14:34:11.000Z&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyAt&quot;:&quot;2025-12-15T08:51:24.053Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Sharp Monocular View Synthesis in Less Than a Second&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;665ebfb7a57b277d7a202fb1&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;/avatars/15538783a4fbc4688db85d1b49cd24e2.svg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Amael Delaunoy&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;amael-apple&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;We present SHARP, an approach to photorealistic view synthesis from a single image. Given a single photograph, SHARP regresses the parameters of a 3D Gaussian representation of the depicted scene. This is done in less than a second on a standard GPU via a single feedforward pass through a neural network. The 3D Gaussian representation produced by SHARP can then be rendered in real time, yielding high-resolution photorealistic images for nearby views. The representation is metric, with absolute scale, supporting metric camera movements. Experimental results demonstrate that SHARP delivers robust zero-shot generalization across datasets. It sets a new state of the art on multiple datasets, reducing LPIPS by 25-34% and DISTS by 21-43% versus the best prior model, while lowering the synthesis time by three orders of magnitude. Code and weights are provided at https://github.com/apple/ml-sharp&quot;,&quot;upvotes&quot;:3,&quot;discussionId&quot;:&quot;693be2ea9874a2a5e4ffb43b&quot;,&quot;projectPage&quot;:&quot;https://apple.github.io/ml-sharp/&quot;,&quot;githubRepo&quot;:&quot;https://github.com/apple/ml-sharp&quot;,&quot;githubRepoAddedBy&quot;:&quot;user&quot;,&quot;ai_summary&quot;:&quot;SHARP synthesizes photorealistic views from a single image using a 3D Gaussian representation, achieving state-of-the-art results with rapid processing.&quot;,&quot;ai_keywords&quot;:[&quot;photorealistic view synthesis&quot;,&quot;3D Gaussian representation&quot;,&quot;neural network&quot;,&quot;feedforward pass&quot;,&quot;real-time rendering&quot;,&quot;metric representation&quot;,&quot;zero-shot generalization&quot;,&quot;LPIPS&quot;,&quot;DISTS&quot;],&quot;githubStars&quot;:163,&quot;organization&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;628cbd99ef14f971b69948ab&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;apple&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Apple&quot;,&quot;avatar&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/1653390727490-5dd96eb166059660ed1ee413.jpeg&quot;}},&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-12-11T09:34:11.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Sharp Monocular View Synthesis in Less Than a Second&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;We present SHARP, an approach to photorealistic view synthesis from a single image. Given a single photograph, SHARP regresses the parameters of a 3D Gaussian representation of the depicted scene. This is done in less than a second on a standard GPU via a single feedforward pass through a neural network. The 3D Gaussian representation produced by SHARP can then be rendered in real time, yielding high-resolution photorealistic images for nearby views. The representation is metric, with absolute scale, supporting metric camera movements. Experimental results demonstrate that SHARP delivers robust zero-shot generalization across datasets. It sets a new state of the art on multiple datasets, reducing LPIPS by 25-34% and DISTS by 21-43% versus the best prior model, while lowering the synthesis time by three orders of magnitude. Code and weights are provided at https://github.com/apple/ml-sharp&quot;,&quot;thumbnail&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-thumbnails.huggingface.co/social-thumbnails/papers/2512.10685.png&quot;,&quot;numComments&quot;:2,&quot;upvoted&quot;:false,&quot;submittedBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;665ebfb7a57b277d7a202fb1&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;/avatars/15538783a4fbc4688db85d1b49cd24e2.svg&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Amael He&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false}],&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-09-26T10:45:48.000Z&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyAt&quot;:&quot;2025-09-29T00:46:33.156Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;MinerU2.5: A Decoupled Vision-Language Model for Efficient\n  High-Resolution Document Parsing&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6039478ab3ecf716b1a5fd4d&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/6039478ab3ecf716b1a5fd4d/_Thy4E7taiSYBLKxEKJbT.jpeg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:true,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;taesiri&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;taesiri&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;We introduce MinerU2.5, a 1.2B-parameter document parsing vision-language\nmodel that achieves state-of-the-art recognition accuracy while maintaining\nexceptional computational efficiency. Our approach employs a coarse-to-fine,\ntwo-stage parsing strategy that decouples global layout analysis from local\ncontent recognition. In the first stage, the model performs efficient layout\nanalysis on downsampled images to identify structural elements, circumventing\nthe computational overhead of processing high-resolution inputs. In the second\nstage, guided by the global layout, it performs targeted content recognition on\nnative-resolution crops extracted from the original image, preserving\nfine-grained details in dense text, complex formulas, and tables. To support\nthis strategy, we developed a comprehensive data engine that generates diverse,\nlarge-scale training corpora for both pretraining and fine-tuning. Ultimately,\nMinerU2.5 demonstrates strong document parsing ability, achieving\nstate-of-the-art performance on multiple benchmarks, surpassing both\ngeneral-purpose and domain-specific models across various recognition tasks,\nwhile maintaining significantly lower computational overhead.&quot;,&quot;upvotes&quot;:137,&quot;discussionId&quot;:&quot;68d9ebf80177a6054b013a95&quot;,&quot;projectPage&quot;:&quot;https://opendatalab.github.io/MinerU/&quot;,&quot;githubRepo&quot;:&quot;https://github.com/opendatalab/MinerU&quot;,&quot;githubRepoAddedBy&quot;:&quot;user&quot;,&quot;ai_summary&quot;:&quot;MinerU2.5, a 1.2B-parameter document parsing vision-language model, achieves state-of-the-art recognition accuracy with computational efficiency through a coarse-to-fine parsing strategy.&quot;,&quot;ai_keywords&quot;:[&quot;document parsing&quot;,&quot;vision-language model&quot;,&quot;coarse-to-fine&quot;,&quot;two-stage parsing&quot;,&quot;layout analysis&quot;,&quot;content recognition&quot;,&quot;downsampled images&quot;,&quot;native-resolution crops&quot;,&quot;data engine&quot;,&quot;pretraining&quot;,&quot;fine-tuning&quot;,&quot;state-of-the-art performance&quot;,&quot;computational overhead&quot;],&quot;githubStars&quot;:50513},&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-09-26T06:45:48.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;MinerU2.5: A Decoupled Vision-Language Model for Efficient\n  High-Resolution Document Parsing&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;We introduce MinerU2.5, a 1.2B-parameter document parsing vision-language\nmodel that achieves state-of-the-art recognition accuracy while maintaining\nexceptional computational efficiency. Our approach employs a coarse-to-fine,\ntwo-stage parsing strategy that decouples global layout analysis from local\ncontent recognition. In the first stage, the model performs efficient layout\nanalysis on downsampled images to identify structural elements, circumventing\nthe computational overhead of processing high-resolution inputs. In the second\nstage, guided by the global layout, it performs targeted content recognition on\nnative-resolution crops extracted from the original image, preserving\nfine-grained details in dense text, complex formulas, and tables. To support\nthis strategy, we developed a comprehensive data engine that generates diverse,\nlarge-scale training corpora for both pretraining and fine-tuning. Ultimately,\nMinerU2.5 demonstrates strong document parsing ability, achieving\nstate-of-the-art performance on multiple benchmarks, surpassing both\ngeneral-purpose and domain-specific models across various recognition tasks,\nwhile maintaining significantly lower computational overhead.&quot;,&quot;thumbnail&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-thumbnails.huggingface.co/social-thumbnails/papers/2509.22186.png&quot;,&quot;numComments&quot;:2,&quot;upvoted&quot;:false,&quot;submittedBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6039478ab3ecf716b1a5fd4d&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/6039478ab3ecf716b1a5fd4d/_Thy4E7taiSYBLKxEKJbT.jpeg&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;taesiri&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;taesiri&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:true,&quot;isHf&quot;:false,&quot;isHfAdmin&quot;:false,&quot;isMod&quot;:false,&quot;followerCount&quot;:185},&quot;isAuthorParticipating&quot;:false},{&quot;paper&quot;:{&quot;id&quot;:&quot;2412.00568&quot;,&quot;authors&quot;:[{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;674f356ea03fd00bab16cdc2&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;630495adeb6d777a838d27b4&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/630495adeb6d777a838d27b4/qCtQ8t37vYDOsQukDznTZ.jpeg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Ruben Parker&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;674f356ea03fd00bab16cdda&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Miles Cranmer&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;674f356ea03fd00bab16cddb&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Shirley Ho&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false}],&quot;mediaUrls&quot;:[&quot;https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/630495adeb6d777a838d27b4/f-17m7Z_1gB7kHabYSn6K.gif&quot;],&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2024-11-30T19:42:14.000Z&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyAt&quot;:&quot;2024-12-03T14:16:06.868Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;The Well: a Large-Scale Collection of Diverse Physics Simulations for\n  Machine Learning&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;630495adeb6d777a838d27b4&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/630495adeb6d777a838d27b4/qCtQ8t37vYDOsQukDznTZ.jpeg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Ruben Ohana&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;rubenohana&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Machine learning based surrogate models offer researchers powerful tools for\naccelerating simulation-based workflows. However, as standard datasets in this\nspace often cover small classes of physical behavior, it can be difficult to\nevaluate the efficacy of new approaches. To address this gap, we introduce the\nWell: a large-scale collection of datasets containing numerical simulations of\na wide variety of spatiotemporal physical systems. The Well draws from domain\nexperts and numerical software developers to provide 15TB of data across 16\ndatasets covering diverse domains such as biological systems, fluid dynamics,\nacoustic scattering, as well as magneto-hydrodynamic simulations of\nextra-galactic fluids or supernova explosions. These datasets can be used\nindividually or as part of a broader benchmark suite. To facilitate usage of\nthe Well, we provide a unified PyTorch interface for training and evaluating\nmodels. We demonstrate the function of this library by introducing example\nbaselines that highlight the new challenges posed by the complex dynamics of\nthe Well. The code and data is available at\nhttps://github.com/PolymathicAI/the_well.&quot;,&quot;upvotes&quot;:23,&quot;discussionId&quot;:&quot;674f3570a03fd00bab16ce66&quot;,&quot;githubRepo&quot;:&quot;https://github.com/PolymathicAI/the_well&quot;,&quot;githubRepoAddedBy&quot;:&quot;user&quot;,&quot;ai_summary&quot;:&quot;A large-scale dataset collection, The Well, provides diverse numerical simulations for benchmarking machine learning models in physical systems simulation.&quot;,&quot;ai_keywords&quot;:[&quot;surrogate models&quot;,&quot;simulation-based workflows&quot;,&quot;numerical simulations&quot;,&quot;spatiotemporal physical systems&quot;,&quot;biological systems&quot;,&quot;fluid dynamics&quot;,&quot;acoustic scattering&quot;,&quot;magneto-hydrodynamic simulations&quot;,&quot;PyTorch interface&quot;,&quot;benchmark suite&quot;],&quot;githubStars&quot;:1601},&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2024-11-30T14:42:14.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;The Well: a Large-Scale Collection of Diverse Physics Simulations for\n  Machine Learning&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Machine learning based surrogate models offer researchers powerful tools for\naccelerating simulation-based workflows. However, as standard datasets in this\nspace often cover small classes of physical behavior, it can be difficult to\nevaluate the efficacy of new approaches. To address this gap, we introduce the\nWell: a large-scale collection of datasets containing numerical simulations of\na wide variety of spatiotemporal physical systems. The Well draws from domain\nexperts and numerical software developers to provide 15TB of data across 16\ndatasets covering diverse domains such as biological systems, fluid dynamics,\nacoustic scattering, as well as magneto-hydrodynamic simulations of\nextra-galactic fluids or supernova explosions. These datasets can be used\nindividually or as part of a broader benchmark suite. To facilitate usage of\nthe Well, we provide a unified PyTorch interface for training and evaluating\nmodels. We demonstrate the function of this library by introducing example\nbaselines that highlight the new challenges posed by the complex dynamics of\nthe Well. The code and data is available at\nhttps://github.com/PolymathicAI/the_well.&quot;,&quot;mediaUrls&quot;:[&quot;https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/630495adeb6d777a838d27b4/f-17m7Z_1gB7kHabYSn6K.gif&quot;],&quot;thumbnail&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-thumbnails.huggingface.co/social-thumbnails/papers/2412.00568.png&quot;,&quot;numComments&quot;:2,&quot;upvoted&quot;:false,&quot;submittedBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;630495adeb6d777a838d27b4&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/630495adeb6d777a838d27b4/qCtQ8t37vYDOsQukDznTZ.jpeg&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Ruben Ohana&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;rubenohana&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;isHf&quot;:false,&quot;isHfAdmin&quot;:false,&quot;isMod&quot;:false,&quot;followerCount&quot;:10},&quot;isAuthorParticipating&quot;:true},{&quot;paper&quot;:{&quot;id&quot;:&quot;2410.17799&quot;,&quot;authors&quot;:[{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;671a373f1675096c0e87a4ff&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Qinglin Cheng&quot;,&quot;status&quot;:&quot;claimed_verified&quot;,&quot;statusLastChangedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-12-15T09:59:11.833Z&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;671a373f1675096c0e87a501&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Chong Deng&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;671a373f1675096c0e87a502&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Qian Tan&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false}],&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2024-10-23T11:58:58.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;OmniFlatten: An End-to-end GPT Model for Seamless Voice Conversation&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Full-duplex spoken dialogue systems significantly advance over traditional\nturn-based dialogue systems, as they allow simultaneous bidirectional\ncommunication, closely mirroring human-human interactions. However, achieving\nlow latency and natural interactions in full-duplex dialogue systems remains a\nsignificant challenge, especially considering human conversation dynamics such\nas interruptions, backchannels, and overlapping speech. In this paper, we\nintroduce a novel End-to-End GPT-based model OmniFlatten for full-duplex\nconversation, capable of effectively modeling the complex behaviors inherent to\nnatural conversations with low latency. To achieve full-duplex communication\ncapabilities, we propose a multi-stage post-training scheme that progressively\nadapts a text-based large language model (LLM) backbone into a speech-text\ndialogue LLM, capable of generating text and speech in real time, without\nmodifying the architecture of the backbone LLM. The training process comprises\nthree stages: modality alignment, half-duplex dialogue learning, and\nfull-duplex dialogue learning. Throughout all training stages, we standardize\nthe data using a flattening operation, which allows us to unify the training\nmethods and the model architecture across different modalities and tasks. Our\napproach offers a straightforward modeling technique and a promising research\ndirection for developing efficient and natural end-to-end full-duplex spoken\ndialogue systems. Audio samples of dialogues generated by OmniFlatten can be\nfound at this web site (https://omniflatten.github.io/).&quot;,&quot;upvotes&quot;:6,&quot;discussionId&quot;:&quot;671a37401675096c0e87a573&quot;,&quot;githubRepo&quot;:&quot;https://github.com/karpathy/nanogpt&quot;,&quot;githubRepoAddedBy&quot;:&quot;auto&quot;,&quot;ai_summary&quot;:&quot;A novel GPT-based model, OmniFlatten, enables real-time natural full-duplex spoken dialogue through a multi-stage post-training technique that integrates speech and text without altering the original model's architecture.&quot;,&quot;ai_keywords&quot;:[&quot;End-to-End GPT-based model&quot;,&quot;OmniFlatten&quot;,&quot;full-duplex conversation&quot;,&quot;text-based large language model (LLM)&quot;,&quot;speech-text dialogue LLM&quot;,&quot;modality alignment&quot;,&quot;half-duplex dialogue learning&quot;,&quot;full-duplex dialogue learning&quot;,&quot;flattening operation&quot;],&quot;githubStars&quot;:51128},&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2024-10-23T07:58:58.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;OmniFlatten: An End-to-end GPT Model for Seamless Voice Conversation&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Full-duplex spoken dialogue systems significantly advance over traditional\nturn-based dialogue systems, as they allow simultaneous bidirectional\ncommunication, closely mirroring human-human interactions. However, achieving\nlow latency and natural interactions in full-duplex dialogue systems remains a\nsignificant challenge, especially considering human conversation dynamics such\nas interruptions, backchannels, and overlapping speech. In this paper, we\nintroduce a novel End-to-End GPT-based model OmniFlatten for full-duplex\nconversation, capable of effectively modeling the complex behaviors inherent to\nnatural conversations with low latency. To achieve full-duplex communication\ncapabilities, we propose a multi-stage post-training scheme that progressively\nadapts a text-based large language model (LLM) backbone into a speech-text\ndialogue LLM, capable of generating text and speech in real time, without\nmodifying the architecture of the backbone LLM. The training process comprises\nthree stages: modality alignment, half-duplex dialogue learning, and\nfull-duplex dialogue learning. Throughout all training stages, we standardize\nthe data using a flattening operation, which allows us to unify the training\nmethods and the model architecture across different modalities and tasks. Our\napproach offers a straightforward modeling technique and a promising research\ndirection for developing efficient and natural end-to-end full-duplex spoken\ndialogue systems. Audio samples of dialogues generated by OmniFlatten can be\nfound at this web site (https://omniflatten.github.io/).&quot;,&quot;thumbnail&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-thumbnails.huggingface.co/social-thumbnails/papers/2410.17799.png&quot;,&quot;numComments&quot;:1,&quot;upvoted&quot;:false,&quot;isAuthorParticipating&quot;:false},{&quot;paper&quot;:{&quot;id&quot;:&quot;2409.18839&quot;,&quot;authors&quot;:[{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;66fa495601ab1cdf3672e569&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;63ae9ff5557befe297a76f90&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/1672388558183-noauth.jpeg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Bin He&quot;,&quot;status&quot;:&quot;admin_assigned&quot;,&quot;statusLastChangedAt&quot;:&quot;2024-09-30T12:33:29.147Z&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false}],&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2024-09-27T15:35:15.000Z&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyAt&quot;:&quot;2024-09-30T05:17:52.656Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;MinerU: An Open-Source Solution for Precise Document Content Extraction&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;63ae9ff5557befe297a76f90&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/1672388558183-noauth.jpeg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Bin Wang&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;wanderkid&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Document content analysis has been a crucial research area in computer\nvision. Despite significant advancements in methods such as OCR, layout\ndetection, and formula recognition, existing open-source solutions struggle to\nconsistently deliver high-quality content extraction due to the diversity in\ndocument types and content. To address these challenges, we present MinerU, an\nopen-source solution for high-precision document content extraction. MinerU\nleverages the sophisticated PDF-Extract-Kit models to extract content from\ndiverse documents effectively and employs finely-tuned preprocessing and\npostprocessing rules to ensure the accuracy of the final results. Experimental\nresults demonstrate that MinerU consistently achieves high performance across\nvarious document types, significantly enhancing the quality and consistency of\ncontent extraction. The MinerU open-source project is available at\nhttps://github.com/opendatalab/MinerU.&quot;,&quot;upvotes&quot;:35,&quot;discussionId&quot;:&quot;66fa495801ab1cdf3672e61f&quot;,&quot;githubRepo&quot;:&quot;https://github.com/opendatalab/mineru&quot;,&quot;githubRepoAddedBy&quot;:&quot;auto&quot;,&quot;ai_summary&quot;:&quot;MinerU is an open-source tool that enhances document content extraction using fine-tuned models and pre/postprocessing rules across diverse document types.&quot;,&quot;ai_keywords&quot;:[&quot;PDF-Extract-Kit&quot;,&quot;high-precision&quot;,&quot;content extraction&quot;,&quot;preprocessing&quot;,&quot;postprocessing&quot;,&quot;document types&quot;],&quot;githubStars&quot;:50498},&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2024-09-27T11:35:15.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;MinerU: An Open-Source Solution for Precise Document Content Extraction&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Document content analysis has been a crucial research area in computer\nvision. Despite significant advancements in methods such as OCR, layout\ndetection, and formula recognition, existing open-source solutions struggle to\nconsistently deliver high-quality content extraction due to the diversity in\ndocument types and content. To address these challenges, we present MinerU, an\nopen-source solution for high-precision document content extraction. MinerU\nleverages the sophisticated PDF-Extract-Kit models to extract content from\ndiverse documents effectively and employs finely-tuned preprocessing and\npostprocessing rules to ensure the accuracy of the final results. Experimental\nresults demonstrate that MinerU consistently achieves high performance across\nvarious document types, significantly enhancing the quality and consistency of\ncontent extraction. The MinerU open-source project is available at\nhttps://github.com/opendatalab/MinerU.&quot;,&quot;thumbnail&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-thumbnails.huggingface.co/social-thumbnails/papers/2409.18839.png&quot;,&quot;numComments&quot;:4,&quot;upvoted&quot;:false,&quot;submittedBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;63ae9ff5557befe297a76f90&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/1672388558183-noauth.jpeg&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Bin Large-Scale Multi-Agent Simulation in AgentScope&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;60f1abe7544c2adfd699860c&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/1674929746905-60f1abe7544c2adfd699860c.jpeg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:true,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;AK&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;akhaliq&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Recent advances in large language models (LLMs) have opened new avenues for\napplying multi-agent systems in very large-scale simulations. However, there\nremain several challenges when conducting multi-agent simulations with existing\nplatforms, such as limited scalability and low efficiency, unsatisfied agent\ndiversity, and effort-intensive management processes. To address these\nchallenges, we develop several new features and components for AgentScope, a\nuser-friendly multi-agent platform, enhancing its convenience and flexibility\nfor supporting very large-scale multi-agent simulations. Specifically, we\npropose an actor-based distributed mechanism as the underlying technological\ninfrastructure towards great scalability and high efficiency, and provide\nflexible environment support for simulating various real-world scenarios, which\nenables parallel execution of multiple agents, centralized workflow\norchestration, and both inter-agent and agent-environment interactions among\nagents. Moreover, we integrate an easy-to-use configurable tool and an\nautomatic background generation pipeline in AgentScope, simplifying the process\nof creating agents with diverse yet detailed background settings. Last but not\nleast, we provide a web-based interface for conveniently monitoring and\nmanaging a large number of agents that might deploy across multiple devices. We\nconduct a comprehensive simulation to demonstrate the effectiveness of the\nproposed enhancements in AgentScope, and provide detailed observations and\ndiscussions to highlight the great potential of applying multi-agent systems in\nlarge-scale simulations. The source code is released on GitHub at\nhttps://github.com/modelscope/agentscope to inspire further research and\ndevelopment in large-scale multi-agent simulations.&quot;,&quot;upvotes&quot;:34,&quot;discussionId&quot;:&quot;66a31f3aa74b20aad777e82e&quot;,&quot;githubRepo&quot;:&quot;https://github.com/modelscope/agentscope&quot;,&quot;githubRepoAddedBy&quot;:&quot;auto&quot;,&quot;ai_summary&quot;:&quot;Enhancements to the AgentScope platform improve scalability, efficiency, and ease of use for large-scale multi-agent simulations through distributed mechanisms, flexible environments, and user-friendly tools.&quot;,&quot;ai_keywords&quot;:[&quot;actor-based distributed mechanism&quot;,&quot;multi-agent platform&quot;,&quot;centralized workflow orchestration&quot;,&quot;inter-agent interactions&quot;,&quot;agent-environment interactions&quot;,&quot;configurable tool&quot;,&quot;automatic background generation pipeline&quot;,&quot;web-based interface&quot;],&quot;githubStars&quot;:14486},&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2024-07-25T01:50:46.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Very Large-Scale Multi-Agent Simulation in AgentScope&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Recent advances in large language models (LLMs) have opened new avenues for\napplying multi-agent systems in very large-scale simulations. However, there\nremain several challenges when conducting multi-agent simulations with existing\nplatforms, such as limited scalability and low efficiency, unsatisfied agent\ndiversity, and effort-intensive management processes. To address these\nchallenges, we develop several new features and components for AgentScope, a\nuser-friendly multi-agent platform, enhancing its convenience and flexibility\nfor supporting very large-scale multi-agent simulations. Specifically, we\npropose an actor-based distributed mechanism as the underlying technological\ninfrastructure towards great scalability and high efficiency, and provide\nflexible environment support for simulating various real-world scenarios, which\nenables parallel execution of multiple agents, centralized workflow\norchestration, and both inter-agent and agent-environment interactions among\nagents. Moreover, we integrate an easy-to-use configurable tool and an\nautomatic background generation pipeline in AgentScope, simplifying the process\nof creating agents with diverse yet detailed background settings. Last but not\nleast, we provide a web-based interface for conveniently monitoring and\nmanaging a large number of agents that might deploy across multiple devices. We\nconduct a comprehensive simulation to demonstrate the effectiveness of the\nproposed enhancements in AgentScope, and provide detailed observations and\ndiscussions to highlight the great potential of applying multi-agent systems in\nlarge-scale simulations. The source code is released on GitHub at\nhttps://github.com/modelscope/agentscope to inspire further research and\ndevelopment in large-scale multi-agent simulations.&quot;,&quot;thumbnail&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-thumbnails.huggingface.co/social-thumbnails/papers/2407.17789.png&quot;,&quot;numComments&quot;:2,&quot;upvoted&quot;:false,&quot;submittedBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;60f1abe7544c2adfd699860c&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/1674929746905-60f1abe7544c2adfd699860c.jpeg&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;AK&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;akhaliq&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:true,&quot;isHf&quot;:true,&quot;isHfAdmin&quot;:false,&quot;isMod&quot;:false,&quot;followerCount&quot;:8928},&quot;isAuthorParticipating&quot;:false},{&quot;paper&quot;:{&quot;id&quot;:&quot;2512.08765&quot;,&quot;authors&quot;:[{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6938da63dfc35938ba129f3c&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;642e3bcb958faf258a40e89c&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;/avatars/dad142df2217f8eed1f45c9e7287d3ea.svg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Ruihang Zhao&quot;,&quot;status&quot;:&quot;admin_assigned&quot;,&quot;statusLastChangedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-12-10T09:41:26.372Z&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6938da63dfc35938ba129f46&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Yu Liu&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6938da63dfc35938ba129f47&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Yingya Zhang&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6938da63dfc35938ba129f48&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;64ca1fe838837b12d5e529b7&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;/avatars/44a3ad9e59318784ac531993b5f69f6b.svg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Yujiu Yang&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;Thu-redrobot&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Yujiu Yang&quot;,&quot;status&quot;:&quot;admin_assigned&quot;,&quot;statusLastChangedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-12-10T09:41:10.566Z&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false}],&quot;mediaUrls&quot;:[&quot;https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/6039478ab3ecf716b1a5fd4d/GRHR-g0jymQza9KMw0iLn.png&quot;,&quot;https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/6039478ab3ecf716b1a5fd4d/K8nyGDyLuL_hxp15wJdMk.png&quot;,&quot;https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/6039478ab3ecf716b1a5fd4d/4b8dLB_xvGpTjJlWP8oeh.mp4&quot;],&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-12-09T16:13:55.000Z&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyAt&quot;:&quot;2025-12-10T00:20:18.797Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Wan-Move: Motion-controllable Video Generation via Latent Trajectory Guidance&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6039478ab3ecf716b1a5fd4d&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/6039478ab3ecf716b1a5fd4d/_Thy4E7taiSYBLKxEKJbT.jpeg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:true,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;taesiri&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;taesiri&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;We present Wan-Move, a simple and scalable framework that brings motion control to video generative models. Existing motion-controllable methods typically suffer from coarse control granularity and limited scalability, leaving their outputs insufficient for practical use. We narrow this gap by achieving precise and high-quality motion control. Our core idea is to directly make the original condition features motion-aware for guiding video synthesis. To this end, we first represent object motions with dense point trajectories, allowing fine-grained control over the scene. We then project these trajectories into latent space and propagate the first frame's features along each trajectory, producing an aligned spatiotemporal feature map that tells how each scene element should move. This feature map serves as the updated latent condition, which is naturally integrated into the off-the-shelf image-to-video model, e.g., Wan-I2V-14B, as motion guidance without any architecture change. It removes the need for auxiliary motion encoders and makes fine-tuning base models easily scalable. Through scaled training, Wan-Move generates 5-second, 480p videos whose motion controllability rivals Kling 1.5 Pro's commercial Motion Brush, as indicated by user studies. To support comprehensive evaluation, we further design MoveBench, a rigorously curated benchmark featuring diverse content categories and hybrid-verified annotations. It is distinguished by larger data volume, longer video durations, and high-quality motion annotations. Extensive experiments on MoveBench and the public dataset consistently show Wan-Move's superior motion quality. Code, models, and benchmark data are made publicly available.&quot;,&quot;upvotes&quot;:122,&quot;discussionId&quot;:&quot;6938da64dfc35938ba129f49&quot;,&quot;projectPage&quot;:&quot;https://wan-move.github.io/&quot;,&quot;githubRepo&quot;:&quot;https://github.com/ali-vilab/Wan-Move&quot;,&quot;githubRepoAddedBy&quot;:&quot;user&quot;,&quot;ai_summary&quot;:&quot;Wan-Move enhances motion control in video generative models by integrating motion-aware features into latent space, enabling high-quality and scalable video synthesis.&quot;,&quot;ai_keywords&quot;:[&quot;motion control&quot;,&quot;video generative models&quot;,&quot;dense point trajectories&quot;,&quot;latent space&quot;,&quot;spatiotemporal feature map&quot;,&quot;motion guidance&quot;,&quot;image-to-video model&quot;,&quot;auxiliary motion encoders&quot;,&quot;fine-tuning&quot;,&quot;MoveBench&quot;,&quot;motion annotations&quot;],&quot;githubStars&quot;:410,&quot;organization&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;67d15cca6e2cf0e062dbfb54&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;AlibabaTongyiLab&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;TongyiLab&quot;,&quot;avatar&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/67d1502bfabfe9974d1f77bb/XdUSVf6HqBzE7zFBfSDQP.png&quot;}},&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-12-09T11:13:55.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Wan-Move: Motion-controllable Video Generation via Latent Trajectory Guidance&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;We present Wan-Move, a simple and scalable framework that brings motion control to video generative models. Existing motion-controllable methods typically suffer from coarse control granularity and limited scalability, leaving their outputs insufficient for practical use. We narrow this gap by achieving precise and high-quality motion control. Our core idea is to directly make the original condition features motion-aware for guiding video synthesis. To this end, we first represent object motions with dense point trajectories, allowing fine-grained control over the scene. We then project these trajectories into latent space and propagate the first frame's features along each trajectory, producing an aligned spatiotemporal feature map that tells how each scene element should move. This feature map serves as the updated latent condition, which is naturally integrated into the off-the-shelf image-to-video model, e.g., Wan-I2V-14B, as motion guidance without any architecture change. It removes the need for auxiliary motion encoders and makes fine-tuning base models easily scalable. Through scaled training, Wan-Move generates 5-second, 480p videos whose motion controllability rivals Kling 1.5 Pro's commercial Motion Brush, as indicated by user studies. To support comprehensive evaluation, we further design MoveBench, a rigorously curated benchmark featuring diverse content categories and hybrid-verified annotations. It is distinguished by larger data volume, longer video durations, and high-quality motion annotations. Extensive experiments on MoveBench and the public dataset consistently show Wan-Move's superior motion quality. Code, models, and benchmark data are made publicly available.&quot;,&quot;mediaUrls&quot;:[&quot;https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/6039478ab3ecf716b1a5fd4d/GRHR-g0jymQza9KMw0iLn.png&quot;,&quot;https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/6039478ab3ecf716b1a5fd4d/K8nyGDyLuL_hxp15wJdMk.png&quot;,&quot;https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/6039478ab3ecf716b1a5fd4d/4b8dLB_xvGpTjJlWP8oeh.mp4&quot;],&quot;thumbnail&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-thumbnails.huggingface.co/social-thumbnails/papers/2512.08765.png&quot;,&quot;numComments&quot;:3,&quot;upvoted&quot;:false,&quot;submittedBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6039478ab3ecf716b1a5fd4d&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/6039478ab3ecf716b1a5fd4d/_Thy4E7taiSYBLKxEKJbT.jpeg&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;taesiri&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;taesiri&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:true,&quot;isHf&quot;:false,&quot;isHfAdmin&quot;:false,&quot;isMod&quot;:false,&quot;followerCount&quot;:185},&quot;organization&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;67d15cca6e2cf0e062dbfb54&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;AlibabaTongyiLab&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;TongyiLab&quot;,&quot;avatar&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/67d1502bfabfe9974d1f77bb/XdUSVf6HqBzE7zFBfSDQP.png&quot;},&quot;isAuthorParticipating&quot;:true},{&quot;paper&quot;:{&quot;id&quot;:&quot;2510.14528&quot;,&quot;authors&quot;:[{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;68f1a43f6e0bef323a68fcee&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;65a5231a087d8a2e9cc2414b&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/65a5231a087d8a2e9cc2414b/wj0l5R5LmBUG-E8XTMdBM.jpeg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;cuicheng&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;ChengCui&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Cheng Ma&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false}],&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-10-16T10:18:48.000Z&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyAt&quot;:&quot;2025-10-17T00:35:15.163Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;PaddleOCR-VL: Boosting Multilingual Document Parsing via a 0.9B Ultra-Compact Vision-Language Model&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6039478ab3ecf716b1a5fd4d&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/6039478ab3ecf716b1a5fd4d/_Thy4E7taiSYBLKxEKJbT.jpeg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:true,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;taesiri&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;taesiri&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;In this report, we propose PaddleOCR-VL, a SOTA and resource-efficient model tailored for document parsing. Its core component is PaddleOCR-VL-0.9B, a compact yet powerful vision-language model (VLM) that integrates a NaViT-style dynamic resolution visual encoder with the ERNIE-4.5-0.3B language model to enable accurate element recognition. This innovative model efficiently supports 109 languages and excels in recognizing complex elements (e.g., text, tables, formulas, and charts), while maintaining minimal resource consumption. Through comprehensive evaluations on widely used public benchmarks and in-house benchmarks, PaddleOCR-VL achieves SOTA performance in both page-level document parsing and element-level recognition. It significantly outperforms existing solutions, exhibits strong competitiveness against top-tier VLMs, and delivers fast inference speeds. These strengths make it highly suitable for practical deployment in real-world scenarios. Code is available at https://github.com/PaddlePaddle/PaddleOCR .&quot;,&quot;upvotes&quot;:107,&quot;discussionId&quot;:&quot;68f1a4406e0bef323a68fd00&quot;,&quot;githubRepo&quot;:&quot;https://github.com/PaddlePaddle/PaddleOCR&quot;,&quot;githubRepoAddedBy&quot;:&quot;user&quot;,&quot;ai_summary&quot;:&quot;PaddleOCR-VL, a vision-language model combining NaViT-style dynamic resolution and ERNIE, achieves state-of-the-art performance in document parsing and element recognition with high efficiency.&quot;,&quot;ai_keywords&quot;:[&quot;vision-language model&quot;,&quot;VLM&quot;,&quot;NaViT-style dynamic resolution visual encoder&quot;,&quot;ERNIE&quot;,&quot;element recognition&quot;,&quot;page-level document parsing&quot;,&quot;element-level recognition&quot;],&quot;githubStars&quot;:66364,&quot;organization&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;62067d5d3906f102bc9658bd&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;PaddlePaddle&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;PaddlePaddle&quot;,&quot;avatar&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/1654942635336-5f3ff69679c1ba4c353d0c5a.png&quot;}},&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-10-16T06:18:48.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;PaddleOCR-VL: Boosting Multilingual Document Parsing via a 0.9B Ultra-Compact Vision-Language Model&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;In this report, we propose PaddleOCR-VL, a SOTA and resource-efficient model tailored for document parsing. Its core component is PaddleOCR-VL-0.9B, a compact yet powerful vision-language model (VLM) that integrates a NaViT-style dynamic resolution visual encoder with the ERNIE-4.5-0.3B language model to enable accurate element recognition. This innovative model efficiently supports 109 languages and excels in recognizing complex elements (e.g., text, tables, formulas, and charts), while maintaining minimal resource consumption. Through comprehensive evaluations on widely used public benchmarks and in-house benchmarks, PaddleOCR-VL achieves SOTA performance in both page-level document parsing and element-level recognition. It significantly outperforms existing solutions, exhibits strong competitiveness against top-tier VLMs, and delivers fast inference speeds. These strengths make it highly suitable for practical deployment in real-world scenarios. Code is available at https://github.com/PaddlePaddle/PaddleOCR .&quot;,&quot;thumbnail&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-thumbnails.huggingface.co/social-thumbnails/papers/2510.14528.png&quot;,&quot;numComments&quot;:6,&quot;upvoted&quot;:false,&quot;submittedBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6039478ab3ecf716b1a5fd4d&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/6039478ab3ecf716b1a5fd4d/_Thy4E7taiSYBLKxEKJbT.jpeg&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;taesiri&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;taesiri&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:true,&quot;isHf&quot;:false,&quot;isHfAdmin&quot;:false,&quot;isMod&quot;:false,&quot;followerCount&quot;:185},&quot;organization&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;62067d5d3906f102bc9658bd&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;PaddlePaddle&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;PaddlePaddle&quot;,&quot;avatar&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/1654942635336-5f3ff69679c1ba4c353d0c5a.png&quot;},&quot;isAuthorParticipating&quot;:true},{&quot;paper&quot;:{&quot;id&quot;:&quot;2502.06855&quot;,&quot;authors&quot;:[{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;67adeaf26083604e4b620c3f&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;649ea7106282cb41e77760bc&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/649ea7106282cb41e77760bc/HlWjaqxr03ob93vdKg_LQ.jpeg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Isaac&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;XiangJinYu&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Jinyu Tu&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;67adeaf26083604e4b620c44&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Xinbing Hong&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;67adeaf26083604e4b620c46&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;64252594a4f3051f54dd4355&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;/avatars/c1f982b9b6be2956f6b6558be70d9ec3.svg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Wu&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;alexanderwu&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Chenglin Wu&quot;,&quot;status&quot;:&quot;claimed_verified&quot;,&quot;statusLastChangedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-04-08T06:58:35.476Z&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;67adeaf26083604e4b620c47&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;67efa8a2ed790a2e999dc216&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/no-auth/0S4lQCJX61uCF8EkSLMkk.png&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Yuyu Luo&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;luoyuyu&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Yuyu Luo&quot;,&quot;status&quot;:&quot;claimed_verified&quot;,&quot;statusLastChangedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-04-08T06:58:33.020Z&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false}],&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-02-07T17:45:16.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Self-Supervised Prompt Optimization&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Well-designed prompts are crucial for enhancing Large language models' (LLMs)\nreasoning capabilities while aligning their outputs with task requirements\nacross diverse domains. However, manually designed prompts require expertise\nand iterative experimentation. While existing prompt optimization methods aim\nto automate this process, they rely heavily on external references such as\nground truth or by humans, limiting their applicability in real-world scenarios\nwhere such data is unavailable or costly to obtain. To address this, we propose\nSelf-Supervised Prompt Optimization (SPO), a cost-efficient framework that\ndiscovers effective prompts for both closed and open-ended tasks without\nrequiring external reference. Motivated by the observations that prompt quality\nmanifests directly in LLM outputs and LLMs can effectively assess adherence to\ntask requirements, we derive evaluation and optimization signals purely from\noutput comparisons. Specifically, SPO selects superior prompts through pairwise\noutput comparisons evaluated by an LLM evaluator, followed by an LLM optimizer\nthat aligns outputs with task requirements. Extensive experiments demonstrate\nthat SPO outperforms state-of-the-art prompt optimization methods, achieving\ncomparable or superior results with significantly lower costs (e.g., 1.1% to\n5.6% of existing methods) and fewer samples (e.g., three samples). The code is\navailable at https://github.com/geekan/MetaGPT.&quot;,&quot;upvotes&quot;:2,&quot;discussionId&quot;:&quot;67adeaf36083604e4b620c8a&quot;,&quot;githubRepo&quot;:&quot;https://github.com/geekan/metagpt&quot;,&quot;githubRepoAddedBy&quot;:&quot;auto&quot;,&quot;ai_summary&quot;:&quot;A self-supervised framework optimizes prompts for both closed and open-ended tasks by evaluating LLM outputs without external references, reducing costs and required data.&quot;,&quot;ai_keywords&quot;:[&quot;LLMs&quot;,&quot;prompt optimization&quot;,&quot;Self-Supervised Prompt Optimization (SPO)&quot;,&quot;prompt quality&quot;,&quot;pairwise output comparisons&quot;,&quot;LLM evaluator&quot;,&quot;LLM optimizer&quot;,&quot;state-of-the-art methods&quot;],&quot;githubStars&quot;:60708},&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-02-07T12:45:16.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Self-Supervised Prompt Optimization&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Well-designed prompts are crucial for enhancing Large language models' (LLMs)\nreasoning capabilities while aligning their outputs with task requirements\nacross diverse domains. However, manually designed prompts require expertise\nand iterative experimentation. While existing prompt optimization methods aim\nto automate this process, they rely heavily on external references such as\nground truth or by humans, limiting their applicability in real-world scenarios\nwhere such data is unavailable or costly to obtain. To address this, we propose\nSelf-Supervised Prompt Optimization (SPO), a cost-efficient framework that\ndiscovers effective prompts for both closed and open-ended tasks without\nrequiring external reference. Motivated by the observations that prompt quality\nmanifests directly in LLM outputs and LLMs can effectively assess adherence to\ntask requirements, we derive evaluation and optimization signals purely from\noutput comparisons. Specifically, SPO selects superior prompts through pairwise\noutput comparisons evaluated by an LLM evaluator, followed by an LLM optimizer\nthat aligns outputs with task requirements. Extensive experiments demonstrate\nthat SPO outperforms state-of-the-art prompt optimization methods, achieving\ncomparable or superior results with significantly lower costs (e.g., 1.1% to\n5.6% of existing methods) and fewer samples (e.g., three samples). The code is\navailable at Models&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;60f1abe7544c2adfd699860c&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/1674929746905-60f1abe7544c2adfd699860c.jpeg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:true,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;AK&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;akhaliq&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Efficient fine-tuning is vital for adapting large language models (LLMs) to\ndownstream tasks. However, it requires non-trivial efforts to implement these\nmethods on different models. We present LlamaFactory, a unified framework that\nintegrates a suite of cutting-edge efficient training methods. It allows users\nto flexibly customize the fine-tuning of 100+ LLMs without the need for coding\nthrough the built-in web UI LlamaBoard. We empirically validate the efficiency\nand effectiveness of our framework on language modeling and text generation\ntasks. It has been released at https://github.com/hiyouga/LLaMA-Factory and\nalready received over 13,000 stars and 1,600 forks.&quot;,&quot;upvotes&quot;:175,&quot;discussionId&quot;:&quot;65fbae8bdfd0ff86aa7a219d&quot;,&quot;projectPage&quot;:&quot;https://huggingface.co/spaces/hiyouga/LLaMA-Board&quot;,&quot;githubRepo&quot;:&quot;https://github.com/hiyouga/LLaMA-Factory&quot;,&quot;githubRepoAddedBy&quot;:&quot;user&quot;,&quot;ai_summary&quot;:&quot;LlamaFactory is a unified framework enabling efficient fine-tuning of large language models across various tasks using a web-based user interface.&quot;,&quot;ai_keywords&quot;:[&quot;efficient fine-tuning&quot;,&quot;large language models&quot;,&quot;LLaMA&quot;,&quot;LlamaFactory&quot;,&quot;LlamaBoard&quot;,&quot;language modeling&quot;,&quot;text generation&quot;],&quot;githubStars&quot;:64040},&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2024-03-20T04:08:54.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;LlamaFactory: Unified Efficient Fine-Tuning of 100+ Language Models&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Efficient fine-tuning is vital for adapting large language models (LLMs) to\ndownstream tasks. However, it requires non-trivial efforts to implement these\nmethods on different models. We present LlamaFactory, a unified framework that\nintegrates a suite of cutting-edge efficient training methods. It allows users\nto flexibly customize the fine-tuning of 100+ LLMs without the need for coding\nthrough the built-in web UI LlamaBoard. We empirically validate the efficiency\nand effectiveness of our framework on language modeling and text generation\ntasks. Towards Studio-Grade Character Animation via In-Context Learning of 3D-Consistent Pose Representations&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;63a369d98c0c89dcae3b8329&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/63a369d98c0c89dcae3b8329/AiH2zjy1cnt9OADAAZMLD.jpeg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Adina Yakefu&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;AdinaY&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Achieving character animation that meets studio-grade production standards remains challenging despite recent progress. Existing approaches can transfer motion from a driving video to a reference image, but often fail to preserve structural fidelity and temporal consistency in wild scenarios involving complex motion and cross-identity animations. In this work, we present SCAIL (Studio-grade Character Animation via In-context Learning), a framework designed to address these challenges from two key innovations. First, we propose a novel 3D pose representation, providing a more robust and flexible motion signal. Second, we introduce a full-context pose injection mechanism within a diffusion-transformer architecture, enabling effective spatio-temporal reasoning over full motion sequences. To align with studio-level requirements, we develop a curated data pipeline ensuring both diversity and quality, and establish a comprehensive benchmark for systematic evaluation. Experiments show that SCAIL achieves state-of-the-art performance and advances character animation toward studio-grade reliability and realism.&quot;,&quot;upvotes&quot;:19,&quot;discussionId&quot;:&quot;69363c263962c926cf68077f&quot;,&quot;projectPage&quot;:&quot;https://teal024.github.io/SCAIL/&quot;,&quot;githubRepo&quot;:&quot;https://github.com/teal024/SCAIL-Official&quot;,&quot;githubRepoAddedBy&quot;:&quot;auto&quot;,&quot;ai_summary&quot;:&quot;SCAIL framework improves character animation by using a novel 3D pose representation and a diffusion-transformer architecture with full-context pose injection, achieving studio-grade quality and realism.&quot;,&quot;ai_keywords&quot;:[&quot;3D pose representation&quot;,&quot;diffusion-transformer architecture&quot;,&quot;full-context pose injection&quot;,&quot;studio-grade animation&quot;,&quot;spatio-temporal reasoning&quot;,&quot;motion sequences&quot;],&quot;githubStars&quot;:196,&quot;organization&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;62ad27f19096e7f9ecb1853a&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;zai-org&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Z.ai&quot;,&quot;avatar&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/62dc173789b4cf157d36ebee/i_pxzM2ZDo3Ub-BEgIkE9.png&quot;}},&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-12-05T12:38:55.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;SCAIL: Towards Studio-Grade Character Animation via In-Context Learning of 3D-Consistent Pose Representations&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Achieving character animation that meets studio-grade production standards remains challenging despite recent progress. Existing approaches can transfer motion from a driving video to a reference image, but often fail to preserve structural fidelity and temporal consistency in wild scenarios involving complex motion and cross-identity animations. In this work, we present SCAIL (Studio-grade Character Animation via In-context Learning), a framework designed to address these challenges from two key innovations. First, we propose a novel 3D pose representation, providing a more robust and flexible motion signal. Second, we introduce a full-context pose injection mechanism within a diffusion-transformer architecture, enabling effective spatio-temporal reasoning over full motion sequences. To align with studio-level requirements, we develop a curated data pipeline ensuring both diversity and quality, and establish a comprehensive benchmark for systematic evaluation. Experiments show that SCAIL achieves state-of-the-art performance and advances character animation toward studio-grade reliability and realism.&quot;,&quot;mediaUrls&quot;:[&quot;https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/63a369d98c0c89dcae3b8329/WXrZe3fv7C3YRAazHHfZM.qt&quot;],&quot;thumbnail&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-thumbnails.huggingface.co/social-thumbnails/papers/2512.05905.png&quot;,&quot;numComments&quot;:2,&quot;upvoted&quot;:false,&quot;submittedBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;63a369d98c0c89dcae3b8329&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/63a369d98c0c89dcae3b8329/AiH2zjy1cnt9OADAAZMLD.jpeg&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Adina An Open Platform for AI Software Developers as Generalist\n  Agents&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;60f1abe7544c2adfd699860c&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/1674929746905-60f1abe7544c2adfd699860c.jpeg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:true,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;AK&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;akhaliq&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Software is one of the most powerful tools that we humans have at our\ndisposal; it allows a skilled programmer to interact with the world in complex\nand profound ways. At the same time, thanks to improvements in large language\nmodels (LLMs), there has also been a rapid development in AI agents that\ninteract with and affect change in their surrounding environments. In this\npaper, we introduce OpenDevin, a platform for the development of powerful and\nflexible AI agents that interact with the world in similar ways to those of a\nhuman developer: by writing code, interacting with a command line, and browsing\nthe web. We describe how the platform allows for the implementation of new\nagents, safe interaction with sandboxed environments for code execution,\ncoordination between multiple agents, and incorporation of evaluation\nbenchmarks. Based on our currently incorporated benchmarks, we perform an\nevaluation of agents over 15 challenging tasks, including software engineering\n(e.g., SWE-Bench) and web browsing (e.g., WebArena), among others. Released\nunder the permissive MIT license, OpenDevin is a community project spanning\nacademia and industry with more than 1.3K contributions from over 160\ncontributors and will improve going forward.&quot;,&quot;upvotes&quot;:74,&quot;discussionId&quot;:&quot;66a1b11fca8ee359d60b5bd5&quot;,&quot;githubRepo&quot;:&quot;https://github.com/opendevin/opendevin&quot;,&quot;githubRepoAddedBy&quot;:&quot;auto&quot;,&quot;ai_summary&quot;:&quot;OpenDevin is a platform for developing AI agents that interact with the world by writing code, using command lines, and browsing the web, with support for multiple agents and evaluation benchmarks.&quot;,&quot;ai_keywords&quot;:[&quot;large language models&quot;,&quot;OpenDevin&quot;,&quot;AI agents&quot;,&quot;code execution&quot;,&quot;sandboxed environments&quot;,&quot;evaluation benchmarks&quot;,&quot;SWE-Bench&quot;,&quot;WebArena&quot;],&quot;githubStars&quot;:65703},&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2024-07-23T13:50:43.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;OpenDevin: An Open Platform for AI Software Developers as Generalist\n  Agents&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Software is one of the most powerful tools that we humans have at our\ndisposal; it allows a skilled programmer to interact with the world in complex\nand profound ways. At the same time, thanks to improvements in large language\nmodels (LLMs), there has also been a rapid development in AI agents that\ninteract with and affect change in their surrounding environments. In this\npaper, we introduce OpenDevin, a platform for the development of powerful and\nflexible AI agents that interact with the world in similar ways to those of a\nhuman developer: by writing code, interacting with a command line, and browsing\nthe web. We describe how the platform allows for the implementation of new\nagents, safe interaction with sandboxed environments for code execution,\ncoordination between multiple agents, and incorporation of evaluation\nbenchmarks. Based on our currently incorporated benchmarks, we perform an\nevaluation of agents over 15 challenging tasks, including software engineering\n(e.g., SWE-Bench) and web browsing (e.g., WebArena), among others. Released\nunder the permissive MIT license, OpenDevin is a community project spanning\nacademia and industry with more than 1.3K contributions from over 160\ncontributors and will improve going forward.&quot;,&quot;thumbnail&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-thumbnails.huggingface.co/social-thumbnails/papers/2407.16741.png&quot;,&quot;numComments&quot;:5,&quot;upvoted&quot;:false,&quot;submittedBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;60f1abe7544c2adfd699860c&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/1674929746905-60f1abe7544c2adfd699860c.jpeg&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;AK&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;akhaliq&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:true,&quot;isHf&quot;:true,&quot;isHfAdmin&quot;:false,&quot;isMod&quot;:false,&quot;followerCount&quot;:8928},&quot;isAuthorParticipating&quot;:true},{&quot;paper&quot;:{&quot;id&quot;:&quot;2511.20347&quot;,&quot;authors&quot;:[{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;69268ffb243b2216fb75cb0b&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Chang Zheng&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;chujiezheng&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Chujie Chen&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;69268ffb243b2216fb75cb0e&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Kai Dang&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;69268ffb243b2216fb75cb0f&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;64e72776e9fc9d0475ef5188&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;/avatars/d32b9d4e1da5486c3d5f9b04fa29d167.svg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Shixuan Liu&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;liusx&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Shixuan Liu&quot;,&quot;status&quot;:&quot;claimed_verified&quot;,&quot;statusLastChangedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-12-04T08:50:48.243Z&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;69268ffb243b2216fb75cb10&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Bowen Yu&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;69268ffb243b2216fb75cb11&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;62088594a5943c8a8fc94560&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/1644733028938-62088594a5943c8a8fc94560.png&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;An Yang&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;yangapku&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;name&quot;:&quot;An Yang&quot;,&quot;status&quot;:&quot;claimed_verified&quot;,&quot;statusLastChangedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-11-26T11:31:25.265Z&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;69268ffb243b2216fb75cb12&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Shuai Bai&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;69268ffb243b2216fb75cb13&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Jingren Zhou&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;69268ffb243b2216fb75cb14&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Junyang Lin&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false}],&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-11-25T14:25:19.000Z&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyAt&quot;:&quot;2025-11-26T04:31:56.255Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Soft Adaptive Policy Optimization&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;63451cf0a05b51f7ded25505&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;/avatars/dec4bbee4a82b773fc58dfc2dce9dbeb.svg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;shuai bai&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;ShuaiBai623&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Reinforcement learning (RL) plays an increasingly important role in enhancing the reasoning capabilities of large language models (LLMs), yet stable and performant policy optimization remains challenging. Token-level importance ratios often exhibit high variance-a phenomenon exacerbated in Mixture-of-Experts models-leading to unstable updates. Existing group-based policy optimization methods, such as GSPO and GRPO, alleviate this problem via hard clipping, making it difficult to maintain both stability and effective learning. We propose Soft Adaptive Policy Optimization (SAPO), which replaces hard clipping with a smooth, temperature-controlled gate that adaptively attenuates off-policy updates while preserving useful learning signals. Compared with GSPO and GRPO, SAPO is both sequence-coherent and token-adaptive. Like GSPO, SAPO maintains sequence-level coherence, but its soft gating forms a continuous trust region that avoids the brittle hard clipping band used in GSPO. When a sequence contains a few highly off-policy tokens, GSPO suppresses all gradients for that sequence, whereas SAPO selectively down-weights only the offending tokens and preserves the learning signal from the near-on-policy ones, improving sample efficiency. Relative to GRPO, SAPO replaces hard token-level clipping with smooth, temperature-controlled scaling, enabling more informative and stable updates. Empirical results on mathematical reasoning benchmarks indicate that SAPO exhibits improved training stability and higher Pass@1 performance under comparable training budgets. Moreover, we employ SAPO to train the Qwen3-VL model series, demonstrating that SAPO yields consistent performance gains across diverse tasks and different model sizes. Overall, SAPO provides a more reliable, scalable, and effective optimization strategy for RL training of LLMs.&quot;,&quot;upvotes&quot;:40,&quot;discussionId&quot;:&quot;69268ffb243b2216fb75cb15&quot;,&quot;projectPage&quot;:&quot;https://swift.readthedocs.io/en/latest/Instruction/GRPO/AdvancedResearch/SAPO.html&quot;,&quot;githubRepo&quot;:&quot;https://github.com/modelscope/ms-swift&quot;,&quot;githubRepoAddedBy&quot;:&quot;auto&quot;,&quot;ai_summary&quot;:&quot;Soft Adaptive Policy Optimization (SAPO) enhances the stability and performance of reinforcement learning in large language models by adaptively attenuating off-policy updates with a smooth, temperature-controlled gate, leading to improved training stability and performance.&quot;,&quot;ai_keywords&quot;:[&quot;reinforcement learning&quot;,&quot;large language models&quot;,&quot;policy optimization&quot;,&quot;token-level importance ratios&quot;,&quot;Mixture-of-Experts models&quot;,&quot;GSPO&quot;,&quot;GRPO&quot;,&quot;Soft Adaptive Policy Optimization&quot;,&quot;sequence-coherent&quot;,&quot;token-adaptive&quot;,&quot;sequence-level coherence&quot;,&quot;off-policy updates&quot;,&quot;sample efficiency&quot;,&quot;Pass@1 performance&quot;,&quot;Qwen3-VL model series&quot;],&quot;githubStars&quot;:11674,&quot;organization&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;64c8b5837fe12ecd0a7e92eb&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Qwen&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Qwen&quot;,&quot;avatar&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/620760a26e3b7210c2ff1943/-s1gyJfvbE1RgO5iBeNOi.png&quot;}},&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-11-25T09:25:19.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Soft Adaptive Policy Optimization&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Reinforcement learning (RL) plays an increasingly important role in enhancing the reasoning capabilities of large language models (LLMs), yet stable and performant policy optimization remains challenging. Token-level importance ratios often exhibit high variance-a phenomenon exacerbated in Mixture-of-Experts models-leading to unstable updates. Existing group-based policy optimization methods, such as GSPO and GRPO, alleviate this problem via hard clipping, making it difficult to maintain both stability and effective learning. We propose Soft Adaptive Policy Optimization (SAPO), which replaces hard clipping with a smooth, temperature-controlled gate that adaptively attenuates off-policy updates while preserving useful learning signals. Compared with GSPO and GRPO, SAPO is both sequence-coherent and token-adaptive. Like GSPO, SAPO maintains sequence-level coherence, but its soft gating forms a continuous trust region that avoids the brittle hard clipping band used in GSPO. When a sequence contains a few highly off-policy tokens, GSPO suppresses all gradients for that sequence, whereas SAPO selectively down-weights only the offending tokens and preserves the learning signal from the near-on-policy ones, improving sample efficiency. Relative to GRPO, SAPO replaces hard token-level clipping with smooth, temperature-controlled scaling, enabling more informative and stable updates. Empirical results on mathematical reasoning benchmarks indicate that SAPO exhibits improved training stability and higher Pass@1 performance under comparable training budgets. Moreover, we employ SAPO to train the Qwen3-VL model series, demonstrating that SAPO yields consistent performance gains across diverse tasks and different model sizes. Overall, SAPO provides a more reliable, scalable, and effective optimization strategy for RL training of LLMs.&quot;,&quot;thumbnail&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-thumbnails.huggingface.co/social-thumbnails/papers/2511.20347.png&quot;,&quot;numComments&quot;:5,&quot;upvoted&quot;:false,&quot;submittedBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;63451cf0a05b51f7ded25505&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;/avatars/dec4bbee4a82b773fc58dfc2dce9dbeb.svg&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;shuai bai&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;ShuaiBai623&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;isHf&quot;:false,&quot;isHfAdmin&quot;:false,&quot;isMod&quot;:false,&quot;followerCount&quot;:42},&quot;organization&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;64c8b5837fe12ecd0a7e92eb&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Qwen&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Qwen&quot;,&quot;avatar&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/620760a26e3b7210c2ff1943/-s1gyJfvbE1RgO5iBeNOi.png&quot;},&quot;isAuthorParticipating&quot;:false},{&quot;paper&quot;:{&quot;id&quot;:&quot;2410.05779&quot;,&quot;authors&quot;:[{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;670d11afc611292cb25116ad&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Zirui Guo&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;670d11afc611292cb25116ae&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Lianghao Xia&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;670d11afc611292cb25116af&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Yanhua Yu&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;670d11afc611292cb25116b0&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Tu
