Huang&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false}],&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2024-10-08T08:00:12.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;LightRAG: Simple and Fast Retrieval-Augmented Generation&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) systems enhance large language models\n(LLMs) by integrating external knowledge sources, enabling more accurate and\ncontextually relevant responses tailored to user needs. However, existing RAG\nsystems have significant limitations, including reliance on flat data\nrepresentations and inadequate contextual awareness, which can lead to\nfragmented answers that fail to capture complex inter-dependencies. To address\nthese challenges, we propose LightRAG, which incorporates graph structures into\ntext indexing and retrieval processes. This innovative framework employs a\ndual-level retrieval system that enhances comprehensive information retrieval\nfrom both low-level and high-level knowledge discovery. Additionally, the\nintegration of graph structures with vector representations facilitates\nefficient retrieval of related entities and their relationships, significantly\nimproving response times while maintaining contextual relevance. This\ncapability is further enhanced by an incremental update algorithm that ensures\nthe timely integration of new data, allowing the system to remain effective and\nresponsive in rapidly changing data environments. Extensive experimental\nvalidation demonstrates considerable improvements in retrieval accuracy and\nefficiency compared to existing approaches. We have made our LightRAG\nopen-source and available at the link: https://github.com/HKUDS/LightRAG.&quot;,&quot;upvotes&quot;:24,&quot;discussionId&quot;:&quot;670d11b0c611292cb25116dc&quot;,&quot;githubRepo&quot;:&quot;https://github.com/hkuds/lightrag&quot;,&quot;githubRepoAddedBy&quot;:&quot;auto&quot;,&quot;ai_summary&quot;:&quot;LightRAG improves Retrieval-Augmented Generation by integrating graph structures for enhanced contextual awareness and efficient information retrieval, achieving better accuracy and response times.&quot;,&quot;ai_keywords&quot;:[&quot;Retrieval-Augmented Generation&quot;,&quot;RAG&quot;,&quot;large language models&quot;,&quot;LLMs&quot;,&quot;external knowledge sources&quot;,&quot;graph structures&quot;,&quot;dual-level retrieval&quot;,&quot;vector representations&quot;,&quot;incremental update algorithm&quot;],&quot;githubStars&quot;:26002},&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2024-10-08T04:00:12.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;LightRAG: Simple and Fast Retrieval-Augmented Generation&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) systems enhance large language models\n(LLMs) by integrating external knowledge sources, enabling more accurate and\ncontextually relevant responses tailored to user needs. However, existing RAG\nsystems have significant limitations, including reliance on flat data\nrepresentations and inadequate contextual awareness, which can lead to\nfragmented answers that fail to capture complex inter-dependencies. To address\nthese challenges, we propose LightRAG, which incorporates graph structures into\ntext indexing and retrieval processes. This innovative framework employs a\ndual-level retrieval system that enhances comprehensive information retrieval\nfrom both low-level and high-level knowledge discovery. Additionally, the\nintegration of graph structures with vector representations facilitates\nefficient retrieval of related entities and their relationships, significantly\nimproving response times while maintaining contextual relevance. This\ncapability is further enhanced by an incremental update algorithm that ensures\nthe timely integration of new data, allowing the system to remain effective and\nresponsive in rapidly changing data environments. Extensive experimental\nvalidation demonstrates considerable improvements in retrieval accuracy and\nefficiency compared to existing approaches. We have made our LightRAG\nopen-source and available at the link: https://github.com/HKUDS/LightRAG.&quot;,&quot;thumbnail&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-thumbnails.huggingface.co/social-thumbnails/papers/2410.05779.png&quot;,&quot;numComments&quot;:0,&quot;upvoted&quot;:false,&quot;isAuthorParticipating&quot;:false},{&quot;paper&quot;:{&quot;id&quot;:&quot;2512.11749&quot;,&quot;authors&quot;:[{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;693f754ef516c693246811c3&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;662887715d246621f33d2ce6&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;/avatars/3e0b1017b1e1bf284758ce840c174290.svg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Shi Scaling Up Text-to-Image Latent Diffusion Model Without Variational Autoencoder&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6039478ab3ecf716b1a5fd4d&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/6039478ab3ecf716b1a5fd4d/_Thy4E7taiSYBLKxEKJbT.jpeg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:true,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;taesiri&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;taesiri&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Visual generation grounded in Visual Foundation Model (VFM) representations offers a highly promising unified pathway for integrating visual understanding, perception, and generation. Despite this potential, training large-scale text-to-image diffusion models entirely within the VFM representation space remains largely unexplored. To bridge this gap, we scale the SVG (Self-supervised representations for Visual Generation) framework, proposing SVG-T2I to support high-quality text-to-image synthesis directly in the VFM feature domain. By leveraging a standard text-to-image diffusion pipeline, SVG-T2I achieves competitive performance, reaching 0.75 on GenEval and 85.78 on DPG-Bench. This performance validates the intrinsic representational power of VFMs for generative tasks. We fully open-source the project, including the autoencoder and generation model, together with their training, inference, evaluation pipelines, and pre-trained weights, to facilitate further research in representation-driven visual generation.&quot;,&quot;upvotes&quot;:34,&quot;discussionId&quot;:&quot;693f754ff516c693246811d1&quot;,&quot;githubRepo&quot;:&quot;https://github.com/KlingTeam/SVG-T2I&quot;,&quot;githubRepoAddedBy&quot;:&quot;user&quot;,&quot;ai_summary&quot;:&quot;SVG-T2I, a scaled SVG framework, enables high-quality text-to-image synthesis directly in the Visual Foundation Model feature domain, achieving competitive performance in generative tasks.&quot;,&quot;ai_keywords&quot;:[&quot;Visual Foundation Model&quot;,&quot;VFM&quot;,&quot;SVG&quot;,&quot;Self-supervised representations for Visual Generation&quot;,&quot;SVG-T2I&quot;,&quot;text-to-image diffusion&quot;,&quot;GenEval&quot;,&quot;DPG-Bench&quot;,&quot;autoencoder&quot;,&quot;generation model&quot;],&quot;githubStars&quot;:56,&quot;organization&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;662c559b322afcbae51b3c8b&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;KlingTeam&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Kling Team&quot;,&quot;avatar&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/60e272ca6c78a8c122b12127/ZQV1aKLUDPf2rUcxxAqj6.jpeg&quot;}},&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-12-12T12:45:03.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;SVG-T2I: Scaling Up Text-to-Image Latent Diffusion Model Without Variational Autoencoder&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Visual generation grounded in Visual Foundation Model (VFM) representations offers a highly promising unified pathway for integrating visual understanding, perception, and generation. Despite this potential, training large-scale text-to-image diffusion models entirely within the VFM representation space remains largely unexplored. To bridge this gap, we scale the SVG (Self-supervised representations for Visual Generation) framework, proposing SVG-T2I to support high-quality text-to-image synthesis directly in the VFM feature domain. By leveraging a standard text-to-image diffusion pipeline, SVG-T2I achieves competitive performance, reaching 0.75 on GenEval and 85.78 on DPG-Bench. This performance validates the intrinsic representational power of VFMs for generative tasks. We fully open-source the project, including the autoencoder and generation model, together with their training, inference, evaluation pipelines, and pre-trained weights, to facilitate further research in representation-driven visual generation.&quot;,&quot;mediaUrls&quot;:[&quot;https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/6039478ab3ecf716b1a5fd4d/V8NQYwKC-8n2SbplK5Ag7.png&quot;],&quot;thumbnail&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-thumbnails.huggingface.co/social-thumbnails/papers/2512.11749.png&quot;,&quot;numComments&quot;:3,&quot;upvoted&quot;:false,&quot;submittedBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6039478ab3ecf716b1a5fd4d&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/6039478ab3ecf716b1a5fd4d/_Thy4E7taiSYBLKxEKJbT.jpeg&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;taesiri&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;taesiri&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:true,&quot;isHf&quot;:false,&quot;isHfAdmin&quot;:false,&quot;isMod&quot;:false,&quot;followerCount&quot;:185},&quot;organization&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;662c559b322afcbae51b3c8b&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;KlingTeam&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Kling Team&quot;,&quot;avatar&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/60e272ca6c78a8c122b12127/ZQV1aKLUDPf2rUcxxAqj6.jpeg&quot;},&quot;isAuthorParticipating&quot;:true},{&quot;paper&quot;:{&quot;id&quot;:&quot;2509.13232&quot;,&quot;authors&quot;:[{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;68ca17a96e0073c09bd1de5f&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;672db76fa34d64e774fc42c9&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;/avatars/be529f4bfcc40514697facbe8e874735.svg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Zhongwen Xu&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;zhongwenxu&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Zhongwen Xu&quot;,&quot;status&quot;:&quot;claimed_verified&quot;,&quot;statusLastChangedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-09-21T13:13:19.734Z&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;68ca17a96e0073c09bd1de60&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Zihan Ding&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false}],&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-09-16T16:39:11.000Z&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyAt&quot;:&quot;2025-09-17T00:38:24.543Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Single-stream Policy Optimization&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;672db76fa34d64e774fc42c9&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;/avatars/be529f4bfcc40514697facbe8e874735.svg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Zhongwen Xu&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;zhongwenxu&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;We revisit policy-gradient optimization for Large Language Models (LLMs) from\na single-stream perspective. Prevailing group-based methods like GRPO reduce\nvariance with on-the-fly baselines but suffer from critical flaws: frequent\ndegenerate groups erase learning signals, and synchronization barriers hinder\nscalability. We introduce Single-stream Policy Optimization (SPO), which\neliminates these issues by design. SPO replaces per-group baselines with a\npersistent, KL-adaptive value tracker and normalizes advantages globally across\nthe batch, providing a stable, low-variance learning signal for every sample.\nBeing group-free, SPO enables higher throughput and scales effectively in\nlong-horizon or tool-integrated settings where generation times vary.\nFurthermore, the persistent value tracker naturally enables an adaptive\ncurriculum via prioritized sampling. Experiments using Qwen3-8B show that SPO\nconverges more smoothly and attains higher accuracy than GRPO, while\neliminating computation wasted on degenerate groups. Ablation studies confirm\nthat SPO's gains stem from its principled approach to baseline estimation and\nadvantage normalization, offering a more robust and efficient path for LLM\nreasoning. Across five hard math benchmarks with Qwen3 8B, SPO improves the\naverage maj@32 by +3.4 percentage points (pp) over GRPO, driven by substantial\nabsolute point gains on challenging datasets, including +7.3 pp on BRUMO 25,\n+4.4 pp on AIME 25, +3.3 pp on HMMT 25, and achieves consistent relative gain\nin pass@k across the evaluated k values. SPO's success challenges the\nprevailing trend of adding incidental complexity to RL algorithms, highlighting\na path where fundamental principles, not architectural workarounds, drive the\nnext wave of progress in LLM reasoning.&quot;,&quot;upvotes&quot;:33,&quot;discussionId&quot;:&quot;68ca17a96e0073c09bd1de61&quot;,&quot;projectPage&quot;:&quot;https://zhongwenxu.notion.site/Single-stream-Policy-Optimization-26a1c4e140e380d78d51fa4567727f50&quot;,&quot;githubRepo&quot;:&quot;https://github.com/volcengine/verl&quot;,&quot;githubRepoAddedBy&quot;:&quot;auto&quot;,&quot;ai_summary&quot;:&quot;Single-stream Policy Optimization (SPO) improves policy-gradient training for Large Language Models by eliminating group-based issues and providing a stable, low-variance learning signal, leading to better performance and efficiency.&quot;,&quot;ai_keywords&quot;:[&quot;policy-gradient optimization&quot;,&quot;Large Language Models (LLMs)&quot;,&quot;GRPO&quot;,&quot;variance reduction&quot;,&quot;on-the-fly baselines&quot;,&quot;degenerate groups&quot;,&quot;synchronization barriers&quot;,&quot;Single-stream Policy Optimization (SPO)&quot;,&quot;KL-adaptive value tracker&quot;,&quot;advantage normalization&quot;,&quot;adaptive curriculum&quot;,&quot;prioritized sampling&quot;,&quot;Qwen3-8B&quot;,&quot;hard math benchmarks&quot;,&quot;maj@32&quot;,&quot;BRUMO 25&quot;,&quot;AIME 25&quot;,&quot;HMMT 25&quot;,&quot;pass@$k$&quot;],&quot;githubStars&quot;:17507,&quot;organization&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;66543b6e420092799d2f625c&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;tencent&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Tencent&quot;,&quot;avatar&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/5dd96eb166059660ed1ee413/Lp3m-XLpjQGwBItlvn69q.png&quot;}},&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-09-16T12:39:11.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Single-stream Policy Optimization&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;We revisit policy-gradient optimization for Large Language Models (LLMs) from\na single-stream perspective. Prevailing group-based methods like GRPO reduce\nvariance with on-the-fly baselines but suffer from critical flaws: frequent\ndegenerate groups erase learning signals, and synchronization barriers hinder\nscalability. We introduce Single-stream Policy Optimization (SPO), which\neliminates these issues by design. SPO replaces per-group baselines with a\npersistent, KL-adaptive value tracker and normalizes advantages globally across\nthe batch, providing a stable, low-variance learning signal for every sample.\nBeing group-free, SPO enables higher throughput and scales effectively in\nlong-horizon or tool-integrated settings where generation times vary.\nFurthermore, the persistent value tracker naturally enables an adaptive\ncurriculum via prioritized sampling. Experiments using Qwen3-8B show that SPO\nconverges more smoothly and attains higher accuracy than GRPO, while\neliminating computation wasted on degenerate groups. Ablation studies confirm\nthat SPO's gains stem from its principled approach to baseline estimation and\nadvantage normalization, offering a more robust and efficient path for LLM\nreasoning. Across five hard math benchmarks with Qwen3 8B, SPO improves the\naverage maj@32 by +3.4 percentage points (pp) over GRPO, driven by substantial\nabsolute point gains on challenging datasets, including +7.3 pp on BRUMO 25,\n+4.4 pp on AIME 25, +3.3 pp on HMMT 25, and achieves consistent relative gain\nin pass@k across the evaluated k values. SPO's success challenges the\nprevailing trend of adding incidental complexity to RL algorithms, highlighting\na path where fundamental principles, not architectural workarounds, drive the\nnext wave of progress in LLM reasoning.&quot;,&quot;thumbnail&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-thumbnails.huggingface.co/social-thumbnails/papers/2509.13232.png&quot;,&quot;numComments&quot;:3,&quot;upvoted&quot;:false,&quot;submittedBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;672db76fa34d64e774fc42c9&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;/avatars/be529f4bfcc40514697facbe8e874735.svg&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Zhongwen Xu&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;zhongwenxu&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;isHf&quot;:false,&quot;isHfAdmin&quot;:false,&quot;isMod&quot;:false},&quot;organization&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;66543b6e420092799d2f625c&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;tencent&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Tencent&quot;,&quot;avatar&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/5dd96eb166059660ed1ee413/Lp3m-XLpjQGwBItlvn69q.png&quot;},&quot;isAuthorParticipating&quot;:true},{&quot;paper&quot;:{&quot;id&quot;:&quot;2506.04106&quot;,&quot;authors&quot;:[{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6940cb8d65f1e24a1177fd9e&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Xiao Xiang Zhu&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6940cb8d65f1e24a1177fd9f&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Sining Chen&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6940cb8d65f1e24a1177fda0&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Fahong Zhang&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6940cb8d65f1e24a1177fda1&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Yilei Shi&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6940cb8d65f1e24a1177fda2&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Yuanyuan Wang&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false}],&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-06-04T15:59:32.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;GlobalBuildingAtlas: An Open Global and Complete Dataset of Building Polygons, Heights and LoD1 3D Models&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;We introduce GlobalBuildingAtlas, a publicly available dataset providing global and complete coverage of building polygons, heights and Level of Detail 1 (LoD1) 3D building models. This is the first open dataset to offer high quality, consistent, and complete building data in 2D and 3D form at the individual building level on a global scale. Towards this dataset, we developed machine learning-based pipelines to derive building polygons and heights (called GBA.Height) from global PlanetScope satellite data, respectively. Also a quality-based fusion strategy was employed to generate higher-quality polygons (called GBA.Polygon) based on existing open building polygons, including our own derived one. With more than 2.75 billion buildings worldwide, GBA.Polygon surpasses the most comprehensive database to date by more than 1 billion buildings. GBA.Height offers the most detailed and accurate global 3D building height maps to date, achieving a spatial resolution of 3x3 meters-30 times finer than previous global products (90 m), enabling a high-resolution and reliable analysis of building volumes at both local and global scales. Finally, we generated a global LoD1 building model (called GBA.LoD1) from the resulting GBA.Polygon and GBA.Height. GBA.LoD1 represents the first complete global LoD1 building models, including 2.68 billion building instances with predicted heights, i.e., with a height completeness of more than 97%, achieving RMSEs ranging from 1.5 m to 8.9 m across different continents. With its height accuracy, comprehensive global coverage and rich spatial details, GlobalBuildingAltas offers novel insights on the status quo of global buildings, which unlocks unprecedented geospatial analysis possibilities, as showcased by a better illustration of where people live and a more comprehensive monitoring of the progress on the 11th Sustainable Development Goal of the United Nations.&quot;,&quot;upvotes&quot;:0,&quot;discussionId&quot;:&quot;6940cb8d65f1e24a1177fdbd&quot;,&quot;projectPage&quot;:&quot;https://mediatum.ub.tum.de/1782307&quot;,&quot;githubRepo&quot;:&quot;https://github.com/zhu-xlab/GlobalBuildingAtlas&quot;,&quot;githubRepoAddedBy&quot;:&quot;auto&quot;,&quot;githubStars&quot;:1588},&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-06-04T11:59:32.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;GlobalBuildingAtlas: An Open Global and Complete Dataset of Building Polygons, Heights and LoD1 3D Models&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;We introduce GlobalBuildingAtlas, a publicly available dataset providing global and complete coverage of building polygons, heights and Level of Detail 1 (LoD1) 3D building models. This is the first open dataset to offer high quality, consistent, and complete building data in 2D and 3D form at the individual building level on a global scale. Towards this dataset, we developed machine learning-based pipelines to derive building polygons and heights (called GBA.Height) from global PlanetScope satellite data, respectively. Also a quality-based fusion strategy was employed to generate higher-quality polygons (called GBA.Polygon) based on existing open building polygons, including our own derived one. With more than 2.75 billion buildings worldwide, GBA.Polygon surpasses the most comprehensive database to date by more than 1 billion buildings. GBA.Height offers the most detailed and accurate global 3D building height maps to date, achieving a spatial resolution of 3x3 meters-30 times finer than previous global products (90 m), enabling a high-resolution and reliable analysis of building volumes at both local and global scales. Finally, we generated a global LoD1 building model (called GBA.LoD1) from the resulting GBA.Polygon and GBA.Height. GBA.LoD1 represents the first complete global LoD1 building models, including 2.68 billion building instances with predicted heights, i.e., with a height completeness of more than 97%, achieving RMSEs ranging from 1.5 m to 8.9 m across different continents. With its height accuracy, comprehensive global coverage and rich spatial details, GlobalBuildingAltas offers novel insights on the status quo of global buildings, which unlocks unprecedented geospatial analysis possibilities, as showcased by a better illustration of where people live and a more comprehensive monitoring of the progress on the 11th Sustainable Development Goal of the United Nations.&quot;,&quot;thumbnail&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-thumbnails.huggingface.co/social-thumbnails/papers/2506.04106.png&quot;,&quot;numComments&quot;:0,&quot;upvoted&quot;:false,&quot;isAuthorParticipating&quot;:false},{&quot;paper&quot;:{&quot;id&quot;:&quot;2511.22940&quot;,&quot;authors&quot;:[{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;692ffb3226742347f61db11e&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Shijun Shi&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;692ffb3226742347f61db11f&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Jing Xu&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;692ffb3226742347f61db120&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Zhihang Li&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;692ffb3226742347f61db121&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Chunli Peng&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;692ffb3226742347f61db122&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Xiaoda Yang&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;692ffb3226742347f61db123&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Lijing Lu&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;692ffb3226742347f61db124&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Kai Hu&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;692ffb3226742347f61db125&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Jiangning Zhang&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false}],&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-11-28T07:30:10.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;One-to-All Animation: Alignment-Free Character Animation and Image Pose Transfer&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Recent advances in diffusion models have greatly improved pose-driven character animation. However, existing methods are limited to spatially aligned reference-pose pairs with matched skeletal structures. Handling reference-pose misalignment remains unsolved. To address this, we present One-to-All Animation, a unified framework for high-fidelity character animation and image pose transfer for references with arbitrary layouts. First, to handle spatially misaligned reference, we reformulate training as a self-supervised outpainting task that transforms diverse-layout reference into a unified occluded-input format. Second, to process partially visible reference, we design a reference extractor for comprehensive identity feature extraction. Further, we integrate hybrid reference fusion attention to handle varying resolutions and dynamic sequence lengths. Finally, from the perspective of generation quality, we introduce identity-robust pose control that decouples appearance from skeletal structure to mitigate pose overfitting, and a token replace strategy for coherent long-video generation. Extensive experiments show that our method outperforms existing approaches. The code and model are available at https://github.com/ssj9596/One-to-All-Animation.&quot;,&quot;upvotes&quot;:1,&quot;discussionId&quot;:&quot;692ffb3226742347f61db126&quot;,&quot;projectPage&quot;:&quot;https://ssj9596.github.io/one-to-all-animation-project/&quot;,&quot;githubRepo&quot;:&quot;https://github.com/ssj9596/One-to-All-Animation&quot;,&quot;githubRepoAddedBy&quot;:&quot;auto&quot;,&quot;ai_summary&quot;:&quot;A unified framework for high-fidelity character animation and image pose transfer handles misaligned and partially visible references, using self-supervised outpainting, hybrid attention, and identity-robust pose control.&quot;,&quot;ai_keywords&quot;:[&quot;diffusion models&quot;,&quot;pose-driven character animation&quot;,&quot;spatially misaligned reference&quot;,&quot;self-supervised outpainting&quot;,&quot;reference extractor&quot;,&quot;hybrid reference fusion attention&quot;,&quot;identity-robust pose control&quot;,&quot;token replace strategy&quot;,&quot;coherent long-video generation&quot;],&quot;githubStars&quot;:281},&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-11-28T02:30:10.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;One-to-All Animation: Alignment-Free Character Animation and Image Pose Transfer&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Recent advances in diffusion models have greatly improved pose-driven character animation. However, existing methods are limited to spatially aligned reference-pose pairs with matched skeletal structures. Handling reference-pose misalignment remains unsolved. To address this, we present One-to-All Animation, a unified framework for high-fidelity character animation and image pose transfer for references with arbitrary layouts. First, to handle spatially misaligned reference, we reformulate training as a self-supervised outpainting task that transforms diverse-layout reference into a unified occluded-input format. Second, to process partially visible reference, we design a reference extractor for comprehensive identity feature extraction. Further, we integrate hybrid reference fusion attention to handle varying resolutions and dynamic sequence lengths. Finally, from the perspective of generation quality, we introduce identity-robust pose control that decouples appearance from skeletal structure to mitigate pose overfitting, and a token replace strategy for coherent long-video generation. Extensive experiments show that our method outperforms existing approaches. The code and model are available at https://github.com/ssj9596/One-to-All-Animation.&quot;,&quot;thumbnail&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-thumbnails.huggingface.co/social-thumbnails/papers/2511.22940.png&quot;,&quot;numComments&quot;:3,&quot;upvoted&quot;:false,&quot;isAuthorParticipating&quot;:false},{&quot;paper&quot;:{&quot;id&quot;:&quot;2510.12323&quot;,&quot;authors&quot;:[{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;68efa8045178b1b97206b296&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Zirui Guo&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;68efa8045178b1b97206b297&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Xubin Ren&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;68efa8045178b1b97206b298&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Lingrui Xu&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;68efa8045178b1b97206b299&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Jiahao Zhang&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;68efa8045178b1b97206b29a&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Chao Huang&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false}],&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-10-14T09:25:35.000Z&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyAt&quot;:&quot;2025-10-15T12:27:59.630Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;RAG-Anything: All-in-One RAG Framework&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;631728389e6b629ba04d3012&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/631728389e6b629ba04d3012/2yihb49Sw-ue_BKTlhZWE.jpeg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Xubin Ren&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;Rbin&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) has emerged as a fundamental paradigm\nfor expanding Large Language Models beyond their static training limitations.\nHowever, a critical misalignment exists between current RAG capabilities and\nreal-world information environments. Modern knowledge repositories are\ninherently multimodal, containing rich combinations of textual content, visual\nelements, structured tables, and mathematical expressions. Yet existing RAG\nframeworks are limited to textual content, creating fundamental gaps when\nprocessing multimodal documents. We present RAG-Anything, a unified framework\nthat enables comprehensive knowledge retrieval across all modalities. Our\napproach reconceptualizes multimodal content as interconnected knowledge\nentities rather than isolated data types. The framework introduces dual-graph\nconstruction to capture both cross-modal relationships and textual semantics\nwithin a unified representation. We develop cross-modal hybrid retrieval that\ncombines structural knowledge navigation with semantic matching. This enables\neffective reasoning over heterogeneous content where relevant evidence spans\nmultiple modalities. RAG-Anything demonstrates superior performance on\nchallenging multimodal benchmarks, achieving significant improvements over\nstate-of-the-art methods. Performance gains become particularly pronounced on\nlong documents where traditional approaches fail. Our framework establishes a\nnew paradigm for multimodal knowledge access, eliminating the architectural\nfragmentation that constrains current systems. Our framework is open-sourced\nat: https://github.com/HKUDS/RAG-Anything.&quot;,&quot;upvotes&quot;:52,&quot;discussionId&quot;:&quot;68efa8045178b1b97206b29b&quot;,&quot;githubRepo&quot;:&quot;https://github.com/HKUDS/RAG-Anything&quot;,&quot;githubRepoAddedBy&quot;:&quot;user&quot;,&quot;ai_summary&quot;:&quot;RAG-Anything is a unified framework that enhances multimodal knowledge retrieval by integrating cross-modal relationships and semantic matching, outperforming existing methods on complex benchmarks.&quot;,&quot;ai_keywords&quot;:[&quot;Retrieval-Augmented Generation&quot;,&quot;RAG&quot;,&quot;Large Language Models&quot;,&quot;multimodal&quot;,&quot;textual content&quot;,&quot;visual elements&quot;,&quot;structured tables&quot;,&quot;mathematical expressions&quot;,&quot;dual-graph construction&quot;,&quot;cross-modal hybrid retrieval&quot;,&quot;structural knowledge navigation&quot;,&quot;semantic matching&quot;,&quot;multimodal benchmarks&quot;,&quot;long documents&quot;],&quot;githubStars&quot;:11101,&quot;organization&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;66b9f52ea0ebe4b8a533017d&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;hkuds&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Data Intelligence Lab@HKU&quot;,&quot;avatar&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/631728389e6b629ba04d3012/_wpzD-zUk5LR0RMxifyNX.jpeg&quot;}},&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-10-14T05:25:35.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;RAG-Anything: All-in-One RAG Framework&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) has emerged as a fundamental paradigm\nfor expanding Large Language Models beyond their static training limitations.\nHowever, a critical misalignment exists between current RAG capabilities and\nreal-world information environments. Modern knowledge repositories are\ninherently multimodal, containing rich combinations of textual content, visual\nelements, structured tables, and mathematical expressions. Yet existing RAG\nframeworks are limited to textual content, creating fundamental gaps when\nprocessing multimodal documents. We present RAG-Anything, a unified framework\nthat enables comprehensive knowledge retrieval across all modalities. Our\napproach reconceptualizes multimodal content as interconnected knowledge\nentities rather than isolated data types. The framework introduces dual-graph\nconstruction to capture both cross-modal relationships and textual semantics\nwithin a unified representation. We develop cross-modal hybrid retrieval that\ncombines structural knowledge navigation with semantic matching. This enables\neffective reasoning over heterogeneous content where relevant evidence spans\nmultiple modalities. RAG-Anything demonstrates superior performance on\nchallenging multimodal benchmarks, achieving significant improvements over\nstate-of-the-art methods. Performance gains become particularly pronounced on\nlong documents where traditional approaches fail. Our framework establishes a\nnew paradigm for multimodal knowledge access, eliminating the architectural\nfragmentation that constrains current systems. Our framework is open-sourced\nat: https://github.com/HKUDS/RAG-Anything.&quot;,&quot;thumbnail&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-thumbnails.huggingface.co/social-thumbnails/papers/2510.12323.png&quot;,&quot;numComments&quot;:6,&quot;upvoted&quot;:false,&quot;submittedBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;631728389e6b629ba04d3012&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/631728389e6b629ba04d3012/2yihb49Sw-ue_BKTlhZWE.jpeg&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Xubin Ren&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Rbin&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;isHf&quot;:false,&quot;isHfAdmin&quot;:false,&quot;isMod&quot;:false,&quot;followerCount&quot;:6},&quot;organization&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;66b9f52ea0ebe4b8a533017d&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;hkuds&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Data Intelligence Lab@HKU&quot;,&quot;avatar&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/631728389e6b629ba04d3012/_wpzD-zUk5LR0RMxifyNX.jpeg&quot;},&quot;isAuthorParticipating&quot;:false},{&quot;paper&quot;:{&quot;id&quot;:&quot;2412.20138&quot;,&quot;authors&quot;:[{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6847673b3ec10bdd8ab4dd5e&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Yijia Xiao&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6847673b3ec10bdd8ab4dd5f&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Edward Sun&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6847673b3ec10bdd8ab4dd60&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Di Luo&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6847673b3ec10bdd8ab4dd61&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Wei Wang&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false}],&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2024-12-28T12:54:06.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;TradingAgents: Multi-Agents LLM Financial Trading Framework&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Significant progress has been made in automated problem-solving using\nsocieties of agents powered by large language models (LLMs). In finance,\nefforts have largely focused on single-agent systems handling specific tasks or\nmulti-agent frameworks independently gathering data. However, the multi-agent\nsystems' potential to replicate real-world trading firms' collaborative\ndynamics remains underexplored. TradingAgents proposes a novel stock trading\nframework inspired by trading firms, featuring LLM-powered agents in\nspecialized roles such as fundamental analysts, sentiment analysts, technical\nanalysts, and traders with varied risk profiles. The framework includes Bull\nand Bear researcher agents assessing market conditions, a risk management team\nmonitoring exposure, and traders synthesizing insights from debates and\nhistorical data to make informed decisions. By simulating a dynamic,\ncollaborative trading environment, this framework aims to improve trading\nperformance. Detailed architecture and extensive experiments reveal its\nsuperiority over baseline models, with notable improvements in cumulative\nreturns, Sharpe ratio, and maximum drawdown, highlighting the potential of\nmulti-agent LLM frameworks in financial trading. TradingAgents is available at\nhttps://github.com/TauricResearch/TradingAgents.&quot;,&quot;upvotes&quot;:14,&quot;discussionId&quot;:&quot;6847673c3ec10bdd8ab4dd62&quot;,&quot;githubRepo&quot;:&quot;https://github.com/tauricresearch/tradingagents&quot;,&quot;githubRepoAddedBy&quot;:&quot;auto&quot;,&quot;ai_summary&quot;:&quot;A multi-agent framework using large language models for stock trading simulates real-world trading firms, improving performance metrics like cumulative returns and Sharpe ratio.&quot;,&quot;ai_keywords&quot;:[&quot;large language models&quot;,&quot;LLM&quot;,&quot;multi-agent systems&quot;,&quot;fundamental analysts&quot;,&quot;sentiment analysts&quot;,&quot;technical analysts&quot;,&quot;traders&quot;,&quot;risk management&quot;,&quot;cumulative returns&quot;,&quot;Sharpe ratio&quot;,&quot;maximum drawdown&quot;],&quot;githubStars&quot;:26643},&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2024-12-28T07:54:06.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;TradingAgents: Multi-Agents LLM Financial Trading Framework&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Significant progress has been made in automated problem-solving using\nsocieties of agents powered by large language models (LLMs). In finance,\nefforts have largely focused on single-agent systems handling specific tasks or\nmulti-agent frameworks independently gathering data. However, the multi-agent\nsystems' potential to replicate real-world trading firms' collaborative\ndynamics remains underexplored. TradingAgents proposes a novel stock trading\nframework inspired by trading firms, featuring LLM-powered agents in\nspecialized roles such as fundamental analysts, sentiment analysts, technical\nanalysts, and traders with varied risk profiles. The framework includes Bull\nand Bear researcher agents assessing market conditions, a risk management team\nmonitoring exposure, and traders synthesizing insights from debates and\nhistorical data to make informed decisions. By simulating a dynamic,\ncollaborative trading environment, this framework aims to improve trading\nperformance. Detailed architecture and extensive experiments reveal its\nsuperiority over baseline models, with notable improvements in cumulative\nreturns, Sharpe ratio, and maximum drawdown, highlighting the potential of\nmulti-agent LLM frameworks in financial trading. TradingAgents is available at\nhttps://github.com/TauricResearch/TradingAgents.&quot;,&quot;thumbnail&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-thumbnails.huggingface.co/social-thumbnails/papers/2412.20138.png&quot;,&quot;numComments&quot;:0,&quot;upvoted&quot;:false,&quot;isAuthorParticipating&quot;:false},{&quot;paper&quot;:{&quot;id&quot;:&quot;2502.05512&quot;,&quot;authors&quot;:[{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;67af222945a2cebaa6dfc66d&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Wei Deng&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;67af222945a2cebaa6dfc66e&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Siyi Zhou&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;67af222945a2cebaa6dfc66f&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Jingchen Shu&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;67af222945a2cebaa6dfc670&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Jinchao Wang&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;67af222945a2cebaa6dfc671&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Lu Wang&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false}],&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-02-08T10:23:20.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;IndexTTS: An Industrial-Level Controllable and Efficient Zero-Shot\n  Text-To-Speech System&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Recently, large language model (LLM) based text-to-speech (TTS) systems have\ngradually become the mainstream in the industry due to their high naturalness\nand powerful zero-shot voice cloning capabilities.Here, we introduce the\nIndexTTS system, which is mainly based on the XTTS and Tortoise model. We add\nsome novel improvements. Specifically, in Chinese scenarios, we adopt a hybrid\nmodeling method that combines characters and pinyin, making the pronunciations\nof polyphonic characters and long-tail characters controllable. We also\nperformed a comparative analysis of the Vector Quantization (VQ) with\nFinite-Scalar Quantization (FSQ) for codebook utilization of acoustic speech\ntokens. To further enhance the effect and stability of voice cloning, we\nintroduce a conformer-based speech conditional encoder and replace the\nspeechcode decoder with BigVGAN2. Compared with XTTS, it has achieved\nsignificant improvements in naturalness, content consistency, and zero-shot\nvoice cloning. As for the popular TTS systems in the open-source, such as\nFish-Speech, CosyVoice2, FireRedTTS and F5-TTS, IndexTTS has a relatively\nsimple training process, more controllable usage, and faster inference speed.\nMoreover, its performance surpasses that of these systems. Our demos are\navailable at https://index-tts.github.io.&quot;,&quot;upvotes&quot;:6,&quot;discussionId&quot;:&quot;67af222a45a2cebaa6dfc691&quot;,&quot;projectPage&quot;:&quot;https://index-tts.github.io&quot;,&quot;githubRepo&quot;:&quot;https://github.com/index-tts/index-tts&quot;,&quot;githubRepoAddedBy&quot;:&quot;auto&quot;,&quot;ai_summary&quot;:&quot;IndexTTS, an enhanced text-to-speech system combining XTTS and Tortoise models, offers improved naturalness, enhanced voice cloning, and controllable usage through hybrid character-pinyin modeling and optimized vector quantization.&quot;,&quot;ai_keywords&quot;:[&quot;IndexTTS&quot;,&quot;XTTS&quot;,&quot;Tortoise&quot;,&quot;hybrid modeling&quot;,&quot;characters&quot;,&quot;pinyin&quot;,&quot;Vector Quantization (VQ)&quot;,&quot;Finite-Scalar Quantization (FSQ)&quot;,&quot;acoustic speech tokens&quot;,&quot;conformer-based speech conditional encoder&quot;,&quot;BigVGAN2&quot;,&quot;naturalness&quot;,&quot;content consistency&quot;,&quot;zero-shot voice cloning&quot;,&quot;Fish-Speech&quot;,&quot;CosyVoice2&quot;,&quot;FireRedTTS&quot;,&quot;F5-TTS&quot;],&quot;githubStars&quot;:16667},&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-02-08T05:23:20.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;IndexTTS: An Industrial-Level Controllable and Efficient Zero-Shot\n  Text-To-Speech System&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Recently, large language model (LLM) based text-to-speech (TTS) systems have\ngradually become the mainstream in the industry due to their high naturalness\nand powerful zero-shot voice cloning capabilities.Here, we introduce the\nIndexTTS system, which is mainly based on the XTTS and Tortoise model. We add\nsome novel improvements. Specifically, in Chinese scenarios, we adopt a hybrid\nmodeling method that combines characters and pinyin, making the pronunciations\nof polyphonic characters and long-tail characters controllable. We also\nperformed a comparative analysis of the Vector Quantization (VQ) with\nFinite-Scalar Quantization (FSQ) for codebook utilization of acoustic speech\ntokens. To further enhance the effect and stability of voice cloning, we\nintroduce a conformer-based speech conditional encoder and replace the\nspeechcode decoder with BigVGAN2. Compared with XTTS, it has achieved\nsignificant improvements in naturalness, content consistency, and zero-shot\nvoice cloning. As for the popular TTS systems in the open-source, such as\nFish-Speech, CosyVoice2, FireRedTTS and F5-TTS, IndexTTS has a relatively\nsimple training process, more controllable usage, and faster inference speed.\nMoreover, its performance surpasses that of these systems. Our demos are\navailable at https://index-tts.github.io.&quot;,&quot;thumbnail&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-thumbnails.huggingface.co/social-thumbnails/papers/2502.05512.png&quot;,&quot;numComments&quot;:0,&quot;upvoted&quot;:false,&quot;isAuthorParticipating&quot;:false},{&quot;paper&quot;:{&quot;id&quot;:&quot;2512.10950&quot;,&quot;authors&quot;:[{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6940d40765f1e24a1178045c&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Qitao Zhao&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6940d40765f1e24a1178045d&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Hao Tan&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6940d40765f1e24a1178045e&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Qianqian Wang&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6940d40765f1e24a1178045f&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Sai Bi&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6940d40765f1e24a11780460&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Kai Zhang&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6940d40765f1e24a11780461&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Kalyan Sunkavalli&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6940d40765f1e24a11780462&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Shubham Tulsiani&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6940d40765f1e24a11780463&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Hanwen Jiang&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false}],&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-12-11T18:59:53.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;E-RayZer: Self-supervised 3D Reconstruction as Spatial Visual Pre-training&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Self-supervised pre-training has revolutionized foundation models for languages, individual 2D images and videos, but remains largely unexplored for learning 3D-aware representations from multi-view images. In this paper, we present E-RayZer, a self-supervised large 3D Vision model that learns truly 3D-aware representations directly from unlabeled images. Unlike prior self-supervised methods such as RayZer that infer 3D indirectly through latent-space view synthesis, E-RayZer operates directly in 3D space, performing self-supervised 3D reconstruction with Explicit geometry. This formulation eliminates shortcut solutions and yields representations that are geometrically grounded. To ensure convergence and scalability, we introduce a novel fine-grained learning curriculum that organizes training from easy to hard samples and harmonizes heterogeneous data sources in an entirely unsupervised manner. Experiments demonstrate that E-RayZer significantly outperforms RayZer on pose estimation, matches or sometimes surpasses fully supervised reconstruction models such as VGGT. Furthermore, its learned representations outperform leading visual pre-training models (e.g., DINOv3, CroCo v2, VideoMAE V2, and RayZer) when transferring to 3D downstream tasks, establishing E-RayZer as a new paradigm for 3D-aware visual pre-training.&quot;,&quot;upvotes&quot;:0,&quot;discussionId&quot;:&quot;6940d40865f1e24a1178046a&quot;,&quot;projectPage&quot;:&quot;https://qitaozhao.github.io/E-RayZer&quot;,&quot;githubRepo&quot;:&quot;https://github.com/QitaoZhao/E-RayZer&quot;,&quot;githubRepoAddedBy&quot;:&quot;auto&quot;,&quot;ai_summary&quot;:&quot;E-RayZer is a self-supervised 3D Vision model that directly learns 3D-aware representations from unlabeled images, outperforming existing models in pose estimation and 3D reconstruction tasks.&quot;,&quot;ai_keywords&quot;:[&quot;self-supervised pre-training&quot;,&quot;3D Vision model&quot;,&quot;E-RayZer&quot;,&quot;3D-aware representations&quot;,&quot;RayZer&quot;,&quot;latent-space view synthesis&quot;,&quot;explicit geometry&quot;,&quot;learning curriculum&quot;,&quot;heterogeneous data sources&quot;,&quot;pose estimation&quot;,&quot;VGGT&quot;,&quot;DINOv3&quot;,&quot;CroCo v2&quot;,&quot;VideoMAE V2&quot;],&quot;githubStars&quot;:133},&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-12-11T13:59:53.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;E-RayZer: Self-supervised 3D Reconstruction as Spatial Visual Pre-training&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Self-supervised pre-training has revolutionized foundation models for languages, individual 2D images and videos, but remains largely unexplored for learning 3D-aware representations from multi-view images. In this paper, we present E-RayZer, a self-supervised large 3D Vision model that learns truly 3D-aware representations directly from unlabeled images. Unlike prior self-supervised methods such as RayZer that infer 3D indirectly through latent-space view synthesis, E-RayZer operates directly in 3D space, performing self-supervised 3D reconstruction with Explicit geometry. This formulation eliminates shortcut solutions and yields representations that are geometrically grounded. To ensure convergence and scalability, we introduce a novel fine-grained learning curriculum that organizes training from easy to hard samples and harmonizes heterogeneous data sources in an entirely unsupervised manner. Experiments demonstrate that E-RayZer significantly outperforms RayZer on pose estimation, matches or sometimes surpasses fully supervised reconstruction models such as VGGT. Furthermore, its learned representations outperform leading visual pre-training models (e.g., DINOv3, CroCo v2, VideoMAE V2, and RayZer) when transferring to 3D downstream tasks, establishing E-RayZer as a new paradigm for 3D-aware visual pre-training.&quot;,&quot;thumbnail&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-thumbnails.huggingface.co/social-thumbnails/papers/2512.10950.png&quot;,&quot;numComments&quot;:0,&quot;upvoted&quot;:false,&quot;isAuthorParticipating&quot;:false},{&quot;paper&quot;:{&quot;id&quot;:&quot;2512.04677&quot;,&quot;authors&quot;:[{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;693251d36d1060ca587a2746&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;66fe5e4de9e5b5c3e4be3014&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;/avatars/0c46d2554dc3a0b527e4d1bebfd692b1.svg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Yubo Chen&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;Hongni&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Enhong Chen&quot;,&quot;status&quot;:&quot;admin_assigned&quot;,&quot;statusLastChangedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-12-08T08:56:08.195Z&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;693251d36d1060ca587a274f&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;637c941588699fba70e29f70&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/637c941588699fba70e29f70/b6G_QZkT-MhE47dx87i0d.png&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:true,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;LIU JIAMING&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;jamesliu1217&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Jiaming Liu&quot;,&quot;status&quot;:&quot;claimed_verified&quot;,&quot;statusLastChangedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-12-05T08:29:19.340Z&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;693251d36d1060ca587a2750&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;65edc033fe1c0c877abf56de&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;/avatars/bde9c7deba1949e06da8368143736a12.svg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Steven hoi&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;stevenhoi&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Steven Hoi&quot;,&quot;status&quot;:&quot;admin_assigned&quot;,&quot;statusLastChangedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-12-08T08:56:14.636Z&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false}],&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-12-04T11:11:24.000Z&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyAt&quot;:&quot;2025-12-05T01:00:58.773Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Live Avatar: Streaming Real-time Audio-Driven Avatar Generation with Infinite Length&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;60f1abe7544c2adfd699860c&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/1674929746905-60f1abe7544c2adfd699860c.jpeg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:true,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;AK&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;akhaliq&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Existing diffusion-based video generation methods are fundamentally constrained by sequential computation and long-horizon inconsistency, limiting their practical adoption in real-time, streaming audio-driven avatar synthesis. We present Live Avatar, an algorithm-system co-designed framework that enables efficient, high-fidelity, and infinite-length avatar generation using a 14-billion-parameter diffusion model. Our approach introduces Timestep-forcing Pipeline Parallelism (TPP), a distributed inference paradigm that pipelines denoising steps across multiple GPUs, effectively breaking the autoregressive bottleneck and ensuring stable, low-latency real-time streaming. To further enhance temporal consistency and mitigate identity drift and color artifacts, we propose the Rolling Sink Frame Mechanism (RSFM), which maintains sequence fidelity by dynamically recalibrating appearance using a cached reference image. Additionally, we leverage Self-Forcing Distribution Matching Distillation to facilitate causal, streamable adaptation of large-scale models without sacrificing visual quality. Live Avatar demonstrates state-of-the-art performance, reaching 20 FPS end-to-end generation on 5 H800 GPUs, and, to the best of our knowledge, is the first to achieve practical, real-time, high-fidelity avatar generation at this scale. Our work establishes a new paradigm for deploying advanced diffusion models in industrial long-form video synthesis applications.&quot;,&quot;upvotes&quot;:166,&quot;discussionId&quot;:&quot;693251d46d1060ca587a2751&quot;,&quot;projectPage&quot;:&quot;https://liveavatar.github.io/&quot;,&quot;githubRepo&quot;:&quot;https://github.com/Alibaba-Quark/LiveAvatar&quot;,&quot;githubRepoAddedBy&quot;:&quot;user&quot;,&quot;ai_summary&quot;:&quot;Live Avatar uses a 14-billion-parameter diffusion model with Timestep-forcing Pipeline Parallelism and Rolling Sink Frame Mechanism to achieve real-time, high-fidelity avatar generation.&quot;,&quot;ai_keywords&quot;:[&quot;diffusion-based video generation&quot;,&quot;sequential computation&quot;,&quot;long-horizon inconsistency&quot;,&quot;real-time&quot;,&quot;streaming audio-driven avatar synthesis&quot;,&quot;Timestep-forcing Pipeline Parallelism&quot;,&quot;distributed inference paradigm&quot;,&quot;pipeline parallelism&quot;,&quot;denoising steps&quot;,&quot;autoregressive bottleneck&quot;,&quot;low-latency real-time streaming&quot;,&quot;Rolling Sink Frame Mechanism&quot;,&quot;sequence fidelity&quot;,&quot;Self-Forcing Distribution Matching Distillation&quot;,&quot;causal&quot;,&quot;streamable adaptation&quot;,&quot;visual quality&quot;,&quot;end-to-end generation&quot;,&quot;H800 GPUs&quot;],&quot;githubStars&quot;:1015,&quot;organization&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6765550c990bcf161cc7e94e&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Quark-LLM&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Quark&quot;,&quot;avatar&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/67655397f7ada4603851ddb3/v51dcR1-2Z-ndlUi-1jQI.png&quot;}},&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-12-04T06:11:24.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Live Avatar: Streaming Real-time Audio-Driven Avatar Generation with Infinite Length&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Existing diffusion-based video generation methods are fundamentally constrained by sequential computation and long-horizon inconsistency, limiting their practical adoption in real-time, streaming audio-driven avatar synthesis. We present Live Avatar, an algorithm-system co-designed framework that enables efficient, high-fidelity, and infinite-length avatar generation using a 14-billion-parameter diffusion model. Our approach introduces Timestep-forcing Pipeline Parallelism (TPP), a distributed inference paradigm that pipelines denoising steps across multiple GPUs, effectively breaking the autoregressive bottleneck and ensuring stable, low-latency real-time streaming. To further enhance temporal consistency and mitigate identity drift and color artifacts, we propose the Rolling Sink Frame Mechanism (RSFM), which maintains sequence fidelity by dynamically recalibrating appearance using a cached reference image. Additionally, we leverage Self-Forcing Distribution Matching Distillation to facilitate causal, streamable adaptation of large-scale models without sacrificing visual quality. Live Avatar demonstrates state-of-the-art performance, reaching 20 FPS end-to-end generation on 5 H800 GPUs, and, to the best of our knowledge, is the first to achieve practical, real-time, high-fidelity avatar generation at this scale. Our work establishes a new paradigm for deploying advanced diffusion models in industrial long-form video synthesis applications.&quot;,&quot;thumbnail&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-thumbnails.huggingface.co/social-thumbnails/papers/2512.04677.png&quot;,&quot;numComments&quot;:4,&quot;upvoted&quot;:false,&quot;submittedBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;60f1abe7544c2adfd699860c&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/1674929746905-60f1abe7544c2adfd699860c.jpeg&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;AK&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;akhaliq&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:true,&quot;isHf&quot;:true,&quot;isHfAdmin&quot;:false,&quot;isMod&quot;:false,&quot;followerCount&quot;:8928},&quot;organization&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6765550c990bcf161cc7e94e&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Quark-LLM&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Quark&quot;,&quot;avatar&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/67655397f7ada4603851ddb3/v51dcR1-2Z-ndlUi-1jQI.png&quot;},&quot;isAuthorParticipating&quot;:true},{&quot;paper&quot;:{&quot;id&quot;:&quot;2409.12191&quot;,&quot;authors&quot;:[{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;66eb8aa9fe376db0aa90bb3f&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Peng Lin&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;JustinLin610&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Junyang Lin&quot;,&quot;status&quot;:&quot;admin_assigned&quot;,&quot;statusLastChangedAt&quot;:&quot;2024-09-19T08:14:59.832Z&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false}],&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2024-09-18T17:59:32.000Z&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyAt&quot;:&quot;2024-09-19T00:52:02.322Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Qwen2-VL: Enhancing Vision-Language Model's Perception of the World at\n  Any Resolution&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;60f1abe7544c2adfd699860c&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/1674929746905-60f1abe7544c2adfd699860c.jpeg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:true,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;AK&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;akhaliq&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;We present the Qwen2-VL Series, an advanced upgrade of the previous Qwen-VL\nmodels that redefines the conventional predetermined-resolution approach in\nvisual processing. Qwen2-VL introduces the Naive Dynamic Resolution mechanism,\nwhich enables the model to dynamically process images of varying resolutions\ninto different numbers of visual tokens. This approach allows the model to\ngenerate more efficient and accurate visual representations, closely aligning\nwith human perceptual processes. The model also integrates Multimodal Rotary\nPosition Embedding (M-RoPE), facilitating the effective fusion of positional\ninformation across text, images, and videos. We employ a unified paradigm for\nprocessing both images and videos, enhancing the model's visual perception\ncapabilities. To explore the potential of large multimodal models, Qwen2-VL\ninvestigates the scaling laws for large vision-language models (LVLMs). By\nscaling both the model size-with versions at 2B, 8B, and 72B parameters-and the\namount of training data, the Qwen2-VL Series achieves highly competitive\nperformance. Notably, the Qwen2-VL-72B model achieves results comparable to\nleading models such as GPT-4o and Claude3.5-Sonnet across various multimodal\nbenchmarks, outperforming other generalist models. Code is available at\nhttps://github.com/QwenLM/Qwen2-VL.&quot;,&quot;upvotes&quot;:78,&quot;discussionId&quot;:&quot;66eb8aaefe376db0aa90bcae&quot;,&quot;githubRepo&quot;:&quot;https://github.com/qwenlm/qwen2-vl&quot;,&quot;githubRepoAddedBy&quot;:&quot;auto&quot;,&quot;ai_summary&quot;:&quot;The Qwen2-VL Series uses Naive Dynamic Resolution and Multimodal Rotary Position Embedding to enhance visual processing and achieves competitive performance on multimodal benchmarks.&quot;,&quot;ai_keywords&quot;:[&quot;Naive Dynamic Resolution&quot;,&quot;visual tokens&quot;,&quot;Multimodal Rotary Position Embedding&quot;,&quot;LVLMs&quot;,&quot;Qwen2-VL&quot;,&quot;GPT-4&quot;,&quot;Claude3.5-Sonnet&quot;,&quot;multimodal benchmarks&quot;],&quot;githubStars&quot;:17202},&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2024-09-18T13:59:32.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Qwen2-VL: Enhancing Vision-Language Model's Perception of the World at\n  Any Resolution&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;We present the Qwen2-VL Series, an advanced upgrade of the previous Qwen-VL\nmodels that redefines the conventional predetermined-resolution approach in\nvisual processing. Qwen2-VL introduces the Naive Dynamic Resolution mechanism,\nwhich enables the model to dynamically process images of varying resolutions\ninto different numbers of visual tokens. This approach allows the model to\ngenerate more efficient and accurate visual representations, closely aligning\nwith human perceptual processes. The model also integrates Multimodal Rotary\nPosition Embedding (M-RoPE), facilitating the effective fusion of positional\ninformation across text, images, and videos. We employ a unified paradigm for\nprocessing both images and videos, enhancing the model's visual perception\ncapabilities. To explore the potential of large multimodal models, Qwen2-VL\ninvestigates the scaling laws for large vision-language models (LVLMs). By\nscaling both the model size-with versions at 2B, 8B, and 72B parameters-and the\namount of training data, the Qwen2-VL Series achieves highly competitive\nperformance. Notably, the Qwen2-VL-72B model achieves results comparable to\nleading models such as GPT-4o and Claude3.5-Sonnet across various multimodal\nbenchmarks, outperforming other generalist models. Code is available at\nhttps://github.com/QwenLM/Qwen2-VL.&quot;,&quot;thumbnail&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-thumbnails.huggingface.co/social-thumbnails/papers/2409.12191.png&quot;,&quot;numComments&quot;:6,&quot;upvoted&quot;:false,&quot;submittedBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;60f1abe7544c2adfd699860c&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/1674929746905-60f1abe7544c2adfd699860c.jpeg&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;AK&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;akhaliq&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:true,&quot;isHf&quot;:true,&quot;isHfAdmin&quot;:false,&quot;isMod&quot;:false,&quot;followerCount&quot;:8928},&quot;isAuthorParticipating&quot;:true},{&quot;paper&quot;:{&quot;id&quot;:&quot;2406.01014&quot;,&quot;authors&quot;:[{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;666113b372f344f198df601c&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6438f6415aa69077ffb16942&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;/avatars/c83dbd3e10e88db97c2a86092bad5917.svg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Junyang Shen&quot;,&quot;status&quot;:&quot;admin_assigned&quot;,&quot;statusLastChangedAt&quot;:&quot;2024-06-06T07:14:54.788Z&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;666113b372f344f198df6022&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Ji Zhang&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;666113b372f344f198df6023&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;635b8b6a37c6a2c12e2cce00&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;/avatars/229fb72180529141515d1df797b33709.svg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Fei Sang&quot;,&quot;status&quot;:&quot;claimed_verified&quot;,&quot;statusLastChangedAt&quot;:&quot;2024-12-04T09:47:26.638Z&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false}],&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2024-06-03T05:50:00.000Z&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyAt&quot;:&quot;2024-06-06T02:36:27.283Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Mobile-Agent-v2: Mobile Device Operation Assistant with Effective\n  Navigation via Multi-Agent Collaboration&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;60f1abe7544c2adfd699860c&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/1674929746905-60f1abe7544c2adfd699860c.jpeg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:true,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;AK&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;akhaliq&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Mobile device operation tasks are increasingly becoming a popular multi-modal\nAI application scenario. Current Multi-modal Large Language Models (MLLMs),\nconstrained by their training data, lack the capability to function effectively\nas operation assistants. Instead, MLLM-based agents, which enhance capabilities\nthrough tool invocation, are gradually being applied to this scenario. However,\nthe two major navigation challenges in mobile device operation tasks, task\nprogress navigation and focus content navigation, are significantly complicated\nunder the single-agent architecture of existing work. This is due to the overly\nlong token sequences and the interleaved text-image data format, which limit\nperformance. To address these navigation challenges effectively, we propose\nMobile-Agent-v2, a multi-agent architecture for mobile device operation\nassistance. The architecture comprises three agents: planning agent, decision\nagent, and reflection agent. The planning agent generates task progress, making\nthe navigation of history operations more efficient. To retain focus content,\nwe design a memory unit that updates with task progress. Additionally, to\ncorrect erroneous operations, the reflection agent observes the outcomes of\neach operation and handles any mistakes accordingly. Experimental results\nindicate that Mobile-Agent-v2 achieves over a 30% improvement in task\ncompletion compared to the single-agent architecture of Mobile-Agent. The code\nis open-sourced at https://github.com/X-PLUG/MobileAgent.&quot;,&quot;upvotes&quot;:34,&quot;discussionId&quot;:&quot;666113b772f344f198df61a1&quot;,&quot;githubRepo&quot;:&quot;https://github.com/x-plug/mobileagent&quot;,&quot;githubRepoAddedBy&quot;:&quot;auto&quot;,&quot;ai_summary&quot;:&quot;Mobile-Agent-v2, a multi-agent system with planning, decision, and reflection components, improves task completion in mobile device operations by addressing navigation challenges and handling errors.&quot;,&quot;ai_keywords&quot;:[&quot;Multi-modal Large Language Models (MLLMs)&quot;,&quot;Mobile-Agent-v2&quot;,&quot;multi-agent architecture&quot;,&quot;planning agent&quot;,&quot;decision agent&quot;,&quot;reflection agent&quot;,&quot;task progress navigation&quot;,&quot;focus content navigation&quot;,&quot;memory unit&quot;,&quot;erroneous operations&quot;],&quot;githubStars&quot;:6693},&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2024-06-03T01:50:00.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Mobile-Agent-v2: Mobile Device Operation Assistant with Effective\n  Navigation via Multi-Agent Collaboration&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Mobile device operation tasks are increasingly becoming a popular multi-modal\nAI application scenario. Current Multi-modal Large Language Models (MLLMs),\nconstrained by their training data, lack the capability to function effectively\nas operation assistants. Instead, MLLM-based agents, which enhance capabilities\nthrough tool invocation, are gradually being applied to this scenario. However,\nthe two major navigation challenges in mobile device operation tasks, task\nprogress navigation and focus content navigation, are significantly complicated\nunder the single-agent architecture of existing work. This is due to the overly\nlong token sequences and the interleaved text-image data format, which limit\nperformance. To address these navigation challenges effectively, we propose\nMobile-Agent-v2, a multi-agent architecture for mobile device operation\nassistance. The architecture comprises three agents: planning agent, decision\nagent, and reflection agent. The planning agent generates task progress, making\nthe navigation of history operations more efficient. To retain focus content,\nwe design a memory unit that updates with task progress. Additionally, to\ncorrect erroneous operations, the reflection agent observes the outcomes of\neach operation and handles any mistakes accordingly. Experimental results\nindicate that Mobile-Agent-v2 achieves over a 30% improvement in task\ncompletion compared to the single-agent architecture of Mobile-Agent. The code\nis open-sourced at https://github.com/X-PLUG/MobileAgent.&quot;,&quot;thumbnail&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-thumbnails.huggingface.co/social-thumbnails/papers/2406.01014.png&quot;,&quot;numComments&quot;:2,&quot;upvoted&quot;:false,&quot;submittedBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;60f1abe7544c2adfd699860c&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/1674929746905-60f1abe7544c2adfd699860c.jpeg&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;AK&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;akhaliq&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:true,&quot;isHf&quot;:true,&quot;isHfAdmin&quot;:false,&quot;isMod&quot;:false,&quot;followerCount&quot;:8928},&quot;isAuthorParticipating&quot;:false},{&quot;paper&quot;:{&quot;id&quot;:&quot;2304.11277&quot;,&quot;authors&quot;:[{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;64b883c8339adc8f30b5d6b5&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Yanli Balioglu&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;cbalioglu&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Can Nguyen&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;64b883c8339adc8f30b5d6c2&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;64abbeacd14398e270d7e95b&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/64abbeacd14398e270d7e95b/nDtR0qtfiw9uNuoZK4yk3.jpeg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Geeta Chauhan&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;chauhang&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Geeta Chauhan&quot;,&quot;status&quot;:&quot;claimed_verified&quot;,&quot;statusLastChangedAt&quot;:&quot;2024-03-04T09:02:00.281Z&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;64b883c8339adc8f30b5d6c3&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Yuchen Hao&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;64b883c8339adc8f30b5d6c4&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Shen Li&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false}],&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2023-04-21T23:52:27.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;PyTorch FSDP: Experiences on Scaling Fully Sharded Data Parallel&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;It is widely acknowledged that large models have the potential to deliver\nsuperior performance across a broad range of domains. Despite the remarkable\nprogress made in the field of machine learning systems research, which has\nenabled the development and exploration of large models, such abilities remain\nconfined to a small group of advanced users and industry leaders, resulting in\nan implicit technical barrier for the wider community to access and leverage\nthese technologies. In this paper, we introduce PyTorch Fully Sharded Data\nParallel (FSDP) as an industry-grade solution for large model training. FSDP\nhas been closely co-designed with several key PyTorch core components including\nTensor implementation, dispatcher system, and CUDA memory caching allocator, to\nprovide non-intrusive user experiences and high training efficiency.\nAdditionally, FSDP natively incorporates a range of techniques and settings to\noptimize resource utilization across a variety of hardware configurations. The\nexperimental results demonstrate that FSDP is capable of achieving comparable\nperformance to Distributed Data Parallel while providing support for\nsignificantly larger models with near-linear scalability in terms of TFLOPS.&quot;,&quot;upvotes&quot;:5,&quot;discussionId&quot;:&quot;64b883c9339adc8f30b5d6d9&quot;,&quot;githubRepo&quot;:&quot;https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/main/torch/distributed/fsdp/fully_sharded_data_parallel.py&quot;,&quot;githubRepoAddedBy&quot;:&quot;auto&quot;,&quot;ai_summary&quot;:&quot;PyTorch Fully Sharded Data Parallel (FSDP) enables efficient and scalable training of large models across hardware configurations.&quot;,&quot;ai_keywords&quot;:[&quot;Fully Sharded Data Parallel&quot;,&quot;FSDP&quot;,&quot;Tensor implementation&quot;,&quot;dispatcher system&quot;,&quot;CUDA memory caching allocator&quot;,&quot;Distributed Data Parallel&quot;,&quot;scalability&quot;,&quot;TFLOPS&quot;],&quot;githubStars&quot;:95942},&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2023-04-21T19:52:27.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;PyTorch FSDP: Experiences on Scaling Fully Sharded Data Parallel&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;It is widely acknowledged that large models have the potential to deliver\nsuperior performance across a broad range of domains. Despite the remarkable\nprogress made in the field of machine learning systems research, which has\nenabled the development and exploration of large models, such abilities remain\nconfined to a small group of advanced users and industry leaders, resulting in\nan implicit technical barrier for the wider community to access and leverage\nthese technologies. In this paper, we introduce PyTorch Fully Sharded Data\nParallel (FSDP) as an industry-grade solution for large model training. FSDP\nhas been closely co-designed with several key PyTorch core components including\nTensor implementation, dispatcher system, and CUDA memory caching allocator, to\nprovide non-intrusive user experiences and high training efficiency.\nAdditionally, FSDP natively incorporates a range of techniques and settings to\noptimize resource utilization across a variety of hardware configurations. The\nexperimental results demonstrate that FSDP is capable of achieving comparable\nperformance to Distributed Data Parallel while providing support for\nsignificantly larger models with near-linear scalability in terms of TFLOPS.&quot;,&quot;thumbnail&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-thumbnails.huggingface.co/social-thumbnails/papers/2304.11277.png&quot;,&quot;numComments&quot;:0,&quot;upvoted&quot;:false,&quot;isAuthorParticipating&quot;:false},{&quot;paper&quot;:{&quot;id&quot;:&quot;2512.11130&quot;,&quot;authors&quot;:[{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;69406113b21c43ffbf4b7648&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Bowen Wen&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;69406113b21c43ffbf4b7649&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Shaurya Dewan&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;69406113b21c43ffbf4b764a&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Stan Birchfield&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false}],&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-12-11T21:36:29.000Z&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyAt&quot;:&quot;2025-12-15T16:58:35.748Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Fast-FoundationStereo: Real-Time Zero-Shot Stereo Matching&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;64aeee717b3b3386662e9e62&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;/avatars/8fd244261d6128a109c25ef8578e186b.svg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Bowen Wen&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;wenbowen&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Stereo foundation models achieve strong zero-shot generalization but remain computationally prohibitive for real-time applications. Efficient stereo architectures, on the other hand, sacrifice robustness for speed and require costly per-domain fine-tuning. To bridge this gap, we present Fast-FoundationStereo, a family of architectures that achieve, for the first time, strong zero-shot generalization at real-time frame rate. We employ a divide-and-conquer acceleration strategy with three components: (1) knowledge distillation to compress the hybrid backbone into a single efficient student; (2) blockwise neural architecture search for automatically discovering optimal cost filtering designs under latency budgets, reducing search complexity exponentially; and (3) structured pruning for eliminating redundancy in the iterative refinement module. Furthermore, we introduce an automatic pseudo-labeling pipeline used to curate 1.4M in-the-wild stereo pairs to supplement synthetic training data and facilitate knowledge distillation. The resulting model can run over 10x faster than FoundationStereo while closely matching its zero-shot accuracy, thus establishing a new state-of-the-art among real-time methods. Project page: https://nvlabs.github.io/Fast-FoundationStereo/&quot;,&quot;upvotes&quot;:2,&quot;discussionId&quot;:&quot;69406113b21c43ffbf4b764b&quot;,&quot;projectPage&quot;:&quot;https://nvlabs.github.io/Fast-FoundationStereo/&quot;,&quot;githubRepo&quot;:&quot;https://github.com/NVlabs/Fast-FoundationStereo&quot;,&quot;githubRepoAddedBy&quot;:&quot;user&quot;,&quot;ai_summary&quot;:&quot;Fast-FoundationStereo achieves real-time zero-shot stereo generalization by combining knowledge distillation, blockwise neural architecture search, and structured pruning.&quot;,&quot;ai_keywords&quot;:[&quot;zero-shot generalization&quot;,&quot;knowledge distillation&quot;,&quot;blockwise neural architecture search&quot;,&quot;structured pruning&quot;,&quot;stereo pairs&quot;,&quot;synthetic training data&quot;],&quot;githubStars&quot;:58,&quot;organization&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;60262b67268c201cdc8b7d43&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;nvidia&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;NVIDIA&quot;,&quot;avatar&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/1613114437487-60262a8e0703121c822a80b6.png&quot;}},&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-12-11T16:36:29.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Fast-FoundationStereo: Real-Time Zero-Shot Stereo Matching&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Stereo foundation models achieve strong zero-shot generalization but remain computationally prohibitive for real-time applications. Efficient stereo architectures, on the other hand, sacrifice robustness for speed and require costly per-domain fine-tuning. To bridge this gap, we present Fast-FoundationStereo, a family of architectures that achieve, for the first time, strong zero-shot generalization at real-time frame rate. We employ a divide-and-conquer acceleration strategy with three components: (1) knowledge distillation to compress the hybrid backbone into a single efficient student; (2) blockwise neural architecture search for automatically discovering optimal cost filtering designs under latency budgets, reducing search complexity exponentially; and (3) structured pruning for eliminating redundancy in the iterative refinement module. Furthermore, we introduce an automatic pseudo-labeling pipeline used to curate 1.4M in-the-wild stereo pairs to supplement synthetic training data and facilitate knowledge distillation. The resulting model can run over 10x faster than FoundationStereo while closely matching its zero-shot accuracy, thus establishing a new state-of-the-art among real-time methods. Project page:
