Zhu&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false}],&quot;mediaUrls&quot;:[&quot;https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/63451cf0a05b51f7ded25505/kVvzrCGrjwoK0CYh4DKif.jpeg&quot;],&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-11-26T17:59:08.000Z&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyAt&quot;:&quot;2025-12-04T01:02:46.772Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Qwen3-VL Technical Report&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;63451cf0a05b51f7ded25505&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;/avatars/dec4bbee4a82b773fc58dfc2dce9dbeb.svg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;shuai bai&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;ShuaiBai623&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;We introduce Qwen3-VL, the most capable vision-language model in the Qwen series to date, achieving superior performance across a broad range of multimodal benchmarks. It natively supports interleaved contexts of up to 256K tokens, seamlessly integrating text, images, and video. The model family includes both dense (2B/4B/8B/32B) and mixture-of-experts (30B-A3B/235B-A22B) variants to accommodate diverse latency-quality trade-offs. Qwen3-VL delivers three core pillars: (i) markedly stronger pure-text understanding, surpassing comparable text-only backbones in several cases; (ii) robust long-context comprehension with a native 256K-token window for both text and interleaved multimodal inputs, enabling faithful retention, retrieval, and cross-referencing across long documents and videos; and (iii) advanced multimodal reasoning across single-image, multi-image, and video tasks, demonstrating leading performance on comprehensive evaluations such as MMMU and visual-math benchmarks (e.g., MathVista and MathVision). Architecturally, we introduce three key upgrades: (i) an enhanced interleaved-MRoPE for stronger spatial-temporal modeling across images and video; (ii) DeepStack integration, which effectively leverages multi-level ViT features to tighten vision-language alignment; and (iii) text-based time alignment for video, evolving from T-RoPE to explicit textual timestamp alignment for more precise temporal grounding. Under comparable token budgets and latency constraints, Qwen3-VL achieves superior performance in both dense and Mixture-of-Experts (MoE) architectures. We envision Qwen3-VL serving as a foundational engine for image-grounded reasoning, agentic decision-making, and multimodal code intelligence in real-world workflows.&quot;,&quot;upvotes&quot;:126,&quot;discussionId&quot;:&quot;692ffb1b26742347f61daf78&quot;,&quot;projectPage&quot;:&quot;https://chat.qwen.ai&quot;,&quot;githubRepo&quot;:&quot;https://github.com/QwenLM/Qwen3-VL&quot;,&quot;githubRepoAddedBy&quot;:&quot;auto&quot;,&quot;ai_summary&quot;:&quot;Qwen3-VL, a vision-language model, excels in text and multimodal understanding through advanced architectures and larger contexts, achieving superior performance across benchmarks.&quot;,&quot;ai_keywords&quot;:[&quot;vision-language model&quot;,&quot;interleaved contexts&quot;,&quot;multimodal benchmarks&quot;,&quot;dense variants&quot;,&quot;mixture-of-experts&quot;,&quot;pure-text understanding&quot;,&quot;long-context comprehension&quot;,&quot;multimodal reasoning&quot;,&quot;MMMU&quot;,&quot;visual-math benchmarks&quot;,&quot;interleaved-MRoPE&quot;,&quot;DeepStack&quot;,&quot;text-based time alignment&quot;,&quot;T-RoPE&quot;,&quot;explicit textual timestamp alignment&quot;,&quot;vision-language alignment&quot;,&quot;image-grounded reasoning&quot;,&quot;agentic decision-making&quot;,&quot;multimodal code intelligence&quot;],&quot;githubStars&quot;:17203,&quot;organization&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;64c8b5837fe12ecd0a7e92eb&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Qwen&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Qwen&quot;,&quot;avatar&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/620760a26e3b7210c2ff1943/-s1gyJfvbE1RgO5iBeNOi.png&quot;}},&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-11-26T12:59:08.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Qwen3-VL Technical Report&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;We introduce Qwen3-VL, the most capable vision-language model in the Qwen series to date, achieving superior performance across a broad range of multimodal benchmarks. It natively supports interleaved contexts of up to 256K tokens, seamlessly integrating text, images, and video. The model family includes both dense (2B/4B/8B/32B) and mixture-of-experts (30B-A3B/235B-A22B) variants to accommodate diverse latency-quality trade-offs. Qwen3-VL delivers three core pillars: (i) markedly stronger pure-text understanding, surpassing comparable text-only backbones in several cases; (ii) robust long-context comprehension with a native 256K-token window for both text and interleaved multimodal inputs, enabling faithful retention, retrieval, and cross-referencing across long documents and videos; and (iii) advanced multimodal reasoning across single-image, multi-image, and video tasks, demonstrating leading performance on comprehensive evaluations such as MMMU and visual-math benchmarks (e.g., MathVista and MathVision). Architecturally, we introduce three key upgrades: (i) an enhanced interleaved-MRoPE for stronger spatial-temporal modeling across images and video; (ii) DeepStack integration, which effectively leverages multi-level ViT features to tighten vision-language alignment; and (iii) text-based time alignment for video, evolving from T-RoPE to explicit textual timestamp alignment for more precise temporal grounding. Under comparable token budgets and latency constraints, Qwen3-VL achieves superior performance in both dense and Mixture-of-Experts (MoE) architectures. We envision Qwen3-VL serving as a foundational engine for image-grounded reasoning, agentic decision-making, and multimodal code intelligence in real-world workflows.&quot;,&quot;mediaUrls&quot;:[&quot;https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/63451cf0a05b51f7ded25505/kVvzrCGrjwoK0CYh4DKif.jpeg&quot;],&quot;thumbnail&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-thumbnails.huggingface.co/social-thumbnails/papers/2511.21631.png&quot;,&quot;numComments&quot;:3,&quot;upvoted&quot;:false,&quot;submittedBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;63451cf0a05b51f7ded25505&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;/avatars/dec4bbee4a82b773fc58dfc2dce9dbeb.svg&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;shuai Lin&quot;,&quot;status&quot;:&quot;admin_assigned&quot;,&quot;statusLastChangedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-02-20T16:03:53.317Z&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false}],&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-02-19T18:00:14.000Z&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyAt&quot;:&quot;2025-02-20T02:05:06.194Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Qwen2.5-VL Technical Report&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;63451cf0a05b51f7ded25505&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;/avatars/dec4bbee4a82b773fc58dfc2dce9dbeb.svg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;shuai bai&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;ShuaiBai623&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;We introduce Qwen2.5-VL, the latest flagship model of Qwen vision-language\nseries, which demonstrates significant advancements in both foundational\ncapabilities and innovative functionalities. Qwen2.5-VL achieves a major leap\nforward in understanding and interacting with the world through enhanced visual\nrecognition, precise object localization, robust document parsing, and\nlong-video comprehension. A standout feature of Qwen2.5-VL is its ability to\nlocalize objects using bounding boxes or points accurately. It provides robust\nstructured data extraction from invoices, forms, and tables, as well as\ndetailed analysis of charts, diagrams, and layouts. To handle complex inputs,\nQwen2.5-VL introduces dynamic resolution processing and absolute time encoding,\nenabling it to process images of varying sizes and videos of extended durations\n(up to hours) with second-level event localization. This allows the model to\nnatively perceive spatial scales and temporal dynamics without relying on\ntraditional normalization techniques. By training a native dynamic-resolution\nVision Transformer (ViT) from scratch and incorporating Window Attention, we\nreduce computational overhead while maintaining native resolution. As a result,\nQwen2.5-VL excels not only in static image and document understanding but also\nas an interactive visual agent capable of reasoning, tool usage, and task\nexecution in real-world scenarios such as operating computers and mobile\ndevices. Qwen2.5-VL is available in three sizes, addressing diverse use cases\nfrom edge AI to high-performance computing. The flagship Qwen2.5-VL-72B model\nmatches state-of-the-art models like GPT-4o and Claude 3.5 Sonnet, particularly\nexcelling in document and diagram understanding. Additionally, Qwen2.5-VL\nmaintains robust linguistic performance, preserving the core language\ncompetencies of the Qwen2.5 LLM.&quot;,&quot;upvotes&quot;:211,&quot;discussionId&quot;:&quot;67b6b0688b56622e70b9e875&quot;,&quot;projectPage&quot;:&quot;https://chat.qwenlm.ai&quot;,&quot;githubRepo&quot;:&quot;https://github.com/QwenLM/Qwen2.5-VL&quot;,&quot;githubRepoAddedBy&quot;:&quot;auto&quot;,&quot;ai_summary&quot;:&quot;Qwen2.5-VL, the latest vision-language model, advances visual recognition, document parsing, and video comprehension through dynamic resolution processing, Window Attention, and a native Vision Transformer.&quot;,&quot;ai_keywords&quot;:[&quot;Vision Transformer&quot;,&quot;Window Attention&quot;,&quot;dynamic resolution processing&quot;,&quot;bounding boxes&quot;,&quot;dynamic-resolution&quot;,&quot;ViT&quot;,&quot;long-video comprehension&quot;,&quot;document parsing&quot;,&quot;visual recognition&quot;,&quot;spatial scales&quot;,&quot;temporal dynamics&quot;,&quot;real-world scenarios&quot;],&quot;githubStars&quot;:17203},&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-02-19T13:00:14.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Qwen2.5-VL Technical Report&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;We introduce Qwen2.5-VL, the latest flagship model of Qwen vision-language\nseries, which demonstrates significant advancements in both foundational\ncapabilities and innovative functionalities. Qwen2.5-VL achieves a major leap\nforward in understanding and interacting with the world through enhanced visual\nrecognition, precise object localization, robust document parsing, and\nlong-video comprehension. A standout feature of Qwen2.5-VL is its ability to\nlocalize objects using bounding boxes or points accurately. It provides robust\nstructured data extraction from invoices, forms, and tables, as well as\ndetailed analysis of charts, diagrams, and layouts. To handle complex inputs,\nQwen2.5-VL introduces dynamic resolution processing and absolute time encoding,\nenabling it to process images of varying sizes and videos of extended durations\n(up to hours) with second-level event localization. This allows the model to\nnatively perceive spatial scales and temporal dynamics without relying on\ntraditional normalization techniques. By training a native dynamic-resolution\nVision Transformer (ViT) from scratch and incorporating Window Attention, we\nreduce computational overhead while maintaining native resolution. As a result,\nQwen2.5-VL excels not only in static image and document understanding but also\nas an interactive visual agent capable of reasoning, tool usage, and task\nexecution in real-world scenarios such as operating computers and mobile\ndevices. Qwen2.5-VL is available in three sizes, addressing diverse use cases\nfrom edge AI to high-performance computing. The flagship Qwen2.5-VL-72B model\nmatches state-of-the-art models like GPT-4o and Claude 3.5 Sonnet, particularly\nexcelling in document and diagram understanding. Additionally, Qwen2.5-VL\nmaintains robust linguistic performance, preserving the core language\ncompetencies of the Qwen2.5 LLM.&quot;,&quot;thumbnail&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-thumbnails.huggingface.co/social-thumbnails/papers/2502.13923.png&quot;,&quot;numComments&quot;:8,&quot;upvoted&quot;:false,&quot;submittedBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;63451cf0a05b51f7ded25505&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;/avatars/dec4bbee4a82b773fc58dfc2dce9dbeb.svg&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;shuai bai&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;ShuaiBai623&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;isHf&quot;:false,&quot;isHfAdmin&quot;:false,&quot;isMod&quot;:false,&quot;followerCount&quot;:42},&quot;isAuthorParticipating&quot;:true},{&quot;paper&quot;:{&quot;id&quot;:&quot;2512.10794&quot;,&quot;authors&quot;:[{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;693c141c9874a2a5e4ffb49c&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Jaskirat Singh&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;693c141c9874a2a5e4ffb49d&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Xingjian Leng&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;693c141c9874a2a5e4ffb49e&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Zongze Wu&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;693c141c9874a2a5e4ffb49f&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Liang Zheng&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;693c141c9874a2a5e4ffb4a0&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Richard Zhang&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;693c141c9874a2a5e4ffb4a1&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Eli Shechtman&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;693c141c9874a2a5e4ffb4a2&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Saining Xie&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false}],&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-12-11T16:39:53.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;What matters for Representation Alignment: Global Information or Spatial Structure?&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Representation alignment (REPA) guides generative training by distilling representations from a strong, pretrained vision encoder to intermediate diffusion features. We investigate a fundamental question: what aspect of the target representation matters for generation, its global semantic information (e.g., measured by ImageNet-1K accuracy) or its spatial structure (i.e. pairwise cosine similarity between patch tokens)? Prevalent wisdom holds that stronger global semantic performance leads to better generation as a target representation. To study this, we first perform a large-scale empirical analysis across 27 different vision encoders and different model scales. The results are surprising; spatial structure, rather than global performance, drives the generation performance of a target representation. To further study this, we introduce two straightforward modifications, which specifically accentuate the transfer of spatial information. We replace the standard MLP projection layer in REPA with a simple convolution layer and introduce a spatial normalization layer for the external representation. Surprisingly, our simple method (implemented in <4 lines of code), termed iREPA, consistently improves convergence speed of REPA, across a diverse set of vision encoders, model sizes, and training variants (such as REPA, REPA-E, Meanflow, JiT etc). %, etc. Our work motivates revisiting the fundamental working mechanism of representational alignment and how it can be leveraged for improved training of generative models. The code and project page are available at https://end2end-diffusion.github.io/irepa&quot;,&quot;upvotes&quot;:0,&quot;discussionId&quot;:&quot;693c141d9874a2a5e4ffb4a3&quot;,&quot;projectPage&quot;:&quot;https://end2end-diffusion.github.io/irepa&quot;,&quot;githubRepo&quot;:&quot;https://github.com/end2end-diffusion/irepa&quot;,&quot;githubRepoAddedBy&quot;:&quot;auto&quot;,&quot;ai_summary&quot;:&quot;Representation alignment enhances generative training by transferring spatial structure from pretrained vision encoders to diffusion models, surpassing the importance of global semantic performance.&quot;,&quot;ai_keywords&quot;:[&quot;representation alignment&quot;,&quot;generative training&quot;,&quot;diffusion features&quot;,&quot;global semantic information&quot;,&quot;spatial structure&quot;,&quot;patch tokens&quot;,&quot;MLP projection layer&quot;,&quot;convolution layer&quot;,&quot;spatial normalization layer&quot;,&quot;iREPA&quot;,&quot;convergence speed&quot;,&quot;REPA&quot;,&quot;REPA-E&quot;,&quot;Meanflow&quot;,&quot;JiT&quot;],&quot;githubStars&quot;:63},&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-12-11T11:39:53.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;What matters for Representation Alignment: Global Information or Spatial Structure?&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Representation alignment (REPA) guides generative training by distilling representations from a strong, pretrained vision encoder to intermediate diffusion features. We investigate a fundamental question: what aspect of the target representation matters for generation, its global semantic information (e.g., measured by ImageNet-1K accuracy) or its spatial structure (i.e. pairwise cosine similarity between patch tokens)? Prevalent wisdom holds that stronger global semantic performance leads to better generation as a target representation. To study this, we first perform a large-scale empirical analysis across 27 different vision encoders and different model scales. The results are surprising; spatial structure, rather than global performance, drives the generation performance of a target representation. To further study this, we introduce two straightforward modifications, which specifically accentuate the transfer of spatial information. We replace the standard MLP projection layer in REPA with a simple convolution layer and introduce a spatial normalization layer for the external representation. Surprisingly, our simple method (implemented in <4 lines of code), termed iREPA, consistently improves convergence speed of REPA, across a diverse set of vision encoders, model sizes, and training variants (such as REPA, REPA-E, Meanflow, JiT etc). %, etc. Our work motivates revisiting the fundamental working mechanism of representational alignment and how it can be leveraged for improved training of generative models. The code and project page are available at https://end2end-diffusion.github.io/irepa&quot;,&quot;thumbnail&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-thumbnails.huggingface.co/social-thumbnails/papers/2512.10794.png&quot;,&quot;numComments&quot;:0,&quot;upvoted&quot;:false,&quot;isAuthorParticipating&quot;:false},{&quot;paper&quot;:{&quot;id&quot;:&quot;2006.15704&quot;,&quot;authors&quot;:[{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;66290acc2874f75405ccbfe6&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Shen Damania&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;66290acc2874f75405ccbff0&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;64b81f399ebb69a79ffec095&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/noauth/2nSfGQk0O72prUr3GfV4V.png&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Soumith Chintala&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;soumithchintala&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Soumith Chintala&quot;,&quot;status&quot;:&quot;claimed_verified&quot;,&quot;statusLastChangedAt&quot;:&quot;2024-06-14T14:57:10.563Z&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false}],&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2020-06-28T20:39:45.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;PyTorch Distributed: Experiences on Accelerating Data Parallel Training&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;This paper presents the design, implementation, and evaluation of the PyTorch\ndistributed data parallel module. PyTorch is a widely-adopted scientific\ncomputing package used in deep learning research and applications. Recent\nadvances in deep learning argue for the value of large datasets and large\nmodels, which necessitates the ability to scale out model training to more\ncomputational resources. Data parallelism has emerged as a popular solution for\ndistributed training thanks to its straightforward principle and broad\napplicability. In general, the technique of distributed data parallelism\nreplicates the model on every computational resource to generate gradients\nindependently and then communicates those gradients at each iteration to keep\nmodel replicas consistent. Despite the conceptual simplicity of the technique,\nthe subtle dependencies between computation and communication make it\nnon-trivial to optimize the distributed training efficiency. As of v1.5,\nPyTorch natively provides several techniques to accelerate distributed data\nparallel, including bucketing gradients, overlapping computation with\ncommunication, and skipping gradient synchronization. Evaluations show that,\nwhen configured appropriately, the PyTorch distributed data parallel module\nattains near-linear scalability using 256 GPUs.&quot;,&quot;upvotes&quot;:4,&quot;discussionId&quot;:&quot;66290acd2874f75405ccc00f&quot;,&quot;githubRepo&quot;:&quot;https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/nn/parallel/distributed.py&quot;,&quot;githubRepoAddedBy&quot;:&quot;auto&quot;,&quot;ai_summary&quot;:&quot;The PyTorch distributed data parallel module optimizes large-scale model training using techniques like gradient bucketing, computation-communication overlap, and selective synchronization to achieve near-linear scalability.&quot;,&quot;ai_keywords&quot;:[&quot;distributed data parallel&quot;,&quot;PyTorch&quot;,&quot;gradient bucketing&quot;,&quot;computation-communication overlap&quot;,&quot;selective synchronization&quot;],&quot;githubStars&quot;:95938},&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2020-06-28T16:39:45.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;PyTorch Distributed: Experiences on Accelerating Data Parallel Training&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;This paper presents the design, implementation, and evaluation of the PyTorch\ndistributed data parallel module. PyTorch is a widely-adopted scientific\ncomputing package used in deep learning research and applications. Recent\nadvances in deep learning argue for the value of large datasets and large\nmodels, which necessitates the ability to scale out model training to more\ncomputational resources. Data parallelism has emerged as a popular solution for\ndistributed training thanks to its straightforward principle and broad\napplicability. In general, the technique of distributed data parallelism\nreplicates the model on every computational resource to generate gradients\nindependently and then communicates those gradients at each iteration to keep\nmodel replicas consistent. Despite the conceptual simplicity of the technique,\nthe subtle dependencies between computation and communication make it\nnon-trivial to optimize the distributed training efficiency. As of v1.5,\nPyTorch natively provides several techniques to accelerate distributed data\nparallel, including bucketing gradients, overlapping computation with\ncommunication, and skipping gradient synchronization. Evaluations show that,\nwhen configured appropriately, the PyTorch distributed data parallel module\nattains near-linear scalability using 256 A World Model-Powered Vision-Language-Action Model&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6426616ea5ec4a5cbc535634&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/6426616ea5ec4a5cbc535634/5IfSFYd9QOxz8K9QmBCst.png&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;JeffWang&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;Jeff-Wang&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Training Vision-Language-Action (VLA) models for generalist robots typically\nrequires large-scale real-world robot data, which is expensive and\ntime-consuming to collect. The inefficiency of physical data collection\nseverely limits the scalability, and generalization capacity of current VLA\nsystems. To address this challenge, we introduce GigaBrain-0, a novel VLA\nfoundation model empowered by world model-generated data (e.g., video\ngeneration, real2real transfer, human transfer, view transfer, sim2real\ntransfer data). By leveraging world models to generate diverse data at scale,\nGigaBrain-0 significantly reduces reliance on real robot data while improving\ncross-task generalization. Our approach further improves policy robustness\nthrough RGBD input modeling and embodied Chain-of-Thought (CoT) supervision,\nenabling the model to reason about spatial geometry, object states, and\nlong-horizon dependencies during task execution. This leads to substantial\ngains in real-world performance on dexterous, long-horizon, and mobile\nmanipulation tasks. Extensive experiments demonstrate that GigaBrain-0 achieves\nsuperior generalization across variations in appearances (e.g., textures,\ncolors), object placements, and camera viewpoints. Additionally, we present\nGigaBrain-0-Small, an optimized lightweight variant designed to run efficiently\non devices such as the NVIDIA Jetson AGX Orin.&quot;,&quot;upvotes&quot;:49,&quot;discussionId&quot;:&quot;68f99e81b9b2e4ae0467386e&quot;,&quot;projectPage&quot;:&quot;https://gigabrain0.github.io/&quot;,&quot;githubRepo&quot;:&quot;https://github.com/open-gigaai/giga-brain-0&quot;,&quot;githubRepoAddedBy&quot;:&quot;user&quot;,&quot;ai_summary&quot;:&quot;GigaBrain-0, a VLA foundation model, uses world model-generated data to enhance cross-task generalization and policy robustness, improving real-world performance on complex manipulation tasks.&quot;,&quot;ai_keywords&quot;:[&quot;VLA models&quot;,&quot;world model-generated data&quot;,&quot;video generation&quot;,&quot;real2real transfer&quot;,&quot;human transfer&quot;,&quot;view transfer&quot;,&quot;sim2real transfer&quot;,&quot;RGBD input modeling&quot;,&quot;Chain-of-Thought supervision&quot;,&quot;spatial geometry&quot;,&quot;object states&quot;,&quot;long-horizon dependencies&quot;,&quot;dexterous manipulation&quot;,&quot;mobile manipulation&quot;],&quot;githubStars&quot;:704,&quot;organization&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;68d6587936e2de9610d9f5f0&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;open-gigaai&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;GigaAI&quot;,&quot;avatar&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/68d6394328e169473e90e4a6/zUK7FKr_8XqrN0aFUgsD-.png&quot;}},&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-10-22T05:57:13.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;GigaBrain-0: A World Model-Powered Vision-Language-Action Model&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Training Vision-Language-Action (VLA) models for generalist robots typically\nrequires large-scale real-world robot data, which is expensive and\ntime-consuming to collect. The inefficiency of physical data collection\nseverely limits the scalability, and generalization capacity of current VLA\nsystems. To address this challenge, we introduce GigaBrain-0, a novel VLA\nfoundation model empowered by world model-generated data (e.g., video\ngeneration, real2real transfer, human transfer, view transfer, sim2real\ntransfer data). By leveraging world models to generate diverse data at scale,\nGigaBrain-0 significantly reduces reliance on real robot data while improving\ncross-task generalization. Our approach further improves policy robustness\nthrough RGBD input modeling and embodied Chain-of-Thought (CoT) supervision,\nenabling the model to reason about spatial geometry, object states, and\nlong-horizon dependencies during task execution. This leads to substantial\ngains in real-world performance on dexterous, long-horizon, and mobile\nmanipulation tasks. Extensive experiments demonstrate that GigaBrain-0 achieves\nsuperior generalization across variations in appearances (e.g., textures,\ncolors), object placements, and camera viewpoints. Additionally, we present\nGigaBrain-0-Small, an optimized lightweight variant designed to run efficiently\non devices such as the NVIDIA Jetson AGX Orin.&quot;,&quot;thumbnail&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-thumbnails.huggingface.co/social-thumbnails/papers/2510.19430.png&quot;,&quot;numComments&quot;:5,&quot;upvoted&quot;:false,&quot;submittedBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6426616ea5ec4a5cbc535634&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/6426616ea5ec4a5cbc535634/5IfSFYd9QOxz8K9QmBCst.png&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;JeffWang&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Jeff-Wang&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;isHf&quot;:false,&quot;isHfAdmin&quot;:false,&quot;isMod&quot;:false,&quot;followerCount&quot;:2},&quot;organization&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;68d6587936e2de9610d9f5f0&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;open-gigaai&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;GigaAI&quot;,&quot;avatar&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/68d6394328e169473e90e4a6/zUK7FKr_8XqrN0aFUgsD-.png&quot;},&quot;isAuthorParticipating&quot;:true},{&quot;paper&quot;:{&quot;id&quot;:&quot;2504.19413&quot;,&quot;authors&quot;:[{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;681132ccee133b09d9d25a65&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;63d81cb4635499f2164094bf&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/1675107437601-noauth.png&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Prateek Khant&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;681132ccee133b09d9d25a67&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Saket Aryan&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;681132ccee133b09d9d25a68&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Taranjeet Singh&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;681132ccee133b09d9d25a69&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;64b397bf93679cd00945624e&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/64b397bf93679cd00945624e/yQnWK5uve6pMavzn4bR33.jpeg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Deshraj Yadav&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;deshrajdry&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Deshraj Yadav&quot;,&quot;status&quot;:&quot;claimed_verified&quot;,&quot;statusLastChangedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-05-04T10:05:24.817Z&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false}],&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-04-28T01:46:35.000Z&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyAt&quot;:&quot;2025-04-29T21:27:11.321Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Mem0: Building Production-Ready AI Agents with Scalable Long-Term Memory&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;60f1abe7544c2adfd699860c&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/1674929746905-60f1abe7544c2adfd699860c.jpeg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:true,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;AK&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;akhaliq&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Large Language Models (LLMs) have demonstrated remarkable prowess in\ngenerating contextually coherent responses, yet their fixed context windows\npose fundamental challenges for maintaining consistency over prolonged\nmulti-session dialogues. We introduce Mem0, a scalable memory-centric\narchitecture that addresses this issue by dynamically extracting,\nconsolidating, and retrieving salient information from ongoing conversations.\nBuilding on this foundation, we further propose an enhanced variant that\nleverages graph-based memory representations to capture complex relational\nstructures among conversational elements. Through comprehensive evaluations on\nLOCOMO benchmark, we systematically compare our approaches against six baseline\ncategories: (i) established memory-augmented systems, (ii) retrieval-augmented\ngeneration (RAG) with varying chunk sizes and k-values, (iii) a full-context\napproach that processes the entire conversation history, (iv) an open-source\nmemory solution, (v) a proprietary model system, and (vi) a dedicated memory\nmanagement platform. Empirical results show that our methods consistently\noutperform all existing memory systems across four question categories:\nsingle-hop, temporal, multi-hop, and open-domain. Notably, Mem0 achieves 26%\nrelative improvements in the LLM-as-a-Judge metric over OpenAI, while Mem0 with\ngraph memory achieves around 2% higher overall score than the base\nconfiguration. Beyond accuracy gains, we also markedly reduce computational\noverhead compared to full-context method. In particular, Mem0 attains a 91%\nlower p95 latency and saves more than 90% token cost, offering a compelling\nbalance between advanced reasoning capabilities and practical deployment\nconstraints. Our findings highlight critical role of structured, persistent\nmemory mechanisms for long-term conversational coherence, paving the way for\nmore reliable and efficient LLM-driven AI agents.&quot;,&quot;upvotes&quot;:35,&quot;discussionId&quot;:&quot;681132cdee133b09d9d25a97&quot;,&quot;githubRepo&quot;:&quot;https://github.com/mem0ai/mem0&quot;,&quot;githubRepoAddedBy&quot;:&quot;auto&quot;,&quot;ai_summary&quot;:&quot;Mem0, a memory-centric architecture with graph-based memory, enhances long-term conversational coherence in LLMs by efficiently extracting, consolidating, and retrieving information, outperforming existing memory systems in terms of accuracy and computational efficiency.&quot;,&quot;ai_keywords&quot;:[&quot;Mem0&quot;,&quot;memory-centric architecture&quot;,&quot;graph-based memory&quot;,&quot;salient information&quot;,&quot;conversational elements&quot;,&quot;LOCOMO benchmark&quot;,&quot;memory-augmented systems&quot;,&quot;retrieval-augmented generation&quot;,&quot;full-context approach&quot;,&quot;memory solution&quot;,&quot;model system&quot;,&quot;memory management platform&quot;,&quot;single-hop&quot;,&quot;temporal&quot;,&quot;multi-hop&quot;,&quot;open-domain&quot;,&quot;LLM-as-a-Judge&quot;,&quot;reasoning capabilities&quot;,&quot;deployment constraints&quot;,&quot;structured memory&quot;,&quot;persistent memory&quot;],&quot;githubStars&quot;:44305},&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-04-27T21:46:35.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Mem0: Building Production-Ready AI Agents with Scalable Long-Term Memory&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Large Language Models (LLMs) have demonstrated remarkable prowess in\ngenerating contextually coherent responses, yet their fixed context windows\npose fundamental challenges for maintaining consistency over prolonged\nmulti-session dialogues. We introduce Mem0, a scalable memory-centric\narchitecture that addresses this issue by dynamically extracting,\nconsolidating, and retrieving salient information from ongoing conversations.\nBuilding on this foundation, we further propose an enhanced variant that\nleverages graph-based memory representations to capture complex relational\nstructures among conversational elements. Through comprehensive evaluations on\nLOCOMO benchmark, we systematically compare our approaches against six baseline\ncategories: (i) established memory-augmented systems, (ii) retrieval-augmented\ngeneration (RAG) with varying chunk sizes and k-values, (iii) a full-context\napproach that processes the entire conversation history, (iv) an open-source\nmemory solution, (v) a proprietary model system, and (vi) a dedicated memory\nmanagement platform. Empirical results show that our methods consistently\noutperform all existing memory systems across four question categories:\nsingle-hop, temporal, multi-hop, and open-domain. Notably, Mem0 achieves 26%\nrelative improvements in the LLM-as-a-Judge metric over OpenAI, while Mem0 with\ngraph memory achieves around 2% higher overall score than the base\nconfiguration. Beyond accuracy gains, we also markedly reduce computational\noverhead compared to full-context method. In particular, Mem0 attains a 91%\nlower p95 latency and saves more than 90% token cost, offering a compelling\nbalance between advanced reasoning capabilities and practical deployment\nconstraints. Our findings highlight critical role of structured, persistent\nmemory mechanisms for long-term conversational coherence, paving the way for\nmore reliable and efficient LLM-driven AI agents.&quot;,&quot;thumbnail&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-thumbnails.huggingface.co/social-thumbnails/papers/2504.19413.png&quot;,&quot;numComments&quot;:2,&quot;upvoted&quot;:false,&quot;submittedBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;60f1abe7544c2adfd699860c&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/1674929746905-60f1abe7544c2adfd699860c.jpeg&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;AK&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;akhaliq&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:true,&quot;isHf&quot;:true,&quot;isHfAdmin&quot;:false,&quot;isMod&quot;:false,&quot;followerCount&quot;:8928},&quot;isAuthorParticipating&quot;:false},{&quot;paper&quot;:{&quot;id&quot;:&quot;2501.07572&quot;,&quot;authors&quot;:[{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6785df7a934f275b48366bdf&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;644a4fbc2166258fccc664bc&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/noauth/8k3b44MbhQiWuo6i8BnYl.jpeg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Jialong Benchmarking LLMs in Web Traversal&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;644a4fbc2166258fccc664bc&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/noauth/8k3b44MbhQiWuo6i8BnYl.jpeg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Jialong Wu&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;callanwu&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) demonstrates remarkable performance\nacross tasks in open-domain question-answering. However, traditional search\nengines may retrieve shallow content, limiting the ability of LLMs to handle\ncomplex, multi-layered information. To address it, we introduce WebWalkerQA, a\nbenchmark designed to assess the ability of LLMs to perform web traversal. It\nevaluates the capacity of LLMs to traverse a website's subpages to extract\nhigh-quality data systematically. We propose WebWalker, which is a multi-agent\nframework that mimics human-like web navigation through an explore-critic\nparadigm. Extensive experimental results show that WebWalkerQA is challenging\nand demonstrates the effectiveness of RAG combined with WebWalker, through the\nhorizontal and vertical integration in real-world scenarios.&quot;,&quot;upvotes&quot;:23,&quot;discussionId&quot;:&quot;6785df7c934f275b48366cff&quot;,&quot;githubRepo&quot;:&quot;https://github.com/alibaba-nlp/webwalker&quot;,&quot;githubRepoAddedBy&quot;:&quot;auto&quot;,&quot;ai_summary&quot;:&quot;WebWalkerQA assesses LLMs' ability to traverse websites for high-quality data, showing enhancements when combined with RAG using the WebWalker multi-agent framework.&quot;,&quot;ai_keywords&quot;:[&quot;Retrieval-augmented generation&quot;,&quot;RAG&quot;,&quot;benchmark&quot;,&quot;LLMs&quot;,&quot;web traversal&quot;,&quot;explore-critic paradigm&quot;,&quot;WebWalker&quot;],&quot;githubStars&quot;:17615},&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-01-13T13:58:07.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;WebWalker: Benchmarking LLMs in Web Traversal&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) demonstrates remarkable performance\nacross tasks in open-domain question-answering. However, traditional search\nengines may retrieve shallow content, limiting the ability of LLMs to handle\ncomplex, multi-layered information. To address it, we introduce WebWalkerQA, a\nbenchmark designed to assess the ability of LLMs to perform web traversal. It\nevaluates the capacity of LLMs to traverse a website's subpages to extract\nhigh-quality data systematically. We propose WebWalker, which is a multi-agent\nframework that mimics human-like web navigation through an explore-critic\nparadigm. Extensive experimental results show that WebWalkerQA is challenging\nand demonstrates the effectiveness of RAG combined with WebWalker, through the\nhorizontal and vertical integration in real-world scenarios.&quot;,&quot;thumbnail&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-thumbnails.huggingface.co/social-thumbnails/papers/2501.07572.png&quot;,&quot;numComments&quot;:3,&quot;upvoted&quot;:false,&quot;submittedBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;644a4fbc2166258fccc664bc&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/noauth/8k3b44MbhQiWuo6i8BnYl.jpeg&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Jialong Wu&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;callanwu&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;isHf&quot;:false,&quot;isHfAdmin&quot;:false,&quot;isMod&quot;:false,&quot;followerCount&quot;:30},&quot;isAuthorParticipating&quot;:true},{&quot;paper&quot;:{&quot;id&quot;:&quot;2512.12602&quot;,&quot;authors&quot;:[{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6940cc8365f1e24a1177ff48&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;65756c5e1488186315c6696d&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;/avatars/2ec67e0d1921b6635c69669b591a3110.svg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:true,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Jingdi Lei&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;huaXiaKyrie&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Jingdi Lei&quot;,&quot;status&quot;:&quot;claimed_verified&quot;,&quot;statusLastChangedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-12-16T10:18:27.530Z&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6940cc8365f1e24a1177ff49&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;64bce15bafd1e46c5504ad38&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/64bce15bafd1e46c5504ad38/vkEjiu-mIagKlrXzDH75o.png&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Di Zhang&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;di-zhang-fdu&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Di Zhang&quot;,&quot;status&quot;:&quot;claimed_verified&quot;,&quot;statusLastChangedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-12-16T09:47:40.902Z&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;6940cc8365f1e24a1177ff4a&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Soujanya Poria&quot;,&quot;hidden&quot;:false}],&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-12-14T08:51:02.000Z&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyAt&quot;:&quot;2025-12-16T00:36:26.596Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Error-Free Linear Attention is a Free Lunch: Exact Solution from Continuous-Time Dynamics&quot;,&quot;submittedOnDailyBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;626b626405fe1cb65725aca1&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/626b626405fe1cb65725aca1/ZVSbhynzpQhVGq9kGywW6.png&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Soujanya Poria&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;soujanyaporia&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Linear-time attention and State Space Models (SSMs) promise to solve the quadratic cost bottleneck in long-context language models employing softmax attention. We introduce Error-Free Linear Attention (EFLA), a numerically stable, fully parallelism and generalized formulation of the delta rule. Specifically, we formulate the online learning update as a continuous-time dynamical system and prove that its exact solution is not only attainable but also computable in linear time with full parallelism. By leveraging the rank-1 structure of the dynamics matrix, we directly derive the exact closed-form solution effectively corresponding to the infinite-order Runge-Kutta method. This attention mechanism is theoretically free from error accumulation, perfectly capturing the continuous dynamics while preserving the linear-time complexity. Through an extensive suite of experiments, we show that EFLA enables robust performance in noisy environments, achieving lower language modeling perplexity and superior downstream benchmark performance than DeltaNet without introducing additional parameters. Our work provides a new theoretical foundation for building high-fidelity, scalable linear-time attention models.&quot;,&quot;upvotes&quot;:31,&quot;discussionId&quot;:&quot;6940cc8365f1e24a1177ff4b&quot;,&quot;githubRepo&quot;:&quot;https://github.com/declare-lab/EFLA&quot;,&quot;githubRepoAddedBy&quot;:&quot;user&quot;,&quot;ai_summary&quot;:&quot;Error-Free Linear Attention (EFLA) is a stable, parallelizable, and theoretically sound linear-time attention mechanism that outperforms DeltaNet in language modeling and downstream tasks.&quot;,&quot;ai_keywords&quot;:[&quot;linear-time attention&quot;,&quot;state space models&quot;,&quot;softmax attention&quot;,&quot;error-free linear attention&quot;,&quot;delta rule&quot;,&quot;continuous-time dynamical system&quot;,&quot;rank-1 structure&quot;,&quot;infinite-order Runge-Kutta method&quot;,&quot;language modeling perplexity&quot;,&quot;DeltaNet&quot;],&quot;githubStars&quot;:17,&quot;organization&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;626ab9dac804c432c1b27a48&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;declare-lab&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Deep Cognition and Language Research (DeCLaRe) Lab&quot;,&quot;avatar&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/626b626405fe1cb65725aca1/grq3rj2uj0WRjjPjAtR1I.png&quot;}},&quot;publishedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-12-14T03:51:02.000Z&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Error-Free Linear Attention is a Free Lunch: Exact Solution from Continuous-Time Dynamics&quot;,&quot;summary&quot;:&quot;Linear-time attention and State Space Models (SSMs) promise to solve the quadratic cost bottleneck in long-context language models employing softmax attention. We introduce Error-Free Linear Attention (EFLA), a numerically stable, fully parallelism and generalized formulation of the delta rule. Specifically, we formulate the online learning update as a continuous-time dynamical system and prove that its exact solution is not only attainable but also computable in linear time with full parallelism. By leveraging the rank-1 structure of the dynamics matrix, we directly derive the exact closed-form solution effectively corresponding to the infinite-order Runge-Kutta method. This attention mechanism is theoretically free from error accumulation, perfectly capturing the continuous dynamics while preserving the linear-time complexity. Through an extensive suite of experiments, we show that EFLA enables robust performance in noisy environments, achieving lower language modeling perplexity and superior downstream benchmark performance than DeltaNet without introducing additional parameters. Our work provides a new theoretical foundation for building high-fidelity, scalable linear-time attention models.&quot;,&quot;thumbnail&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-thumbnails.huggingface.co/social-thumbnails/papers/2512.12602.png&quot;,&quot;numComments&quot;:1,&quot;upvoted&quot;:false,&quot;submittedBy&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;626b626405fe1cb65725aca1&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/626b626405fe1cb65725aca1/ZVSbhynzpQhVGq9kGywW6.png&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Soujanya Poria&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;soujanyaporia&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:false,&quot;isHf&quot;:false,&quot;isHfAdmin&quot;:false,&quot;isMod&quot;:false,&quot;followerCount&quot;:10},&quot;organization&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;626ab9dac804c432c1b27a48&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;declare-lab&quot;,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;Deep Cognition and Language Research (DeCLaRe) Lab&quot;,&quot;avatar&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/626b626405fe1cb65725aca1/grq3rj2uj0WRjjPjAtR1I.png&quot;},&quot;isAuthorParticipating&quot;:false}],&quot;publisher&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;60f1abe7544c2adfd699860c&quot;,&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/1674929746905-60f1abe7544c2adfd699860c.jpeg&quot;,&quot;isPro&quot;:true,&quot;fullname&quot;:&quot;AK&quot;,&quot;user&quot;:&quot;akhaliq&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;},&quot;query&quot;:{},&quot;isTrending&quot;:true}">

<section class="container relative mb-20 mt-8 md:mt-14"><div class="mb-8 grid grid-cols-6 items-start md:mb-12 md:grid-cols-12 md:gap-x-4"><div class="order-1 col-span-5 md:order-none md:col-span-10 lg:col-span-8 xl:col-span-4 xl:pl-0"><div class="flex items-center gap-3"><h1 class="text-2xl font-bold md:text-3xl">Trending Papers</h1>
				</div>
			<h2 class="whitespace-nowrap text-gray-500 xl:text-lg">by<a href="/akhaliq"><img alt="" class="mx-1.5 inline h-4" src="/front/assets/papers-by.png"><span class="underline">AK</span></a> and the research community
			</h2></div>

	<div class="relative grid gap-5 *:[content-visibility:auto] grid-cols-1"><article class="relative overflow-hidden rounded-xl border"><div class="hidden h-40 md:flex"><div class="relative flex-shrink-0"><a href="/papers/2511.12884" class="block h-full w-56 cursor-pointer overflow-hidden bg-white dark:border-gray-800 max-md:border-b md:border-r"><img src="https://cdn-thumbnails.huggingface.co/social-thumbnails/papers/2511.12884.png" loading="lazy" decoding="async" alt="" class="size-full object-cover object-center opacity-80 dark:opacity-70 dark:invert"></a>

			<div class="shadow-xs pointer-events-none absolute bottom-2 right-2 flex h-6 items-center gap-1 whitespace-nowrap rounded-md border bg-white px-2 text-xs leading-none text-gray-700 dark:bg-gray-900 dark:text-gray-400">Submitted by
					<img alt="" loading="lazy" class="size-2.5 rounded-full  flex-none select-none" src="https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/62b4f3b7464e664268bf4e85/atFIscmB37aur0a1zuQ2o.jpeg" crossorigin="anonymous">
					hao-li</div></div>

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b flex min-w-0 flex-1 flex-col justify-center p-6"><h3 class="mb-1.5 text-xl font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2511.12884" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer text-balance">Agent READMEs: An Empirical Study of Context Files for Agentic Coding</a></h3>

			<div class="mb-2"><p class="line-clamp-2 text-sm text-gray-500 dark:text-gray-400">Agentic coding tools receive goals written in natural language as input, break them down into specific tasks, and write or execute the actual code with minimal human intervention. Central to this process are agent context files ("READMEs for agents") that provide persistent, project-level instructions. In this paper, we conduct the first large-scale empirical study of 2,303 agent context files from 1,925 repositories to characterize their structure, maintenance, and content. We find that these files are not static documentation but complex, difficult-to-read artifacts that evolve like configuration code, maintained through frequent, small additions. Our content analysis of 16 instruction types shows that developers prioritize functional context, such as build and run commands (62.3%), implementation details (69.9%), and architecture (67.7%). We also identify a significant gap: non-functional requirements like security (14.5%) and performance (14.5%) are rarely specified. These findings indicate that while developers use context files to make agents functional, they provide few guardrails to ensure that agent-written code is secure or performant, highlighting the need for improved tooling and practices.</p></div>

			<div class="flex min-w-0 items-center text-sm text-gray-400 dark:text-gray-500"><ul class="flex items-center  flex-row-reverse    text-xs "><li class="   -mr-1.5 h-3 w-3 md:h-4 md:w-4 bg-linear-to-br block flex-none rounded-full border-2 border-white from-gray-300 to-gray-100 dark:border-gray-900 dark:from-gray-600 dark:to-gray-800" title="Kundjanasith Thonglek" style="content-visibility:auto;">
			</li><li class="   -mr-1.5 h-3 w-3 md:h-4 md:w-4 bg-linear-to-br block flex-none rounded-full border-2 border-white from-gray-300 to-gray-100 dark:border-gray-900 dark:from-gray-600 dark:to-gray-800" title="Brittany Reid" style="content-visibility:auto;">
			</li><li class="   -mr-1.5 h-3 w-3 md:h-4 md:w-4 bg-linear-to-br block flex-none rounded-full border-2 border-white from-gray-300 to-gray-100 dark:border-gray-900 dark:from-gray-600 dark:to-gray-800" title="Yutaro Kashiwa" style="content-visibility:auto;">
			</li><li class="   -mr-1.5 h-3 w-3 md:h-4 md:w-4 bg-linear-to-br block flex-none rounded-full border-2 border-white from-gray-300 to-gray-100 dark:border-gray-900 dark:from-gray-600 dark:to-gray-800" title="Worawalan Chatlatanagulchai" style="content-visibility:auto;">
			</li><li class="   -mr-1.5 h-3 w-3 md:h-4 md:w-4 bg-linear-to-br block flex-none rounded-full border-2 border-white from-gray-300 to-gray-100 dark:border-gray-900 dark:from-gray-600 dark:to-gray-800" title="hao-li" style="content-visibility:auto;"><img class="overflow-hidden" alt="" src="https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/62b4f3b7464e664268bf4e85/atFIscmB37aur0a1zuQ2o.jpeg" loading="lazy">
			</li>

		<li class="text-xs text-gray-600 hover:text-gray-700 dark:text-gray-400 dark:hover:text-gray-300 order-first ml-2"><span class="text-gray-400 dark:text-gray-500">11 authors</span></li></ul>
				<span class="mx-2"></span>
					<span>Published on Nov 17, 2025</span></div></div>

			<a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2511.12884" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" class="btn flex h-9 w-full items-center justify-center gap-1 text-sm"><svg class="size-3" 	<div class="flex flex-col md:hidden"><div class="relative w-full"><a href="/papers/2511.12884" class="block h-48 w-full cursor-pointer overflow-hidden bg-white dark:border-gray-800 max-md:border-b md:border-r"><img src="https://cdn-thumbnails.huggingface.co/social-thumbnails/papers/2511.12884.png" loading="lazy" decoding="async" alt="" class="size-full object-cover object-center opacity-80 dark:opacity-70 dark:invert"></a>

			<div class="shadow-xs pointer-events-none absolute bottom-2 right-2 flex h-6 items-center gap-1 whitespace-nowrap rounded-md border bg-white px-2 text-xs leading-none text-gray-700 dark:bg-gray-900 dark:text-gray-400">Submitted by
					<img alt="" loading="lazy" class="size-2.5 rounded-full  flex-none select-none" src="https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/62b4f3b7464e664268bf4e85/atFIscmB37aur0a1zuQ2o.jpeg" crossorigin="anonymous">
					hao-li</div></div>

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b p-4"><h3 class="mb-2 text-lg font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2511.12884" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer">Agent READMEs: An Empirical Study of Context Files for Agentic Coding</a></h3>

			<div class="mb-2"><p class="line-clamp-2 text-sm text-gray-600 dark:text-gray-300">Agentic coding tools receive goals written in natural language as input, break them down into specific tasks, and write or execute the actual code with minimal human intervention. Central to this process are agent context files ("READMEs for agents") that provide persistent, project-level instructions. In this paper, we conduct the first large-scale empirical study of 2,303 agent context files from 1,925 repositories to characterize their structure, maintenance, and content. We find that these files are not static documentation but complex, difficult-to-read artifacts that evolve like configuration code, maintained through frequent, small additions. Our content analysis of 16 instruction types shows that developers prioritize functional context, such as build and run commands (62.3%), implementation details (69.9%), and architecture (67.7%). We also identify a significant gap: non-functional requirements like security (14.5%) and performance (14.5%) are rarely specified. These findings indicate that while developers use context files to make agents functional, they provide few guardrails to ensure that agent-written code is secure or performant, highlighting the need for improved tooling and practices.</p></div>

			<div class="mb-3 flex items-center text-sm text-gray-500 dark:text-gray-400"><ul class="flex items-center  flex-row-reverse    text-xs "><li class="   -mr-1.5 h-3 w-3 md:h-4 md:w-4 bg-linear-to-br block flex-none rounded-full border-2 border-white from-gray-300 to-gray-100 dark:border-gray-900 dark:from-gray-600 dark:to-gray-800" title="Kundjanasith Thonglek" style="content-visibility:auto;">
			</li><li class="   -mr-1.5 h-3 w-3 md:h-4 md:w-4 bg-linear-to-br block flex-none rounded-full border-2 border-white from-gray-300 to-gray-100 dark:border-gray-900 dark:from-gray-600 dark:to-gray-800" title="Brittany Reid" style="content-visibility:auto;">
			</li><li class="   -mr-1.5 h-3 w-3 md:h-4 md:w-4 bg-linear-to-br block flex-none rounded-full border-2 border-white from-gray-300 to-gray-100 dark:border-gray-900 dark:from-gray-600 dark:to-gray-800" title="Yutaro Kashiwa" style="content-visibility:auto;">
			</li><li class="   -mr-1.5 h-3 w-3 md:h-4 md:w-4 bg-linear-to-br block flex-none rounded-full border-2 border-white from-gray-300 to-gray-100 dark:border-gray-900 dark:from-gray-600 dark:to-gray-800" title="Worawalan Chatlatanagulchai" style="content-visibility:auto;">
			</li><li class="   -mr-1.5 h-3 w-3 md:h-4 md:w-4 bg-linear-to-br block flex-none rounded-full border-2 border-white from-gray-300 to-gray-100 dark:border-gray-900 dark:from-gray-600 dark:to-gray-800" title="hao-li" style="content-visibility:auto;"><img class="overflow-hidden" alt="" src="https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/62b4f3b7464e664268bf4e85/atFIscmB37aur0a1zuQ2o.jpeg" loading="lazy">

		<li class="text-xs text-gray-600 hover:text-gray-700 dark:text-gray-400 dark:hover:text-gray-300 order-first ml-2"><span>11 authors</span></li></ul>
				<span class="mx-1"></span>

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b flex min-w-0 flex-1 flex-col justify-center p-6"><h3 class="mb-1.5 text-xl font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2512.11253" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer text-balance">PersonaLive! Expressive Portrait Image Animation for Live Streaming</a></h3>

			<div class="mb-2"><p class="line-clamp-2 text-sm text-gray-500 dark:text-gray-400">PersonaLive is a diffusion-based framework for real-time portrait animation that enhances speed and efficiency through multi-stage training, hybrid implicit signals, appearance distillation, and autoregressive micro-chunk streaming.</p></div>

			<div class="flex min-w-0 items-center text-sm text-gray-400 dark:text-gray-500"><a href="/GVCLab" class="inline-flex min-w-0 max-w-full items-center rounded-full border border-blue-200/70 bg-blue-50 py-0.5 text-blue-700 hover:border-blue-200 hover:bg-blue-100 dark:border-blue-500/20 dark:bg-blue-900/30 dark:text-blue-300 dark:hover:border-blue-500/30 dark:hover:bg-blue-900/50 px-1.5 text-xs gap-1 "><img src="https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/63184c517ca1b876d99b7e0e/0mQ2Re10Y0HKnD878FGiU.png" alt="GVCLab" class="size-3 rounded-sm">
	<span class="block min-w-0 truncate font-medium">GVC Lab at Great Bay University</span></a>
				<span class="mx-2"></span>
					<span>Published on Dec 12, 2025</span></div></div>

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b flex w-40 flex-col items-stretch justify-center gap-2 p-4"><div class="w-full"><div class="flex flex-wrap items-center gap-2.5 pt-1  z-1 lg:sticky lg:top-8"><a href="/login?next=%2Fpapers%2F2512.11253" class="self-start">
	<div class="shadow-alternate group flex h-9 cursor-pointer select-none items-center gap-2 rounded-lg border pl-3 pr-3.5 border-gray-300 bg-white dark:bg-gray-850 w-full justify-center text-sm border border-gray-200 dark:border-gray-800"><input disabled type="checkbox"  class="peer hidden">
		<svg class="text-xs text-gray-500 peer-checked:text-gray-500 group-hover:text-gray-500" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" aria-hidden="true" role="img" width="1em" height="1em" preserveAspectRatio="xMidYMid meet" viewBox="0 0 12 12"><path fill="currentColor" d="M5.19 2.67a.94.94 0 0 1 1.62 0l3.31 5.72a.94.94 0 0 1-.82 1.4H2.7a.94.94 0 0 1-.82-1.4l3.31-5.7v-.02Z"></path></svg>

					taesiri</div></div>

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b p-4"><h3 class="mb-2 text-lg font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2512.11253" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer">PersonaLive! Expressive Portrait Image Animation for Live Streaming</a></h3>

			<div class="mb-2"><p class="line-clamp-2 text-sm text-gray-600 dark:text-gray-300">PersonaLive is a diffusion-based framework for real-time portrait animation that enhances speed and efficiency through multi-stage training, hybrid implicit signals, appearance distillation, and autoregressive micro-chunk streaming.</p></div>

			<div class="mb-3 flex items-center text-sm text-gray-500 dark:text-gray-400"><a href="/GVCLab" class="inline-flex min-w-0 max-w-full items-center rounded-full border border-blue-200/70 bg-blue-50 py-0.5 text-blue-700 hover:border-blue-200 hover:bg-blue-100 dark:border-blue-500/20 dark:bg-blue-900/30 dark:text-blue-300 dark:hover:border-blue-500/30 dark:hover:bg-blue-900/50 px-1.5 text-xs gap-1 "><img src="https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/63184c517ca1b876d99b7e0e/0mQ2Re10Y0HKnD878FGiU.png" alt="GVCLab" class="size-3 rounded-sm">
	<span class="block min-w-0 truncate font-medium">GVC Lab at Great Bay University</span></a>
				<span class="mx-1"></span>
					<span>Dec 12, 2025</span></div>

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b p-4"><h3 class="mb-2 text-lg font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2508.19205" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer">VibeVoice Technical Report</a></h3>

			<div class="mb-2"><p class="line-clamp-2 text-sm text-gray-600 dark:text-gray-300">VibeVoice synthesizes long-form multi-speaker speech using next-token diffusion and a highly efficient continuous speech tokenizer, achieving superior performance and fidelity.</p></div>

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b flex min-w-0 flex-1 flex-col justify-center p-6"><h3 class="mb-1.5 text-xl font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2512.07921" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer text-balance">DeepCode: Open Agentic Coding</a></h3>

			<div class="mb-2"><p class="line-clamp-2 text-sm text-gray-500 dark:text-gray-400">DeepCode, a fully autonomous framework, addresses the challenges of document-to-codebase synthesis by optimizing information flow through source compression, structured indexing, knowledge injection, and error correction, achieving state-of-the-art performance and surpassing human experts.</p></div>

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b p-4"><h3 class="mb-2 text-lg font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2512.07921" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer">DeepCode: Open Agentic Coding</a></h3>

			<div class="mb-2"><p class="line-clamp-2 text-sm text-gray-600 dark:text-gray-300">DeepCode, a fully autonomous framework, addresses the challenges of document-to-codebase synthesis by optimizing information flow through source compression, structured indexing, knowledge injection, and error correction, achieving state-of-the-art performance and surpassing human experts.</p></div>

			<div class="mb-3 flex items-center text-sm text-gray-500 dark:text-gray-400"><ul class="flex items-center  flex-row-reverse    text-xs mr-1.5"><li class="   -mr-1.5 h-3 w-3 md:h-4 md:w-4 bg-linear-to-br block flex-none rounded-full border-2 border-white from-gray-300 to-gray-100 dark:border-gray-900 dark:from-gray-600 dark:to-gray-800" title="Chao Huang" style="content-visibility:auto;">

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b flex min-w-0 flex-1 flex-col justify-center p-6"><h3 class="mb-1.5 text-xl font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2407.04051" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer text-balance">FunAudioLLM: Voice Understanding and Generation Foundation Models for

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b p-4"><h3 class="mb-2 text-lg font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2407.04051" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer">FunAudioLLM: Voice Understanding and Generation Foundation Models for

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b flex min-w-0 flex-1 flex-col justify-center p-6"><h3 class="mb-1.5 text-xl font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2511.22699" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer text-balance">Z-Image: An Efficient Image Generation Foundation Model with Single-Stream Diffusion Transformer</a></h3>

			<div class="mb-2"><p class="line-clamp-2 text-sm text-gray-500 dark:text-gray-400">Z-Image, a 6B-parameter Scalable Single-Stream Diffusion Transformer (S3-DiT) model, achieves high-performance image generation with reduced computational cost, offering sub-second inference and compatibility with consumer hardware.</p></div>

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b flex min-w-0 flex-1 flex-col justify-center p-6"><h3 class="mb-1.5 text-xl font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2503.11576" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer text-balance">SmolDocling: An ultra-compact vision-language model for end-to-end
  multi-modal document conversion</a></h3>

			<div class="mb-2"><p class="line-clamp-2 text-sm text-gray-500 dark:text-gray-400">SmolDocling is a compact vision-language model that performs end-to-end document conversion with robust performance across various document types using 256M parameters and a new markup format.</p></div>

			<div class="flex min-w-0 items-center text-sm text-gray-400 dark:text-gray-500"><ul class="flex items-center  flex-row-reverse    text-xs "><li class="   -mr-1.5 h-3 w-3 md:h-4 md:w-4 bg-linear-to-br block flex-none rounded-full border-2 border-white from-gray-300 to-gray-100 dark:border-gray-900 dark:from-gray-600 dark:to-gray-800" title="nlivathinos" style="content-visibility:auto;"><img class="overflow-hidden" alt="" src="https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/67938030aa5e507f71eb0e44/U_7TxvZFuTeJ-Gtfatbzj.jpeg" loading="lazy">

					andito</div></div>

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b p-4"><h3 class="mb-2 text-lg font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2503.11576" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer">SmolDocling: An ultra-compact vision-language model for end-to-end
  multi-modal document conversion</a></h3>

			<div class="mb-2"><p class="line-clamp-2 text-sm text-gray-600 dark:text-gray-300">SmolDocling is a compact vision-language model that performs end-to-end document conversion with robust performance across various document types using 256M parameters and a new markup format.</p></div>

			<div class="mb-3 flex items-center text-sm text-gray-500 dark:text-gray-400"><ul class="flex items-center  flex-row-reverse    text-xs "><li class="   -mr-1.5 h-3 w-3 md:h-4 md:w-4 bg-linear-to-br block flex-none rounded-full border-2 border-white from-gray-300 to-gray-100 dark:border-gray-900 dark:from-gray-600 dark:to-gray-800" title="nlivathinos" style="content-visibility:auto;"><img class="overflow-hidden" alt="" src="https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/67938030aa5e507f71eb0e44/U_7TxvZFuTeJ-Gtfatbzj.jpeg" loading="lazy">
			</li><li class="   -mr-1.5 h-3 w-3 md:h-4 md:w-4 bg-linear-to-br block flex-none rounded-full border-2 border-white from-gray-300 to-gray-100 dark:border-gray-900 dark:from-gray-600 dark:to-gray-800" title="MaxMnemonic" style="content-visibility:auto;"><img class="overflow-hidden" alt="" src="https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/665a2d536a8e042a0bf9b7b0/wA8QmKPW1BSRWNJyx_st0.jpeg" loading="lazy">
			</li><li class="   -mr-1.5 h-3 w-3 md:h-4 md:w-4 bg-linear-to-br block flex-none rounded-full border-2 border-white from-gray-300 to-gray-100 dark:border-gray-900 dark:from-gray-600 dark:to-gray-800" title="MatteoOmenetti" style="content-visibility:auto;"><img class="overflow-hidden" alt="" src="https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/663e1254887b6f5645a0399f/CXtmipcpwK3LMIQNeinVg.jpeg" loading="lazy">

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b flex min-w-0 flex-1 flex-col justify-center p-6"><h3 class="mb-1.5 text-xl font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2511.19663" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer text-balance">Fara-7B: An Efficient Agentic Model for Computer Use</a></h3>

			<div class="mb-2"><p class="line-clamp-2 text-sm text-gray-500 dark:text-gray-400">FaraGen creates synthetic datasets for computer use agents, enabling the training of efficient and high-performing models like Fara-7B on diverse web tasks, outperforming larger models on benchmarks.</p></div>

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b p-4"><h3 class="mb-2 text-lg font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2511.19663" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer">Fara-7B: An Efficient Agentic Model for Computer Use</a></h3>

			<div class="mb-2"><p class="line-clamp-2 text-sm text-gray-600 dark:text-gray-300">FaraGen creates synthetic datasets for computer use agents, enabling the training of efficient and high-performing models like Fara-7B on diverse web tasks, outperforming larger models on benchmarks.</p></div>

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b flex min-w-0 flex-1 flex-col justify-center p-6"><h3 class="mb-1.5 text-xl font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2510.23856" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer text-balance">From Benchmarks to Business Impact: Deploying IBM Generalist Agent in Enterprise Production</a></h3>

			<div class="mb-2"><p class="line-clamp-2 text-sm text-gray-500 dark:text-gray-400">IBM's CUGA, a generalist agent with a hierarchical planner-executor architecture, demonstrates state-of-the-art performance in academic benchmarks and shows potential for enterprise adoption in business-process-outsourcing, addressing scalability, auditability, safety, and governance.</p></div>

	<div class="flex flex-col md:hidden"><div class="relative w-full"><a href="/papers/2510.23856" class="block h-48 w-full cursor-pointer overflow-hidden bg-white dark:border-gray-800 max-md:border-b md:border-r"><img src="https://cdn-thumbnails.huggingface.co/social-thumbnails/papers/2510.23856.png" loading="lazy" decoding="async" alt="" class="size-full object-cover object-center opacity-80 dark:opacity-70 dark:invert"></a>

			</div>

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b p-4"><h3 class="mb-2 text-lg font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2510.23856" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer">From Benchmarks to Business Impact: Deploying IBM Generalist Agent in Enterprise Production</a></h3>

			<div class="mb-2"><p class="line-clamp-2 text-sm text-gray-600 dark:text-gray-300">IBM's CUGA, a generalist agent with a hierarchical planner-executor architecture, demonstrates state-of-the-art performance in academic benchmarks and shows potential for enterprise adoption in business-process-outsourcing, addressing scalability, auditability, safety, and governance.</p></div>

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b flex min-w-0 flex-1 flex-col justify-center p-6"><h3 class="mb-1.5 text-xl font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2507.03009" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer text-balance">PDFMathTranslate: Scientific Document Translation Preserving Layouts</a></h3>

			<div class="mb-2"><p class="line-clamp-2 text-sm text-gray-500 dark:text-gray-400">PDFMathTranslate is an open-source software that translates scientific documents while maintaining layout integrity, utilizing advancements in large language models and layout detection.</p></div>

	<div class="flex flex-col md:hidden"><div class="relative w-full"><a href="/papers/2507.03009" class="block h-48 w-full cursor-pointer overflow-hidden bg-white dark:border-gray-800 max-md:border-b md:border-r"><img src="https://cdn-thumbnails.huggingface.co/social-thumbnails/papers/2507.03009.png" loading="lazy" decoding="async" alt="" class="size-full object-cover object-center opacity-80 dark:opacity-70 dark:invert"></a>

			</div>

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b p-4"><h3 class="mb-2 text-lg font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2507.03009" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer">PDFMathTranslate: Scientific Document Translation Preserving Layouts</a></h3>

			<div class="mb-2"><p class="line-clamp-2 text-sm text-gray-600 dark:text-gray-300">PDFMathTranslate is an open-source software that translates scientific documents while maintaining layout integrity, utilizing advancements in large language models and layout detection.</p></div>

			<div class="mb-3 flex items-center text-sm text-gray-500 dark:text-gray-400"><ul class="flex items-center  flex-row-reverse    text-xs mr-1.5"><li class="   -mr-1.5 h-3 w-3 md:h-4 md:w-4 bg-linear-to-br block flex-none rounded-full border-2 border-white from-gray-300 to-gray-100 dark:border-gray-900 dark:from-gray-600 dark:to-gray-800" title="Xiangyao Ma" style="content-visibility:auto;">

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b flex min-w-0 flex-1 flex-col justify-center p-6"><h3 class="mb-1.5 text-xl font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2512.11799" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer text-balance">V-RGBX: Video Editing with Accurate Controls over Intrinsic Properties</a></h3>

			<div class="mb-2"><p class="line-clamp-2 text-sm text-gray-500 dark:text-gray-400">V-RGBX is an end-to-end framework for intrinsic-aware video editing that combines video inverse rendering, photorealistic synthesis, and keyframe-based editing to produce consistent and physically plausible edits.</p></div>

			<div class="flex min-w-0 items-center text-sm text-gray-400 dark:text-gray-500"><a href="/adobe" class="inline-flex min-w-0 max-w-full items-center rounded-full border border-blue-200/70 bg-blue-50 py-0.5 text-blue-700 hover:border-blue-200 hover:bg-blue-100 dark:border-blue-500/20 dark:bg-blue-900/30 dark:text-blue-300 dark:hover:border-blue-500/30 dark:hover:bg-blue-900/50 px-1.5 text-xs gap-1 "><img src="https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/1645217431826-61e35e517ac6b6d06cfa8081.png" alt="adobe" class="size-3 rounded-sm">

					taesiri</div></div>

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b p-4"><h3 class="mb-2 text-lg font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2512.11799" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer">V-RGBX: Video Editing with Accurate Controls over Intrinsic Properties</a></h3>

			<div class="mb-2"><p class="line-clamp-2 text-sm text-gray-600 dark:text-gray-300">V-RGBX is an end-to-end framework for intrinsic-aware video editing that combines video inverse rendering, photorealistic synthesis, and keyframe-based editing to produce consistent and physically plausible edits.</p></div>

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b p-4"><h3 class="mb-2 text-lg font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2511.16719" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer">SAM 3: Segment Anything with Concepts</a></h3>

			<div class="mb-2"><p class="line-clamp-2 text-sm text-gray-600 dark:text-gray-300">Segment Anything Model 3 achieves state-of-the-art performance in promptable concept segmentation and tracking by leveraging a unified model architecture with decoupled recognition and localization.</p></div>

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b p-4"><h3 class="mb-2 text-lg font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2507.14241" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer">Promptomatix: An Automatic Prompt Optimization Framework for Large
  Language Models</a></h3>

			<div class="mb-2"><p class="line-clamp-2 text-sm text-gray-600 dark:text-gray-300">Promptomatix automates prompt optimization for Large Language Models, improving performance and efficiency across various tasks.</p></div>

			<div class="mb-3 flex items-center text-sm text-gray-500 dark:text-gray-400"><ul class="flex items-center  flex-row-reverse    text-xs "><li class="   -mr-1.5 h-3 w-3 md:h-4 md:w-4 bg-linear-to-br block flex-none rounded-full border-2 border-white from-gray-300 to-gray-100 dark:border-gray-900 dark:from-gray-600 dark:to-gray-800" title="Juntao Tan" style="content-visibility:auto;">

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b p-4"><h3 class="mb-2 text-lg font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2512.10685" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer">Sharp Monocular View Synthesis in Less Than a Second</a></h3>

			<div class="mb-2"><p class="line-clamp-2 text-sm text-gray-600 dark:text-gray-300">SHARP synthesizes photorealistic views from a single image using a 3D Gaussian representation, achieving state-of-the-art results with rapid processing.</p></div>

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b flex min-w-0 flex-1 flex-col justify-center p-6"><h3 class="mb-1.5 text-xl font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2509.22186" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer text-balance">MinerU2.5: A Decoupled Vision-Language Model for Efficient
  High-Resolution Document Parsing</a></h3>

			<div class="mb-2"><p class="line-clamp-2 text-sm text-gray-500 dark:text-gray-400">MinerU2.5, a 1.2B-parameter document parsing vision-language model, achieves state-of-the-art recognition accuracy with computational efficiency through a coarse-to-fine parsing strategy.</p></div>

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b p-4"><h3 class="mb-2 text-lg font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2509.22186" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer">MinerU2.5: A Decoupled Vision-Language Model for Efficient
  High-Resolution Document Parsing</a></h3>

			<div class="mb-2"><p class="line-clamp-2 text-sm text-gray-600 dark:text-gray-300">MinerU2.5, a 1.2B-parameter document parsing vision-language model, achieves state-of-the-art recognition accuracy with computational efficiency through a coarse-to-fine parsing strategy.</p></div>

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b p-4"><h3 class="mb-2 text-lg font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2412.00568" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer">The Well: a Large-Scale Collection of Diverse Physics Simulations for
  Machine Learning</a></h3>

			<div class="mb-2"><p class="line-clamp-2 text-sm text-gray-600 dark:text-gray-300">A large-scale dataset collection, The Well, provides diverse numerical simulations for benchmarking machine learning models in physical systems simulation.</p></div>

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b flex min-w-0 flex-1 flex-col justify-center p-6"><h3 class="mb-1.5 text-xl font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2410.17799" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer text-balance">OmniFlatten: An End-to-end GPT Model for Seamless Voice Conversation</a></h3>

			<div class="mb-2"><p class="line-clamp-2 text-sm text-gray-500 dark:text-gray-400">A novel GPT-based model, OmniFlatten, enables real-time natural full-duplex spoken dialogue through a multi-stage post-training technique that integrates speech and text without altering the original model's architecture.</p></div>

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b p-4"><h3 class="mb-2 text-lg font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2410.17799" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer">OmniFlatten: An End-to-end GPT Model for Seamless Voice Conversation</a></h3>

			<div class="mb-2"><p class="line-clamp-2 text-sm text-gray-600 dark:text-gray-300">A novel GPT-based model, OmniFlatten, enables real-time natural full-duplex spoken dialogue through a multi-stage post-training technique that integrates speech and text without altering the original model's architecture.</p></div>
