			<div class="mb-2"><p class="line-clamp-2 text-sm text-gray-500 dark:text-gray-400">MinerU is an open-source tool that enhances document content extraction using fine-tuned models and pre/postprocessing rules across diverse document types.</p></div>

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b p-4"><h3 class="mb-2 text-lg font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2409.18839" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer">MinerU: An Open-Source Solution for Precise Document Content Extraction</a></h3>

			<div class="mb-2"><p class="line-clamp-2 text-sm text-gray-600 dark:text-gray-300">MinerU is an open-source tool that enhances document content extraction using fine-tuned models and pre/postprocessing rules across diverse document types.</p></div>

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b flex min-w-0 flex-1 flex-col justify-center p-6"><h3 class="mb-1.5 text-xl font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2512.08765" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer text-balance">Wan-Move: Motion-controllable Video Generation via Latent Trajectory Guidance</a></h3>

			<div class="mb-2"><p class="line-clamp-2 text-sm text-gray-500 dark:text-gray-400">Wan-Move enhances motion control in video generative models by integrating motion-aware features into latent space, enabling high-quality and scalable video synthesis.</p></div>

			<div class="flex min-w-0 items-center text-sm text-gray-400 dark:text-gray-500"><a href="/AlibabaTongyiLab" class="inline-flex min-w-0 max-w-full items-center rounded-full border border-blue-200/70 bg-blue-50 py-0.5 text-blue-700 hover:border-blue-200 hover:bg-blue-100 dark:border-blue-500/20 dark:bg-blue-900/30 dark:text-blue-300 dark:hover:border-blue-500/30 dark:hover:bg-blue-900/50 px-1.5 text-xs gap-1 "><img src="https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/67d1502bfabfe9974d1f77bb/XdUSVf6HqBzE7zFBfSDQP.png" alt="AlibabaTongyiLab" class="size-3 rounded-sm">
	<span class="block min-w-0 truncate font-medium">TongyiLab</span></a>
				<span class="mx-2"></span>
					<span>Published on Dec 9, 2025</span></div></div>

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b p-4"><h3 class="mb-2 text-lg font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2512.08765" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer">Wan-Move: Motion-controllable Video Generation via Latent Trajectory Guidance</a></h3>

			<div class="mb-2"><p class="line-clamp-2 text-sm text-gray-600 dark:text-gray-300">Wan-Move enhances motion control in video generative models by integrating motion-aware features into latent space, enabling high-quality and scalable video synthesis.</p></div>

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b flex min-w-0 flex-1 flex-col justify-center p-6"><h3 class="mb-1.5 text-xl font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2510.14528" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer text-balance">PaddleOCR-VL: Boosting Multilingual Document Parsing via a 0.9B Ultra-Compact Vision-Language Model</a></h3>

			<div class="mb-2"><p class="line-clamp-2 text-sm text-gray-500 dark:text-gray-400">PaddleOCR-VL, a vision-language model combining NaViT-style dynamic resolution and ERNIE, achieves state-of-the-art performance in document parsing and element recognition with high efficiency.</p></div>

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b p-4"><h3 class="mb-2 text-lg font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2510.14528" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer">PaddleOCR-VL: Boosting Multilingual Document Parsing via a 0.9B Ultra-Compact Vision-Language Model</a></h3>

			<div class="mb-2"><p class="line-clamp-2 text-sm text-gray-600 dark:text-gray-300">PaddleOCR-VL, a vision-language model combining NaViT-style dynamic resolution and ERNIE, achieves state-of-the-art performance in document parsing and element recognition with high efficiency.</p></div>

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b flex min-w-0 flex-1 flex-col justify-center p-6"><h3 class="mb-1.5 text-xl font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2502.06855" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer text-balance">Self-Supervised Prompt Optimization</a></h3>

			<div class="mb-2"><p class="line-clamp-2 text-sm text-gray-500 dark:text-gray-400">A self-supervised framework optimizes prompts for both closed and open-ended tasks by evaluating LLM outputs without external references, reducing costs and required data.</p></div>

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b p-4"><h3 class="mb-2 text-lg font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2502.06855" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer">Self-Supervised Prompt Optimization</a></h3>

			<div class="mb-2"><p class="line-clamp-2 text-sm text-gray-600 dark:text-gray-300">A self-supervised framework optimizes prompts for both closed and open-ended tasks by evaluating LLM outputs without external references, reducing costs and required data.</p></div>

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b flex min-w-0 flex-1 flex-col justify-center p-6"><h3 class="mb-1.5 text-xl font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2403.13372" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer text-balance">LlamaFactory: Unified Efficient Fine-Tuning of 100+ Language Models</a></h3>

			<div class="mb-2"><p class="line-clamp-2 text-sm text-gray-500 dark:text-gray-400">LlamaFactory is a unified framework enabling efficient fine-tuning of large language models across various tasks using a web-based user interface.</p></div>

			<div class="flex min-w-0 items-center text-sm text-gray-400 dark:text-gray-500"><ul class="flex items-center  flex-row-reverse    text-xs mr-1.5"><li class="   -mr-1.5 h-3 w-3 md:h-4 md:w-4 bg-linear-to-br block flex-none rounded-full border-2 border-white from-gray-300 to-gray-100 dark:border-gray-900 dark:from-gray-600 dark:to-gray-800" title="Zheyan Luo" style="content-visibility:auto;">

			</li><li class="   -mr-1.5 h-3 w-3 md:h-4 md:w-4 bg-linear-to-br block flex-none rounded-full border-2 border-white from-gray-300 to-gray-100 dark:border-gray-900 dark:from-gray-600 dark:to-gray-800" title="CoolColoury" style="content-visibility:auto;"><img class="overflow-hidden" alt="" src="https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/65fc00206529e3fcc230b820/IeZjMvHYZeZn8-igQ45R8.jpeg" loading="lazy">

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b p-4"><h3 class="mb-2 text-lg font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2403.13372" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer">LlamaFactory: Unified Efficient Fine-Tuning of 100+ Language Models</a></h3>

			<div class="mb-2"><p class="line-clamp-2 text-sm text-gray-600 dark:text-gray-300">LlamaFactory is a unified framework enabling efficient fine-tuning of large language models across various tasks using a web-based user interface.</p></div>

			<div class="mb-3 flex items-center text-sm text-gray-500 dark:text-gray-400"><ul class="flex items-center  flex-row-reverse    text-xs mr-1.5"><li class="   -mr-1.5 h-3 w-3 md:h-4 md:w-4 bg-linear-to-br block flex-none rounded-full border-2 border-white from-gray-300 to-gray-100 dark:border-gray-900 dark:from-gray-600 dark:to-gray-800" title="Zheyan Luo" style="content-visibility:auto;">

				<a href="/papers/2512.05905" class="block h-full w-56 cursor-pointer overflow-hidden bg-white dark:border-gray-800 max-md:border-b md:border-r"><video src="https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/63a369d98c0c89dcae3b8329/WXrZe3fv7C3YRAazHHfZM.qt" loop muted playsinline preload="metadata" class="pointer-events-none size-full object-cover object-center"></video></a>

			<div class="shadow-xs pointer-events-none absolute bottom-2 right-2 flex h-6 items-center gap-1 whitespace-nowrap rounded-md border bg-white px-2 text-xs leading-none text-gray-700 dark:bg-gray-900 dark:text-gray-400">Submitted by
					<img alt="" loading="lazy" class="size-2.5 rounded-full  flex-none select-none" src="https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/63a369d98c0c89dcae3b8329/AiH2zjy1cnt9OADAAZMLD.jpeg" crossorigin="anonymous">
					AdinaY</div></div>

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b flex min-w-0 flex-1 flex-col justify-center p-6"><h3 class="mb-1.5 text-xl font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2512.05905" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer text-balance">SCAIL: Towards Studio-Grade Character Animation via In-Context Learning of 3D-Consistent Pose Representations</a></h3>

			<div class="mb-2"><p class="line-clamp-2 text-sm text-gray-500 dark:text-gray-400">SCAIL framework improves character animation by using a novel 3D pose representation and a diffusion-transformer architecture with full-context pose injection, achieving studio-grade quality and realism.</p></div>

			<div class="flex min-w-0 items-center text-sm text-gray-400 dark:text-gray-500"><a href="/zai-org" class="inline-flex min-w-0 max-w-full items-center rounded-full border border-blue-200/70 bg-blue-50 py-0.5 text-blue-700 hover:border-blue-200 hover:bg-blue-100 dark:border-blue-500/20 dark:bg-blue-900/30 dark:text-blue-300 dark:hover:border-blue-500/30 dark:hover:bg-blue-900/50 px-1.5 text-xs gap-1 "><img src="https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/62dc173789b4cf157d36ebee/i_pxzM2ZDo3Ub-BEgIkE9.png" alt="zai-org" class="size-3 rounded-sm">
	<span class="block min-w-0 truncate font-medium">Z.ai</span></a>

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b flex min-w-0 flex-1 flex-col justify-center p-6"><h3 class="mb-1.5 text-xl font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2407.16741" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer text-balance">OpenDevin: An Open Platform for AI Software Developers as Generalist
  Agents</a></h3>

			<div class="mb-2"><p class="line-clamp-2 text-sm text-gray-500 dark:text-gray-400">OpenDevin is a platform for developing AI agents that interact with the world by writing code, using command lines, and browsing the web, with support for multiple agents and evaluation benchmarks.</p></div>

			<div class="flex min-w-0 items-center text-sm text-gray-400 dark:text-gray-500"><ul class="flex items-center  flex-row-reverse    text-xs "><li class="   -mr-1.5 h-3 w-3 md:h-4 md:w-4 bg-linear-to-br block flex-none rounded-full border-2 border-white from-gray-300 to-gray-100 dark:border-gray-900 dark:from-gray-600 dark:to-gray-800" title="RTT1" style="content-visibility:auto;"><img class="overflow-hidden" alt="" src="/avatars/ae0314c644f882251baf59b9134fd36f.svg" loading="lazy">

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b p-4"><h3 class="mb-2 text-lg font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2407.16741" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer">OpenDevin: An Open Platform for AI Software Developers as Generalist
  Agents</a></h3>

			<div class="mb-2"><p class="line-clamp-2 text-sm text-gray-600 dark:text-gray-300">OpenDevin is a platform for developing AI agents that interact with the world by writing code, using command lines, and browsing the web, with support for multiple agents and evaluation benchmarks.</p></div>

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b flex min-w-0 flex-1 flex-col justify-center p-6"><h3 class="mb-1.5 text-xl font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2511.20347" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer text-balance">Soft Adaptive Policy Optimization</a></h3>

			<div class="mb-2"><p class="line-clamp-2 text-sm text-gray-500 dark:text-gray-400">Soft Adaptive Policy Optimization (SAPO) enhances the stability and performance of reinforcement learning in large language models by adaptively attenuating off-policy updates with a smooth, temperature-controlled gate, leading to improved training stability and performance.</p></div>

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b p-4"><h3 class="mb-2 text-lg font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2511.20347" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer">Soft Adaptive Policy Optimization</a></h3>

			<div class="mb-2"><p class="line-clamp-2 text-sm text-gray-600 dark:text-gray-300">Soft Adaptive Policy Optimization (SAPO) enhances the stability and performance of reinforcement learning in large language models by adaptively attenuating off-policy updates with a smooth, temperature-controlled gate, leading to improved training stability and performance.</p></div>

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b flex min-w-0 flex-1 flex-col justify-center p-6"><h3 class="mb-1.5 text-xl font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2509.13232" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer text-balance">Single-stream Policy Optimization</a></h3>

			<div class="mb-2"><p class="line-clamp-2 text-sm text-gray-500 dark:text-gray-400">Single-stream Policy Optimization (SPO) improves policy-gradient training for Large Language Models by eliminating group-based issues and providing a stable, low-variance learning signal, leading to better performance and efficiency.</p></div>

					<span>arXiv Page</span></a></div></div></div></article><article class="relative overflow-hidden rounded-xl border"><div class="hidden h-40 md:flex"><div class="relative flex-shrink-0"><a href="/papers/2506.04106" class="block h-full w-56 cursor-pointer overflow-hidden bg-white dark:border-gray-800 max-md:border-b md:border-r"><img src="https://cdn-thumbnails.huggingface.co/social-thumbnails/papers/2506.04106.png" loading="lazy" decoding="async" alt="" class="size-full object-cover object-center opacity-80 dark:opacity-70 dark:invert"></a>

			</div>

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b flex min-w-0 flex-1 flex-col justify-center p-6"><h3 class="mb-1.5 text-xl font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2506.04106" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer text-balance">GlobalBuildingAtlas: An Open Global and Complete Dataset of Building Polygons, Heights and LoD1 3D Models</a></h3>

			<div class="mb-2"><p class="line-clamp-2 text-sm text-gray-500 dark:text-gray-400">We introduce GlobalBuildingAtlas, a publicly available dataset providing global and complete coverage of building polygons, heights and Level of Detail 1 (LoD1) 3D building models. This is the first open dataset to offer high quality, consistent, and complete building data in 2D and 3D form at the individual building level on a global scale. Towards this dataset, we developed machine learning-based pipelines to derive building polygons and heights (called GBA.Height) from global PlanetScope satellite data, respectively. Also a quality-based fusion strategy was employed to generate higher-quality polygons (called GBA.Polygon) based on existing open building polygons, including our own derived one. With more than 2.75 billion buildings worldwide, GBA.Polygon surpasses the most comprehensive database to date by more than 1 billion buildings. GBA.Height offers the most detailed and accurate global 3D building height maps to date, achieving a spatial resolution of 3x3 meters-30 times finer than previous global products (90 m), enabling a high-resolution and reliable analysis of building volumes at both local and global scales. Finally, we generated a global LoD1 building model (called GBA.LoD1) from the resulting GBA.Polygon and GBA.Height. GBA.LoD1 represents the first complete global LoD1 building models, including 2.68 billion building instances with predicted heights, i.e., with a height completeness of more than 97%, achieving RMSEs ranging from 1.5 m to 8.9 m across different continents. With its height accuracy, comprehensive global coverage and rich spatial details, GlobalBuildingAltas offers novel insights on the status quo of global buildings, which unlocks unprecedented geospatial analysis possibilities, as showcased by a better illustration of where people live and a more comprehensive monitoring of the progress on the 11th Sustainable Development Goal of the United Nations.</p></div>

			<div class="flex min-w-0 items-center text-sm text-gray-400 dark:text-gray-500"><ul class="flex items-center  flex-row-reverse    text-xs mr-1.5"><li class="   -mr-1.5 h-3 w-3 md:h-4 md:w-4 bg-linear-to-br block flex-none rounded-full border-2 border-white from-gray-300 to-gray-100 dark:border-gray-900 dark:from-gray-600 dark:to-gray-800" title="Yuanyuan Wang" style="content-visibility:auto;">
			</li><li class="   -mr-1.5 h-3 w-3 md:h-4 md:w-4 bg-linear-to-br block flex-none rounded-full border-2 border-white from-gray-300 to-gray-100 dark:border-gray-900 dark:from-gray-600 dark:to-gray-800" title="Yilei Shi" style="content-visibility:auto;">
			</li><li class="   -mr-1.5 h-3 w-3 md:h-4 md:w-4 bg-linear-to-br block flex-none rounded-full border-2 border-white from-gray-300 to-gray-100 dark:border-gray-900 dark:from-gray-600 dark:to-gray-800" title="Fahong Zhang" style="content-visibility:auto;">
			</li><li class="   -mr-1.5 h-3 w-3 md:h-4 md:w-4 bg-linear-to-br block flex-none rounded-full border-2 border-white from-gray-300 to-gray-100 dark:border-gray-900 dark:from-gray-600 dark:to-gray-800" title="Sining Chen" style="content-visibility:auto;">
			</li><li class="   -mr-1.5 h-3 w-3 md:h-4 md:w-4 bg-linear-to-br block flex-none rounded-full border-2 border-white from-gray-300 to-gray-100 dark:border-gray-900 dark:from-gray-600 dark:to-gray-800" title="Xiao Xiang Zhu" style="content-visibility:auto;">
			</li>

		<li class="text-xs text-gray-600 hover:text-gray-700 dark:text-gray-400 dark:hover:text-gray-300 order-first ml-2"><span class="text-gray-400 dark:text-gray-500">5 authors</span></li></ul>

					<span>Published on Jun 4, 2025</span></div></div>

				<span>arXiv Page</span></a></div></div>

	<div class="flex flex-col md:hidden"><div class="relative w-full"><a href="/papers/2506.04106" class="block h-48 w-full cursor-pointer overflow-hidden bg-white dark:border-gray-800 max-md:border-b md:border-r"><img src="https://cdn-thumbnails.huggingface.co/social-thumbnails/papers/2506.04106.png" loading="lazy" decoding="async" alt="" class="size-full object-cover object-center opacity-80 dark:opacity-70 dark:invert"></a>

			</div>

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b p-4"><h3 class="mb-2 text-lg font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2506.04106" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer">GlobalBuildingAtlas: An Open Global and Complete Dataset of Building Polygons, Heights and LoD1 3D Models</a></h3>

			<div class="mb-2"><p class="line-clamp-2 text-sm text-gray-600 dark:text-gray-300">We introduce GlobalBuildingAtlas, a publicly available dataset providing global and complete coverage of building polygons, heights and Level of Detail 1 (LoD1) 3D building models. This is the first open dataset to offer high quality, consistent, and complete building data in 2D and 3D form at the individual building level on a global scale. Towards this dataset, we developed machine learning-based pipelines to derive building polygons and heights (called GBA.Height) from global PlanetScope satellite data, respectively. Also a quality-based fusion strategy was employed to generate higher-quality polygons (called GBA.Polygon) based on existing open building polygons, including our own derived one. With more than 2.75 billion buildings worldwide, GBA.Polygon surpasses the most comprehensive database to date by more than 1 billion buildings. GBA.Height offers the most detailed and accurate global 3D building height maps to date, achieving a spatial resolution of 3x3 meters-30 times finer than previous global products (90 m), enabling a high-resolution and reliable analysis of building volumes at both local and global scales. Finally, we generated a global LoD1 building model (called GBA.LoD1) from the resulting GBA.Polygon and GBA.Height. GBA.LoD1 represents the first complete global LoD1 building models, including 2.68 billion building instances with predicted heights, i.e., with a height completeness of more than 97%, achieving RMSEs ranging from 1.5 m to 8.9 m across different continents. With its height accuracy, comprehensive global coverage and rich spatial details, GlobalBuildingAltas offers novel insights on the status quo of global buildings, which unlocks unprecedented geospatial analysis possibilities, as showcased by a better illustration of where people live and a more comprehensive monitoring of the progress on the 11th Sustainable Development Goal of the United Nations.</p></div>

			<div class="mb-3 flex items-center text-sm text-gray-500 dark:text-gray-400"><ul class="flex items-center  flex-row-reverse    text-xs mr-1.5"><li class="   -mr-1.5 h-3 w-3 md:h-4 md:w-4 bg-linear-to-br block flex-none rounded-full border-2 border-white from-gray-300 to-gray-100 dark:border-gray-900 dark:from-gray-600 dark:to-gray-800" title="Yuanyuan Wang" style="content-visibility:auto;">
			</li><li class="   -mr-1.5 h-3 w-3 md:h-4 md:w-4 bg-linear-to-br block flex-none rounded-full border-2 border-white from-gray-300 to-gray-100 dark:border-gray-900 dark:from-gray-600 dark:to-gray-800" title="Yilei Shi" style="content-visibility:auto;">
			</li><li class="   -mr-1.5 h-3 w-3 md:h-4 md:w-4 bg-linear-to-br block flex-none rounded-full border-2 border-white from-gray-300 to-gray-100 dark:border-gray-900 dark:from-gray-600 dark:to-gray-800" title="Fahong Zhang" style="content-visibility:auto;">
			</li><li class="   -mr-1.5 h-3 w-3 md:h-4 md:w-4 bg-linear-to-br block flex-none rounded-full border-2 border-white from-gray-300 to-gray-100 dark:border-gray-900 dark:from-gray-600 dark:to-gray-800" title="Sining Chen" style="content-visibility:auto;">
			</li><li class="   -mr-1.5 h-3 w-3 md:h-4 md:w-4 bg-linear-to-br block flex-none rounded-full border-2 border-white from-gray-300 to-gray-100 dark:border-gray-900 dark:from-gray-600 dark:to-gray-800" title="Xiao Xiang Zhu" style="content-visibility:auto;">
			</li>

		<li class="text-xs text-gray-600 hover:text-gray-700 dark:text-gray-400 dark:hover:text-gray-300 order-first ml-2"><span>5 authors</span></li></ul>

					<span>Jun 4, 2025</span></div>

				<a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2506.04106" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" class="btn flex h-9 w-full items-center justify-center gap-2"><svg class="size-4" 		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b flex min-w-0 flex-1 flex-col justify-center p-6"><h3 class="mb-1.5 text-xl font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2510.12323" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer text-balance">RAG-Anything: All-in-One RAG Framework</a></h3>

					<span>arXiv Page</span></a></div></div></div></article><article class="relative overflow-hidden rounded-xl border"><div class="hidden h-40 md:flex"><div class="relative flex-shrink-0"><a href="/papers/2512.10950" class="block h-full w-56 cursor-pointer overflow-hidden bg-white dark:border-gray-800 max-md:border-b md:border-r"><img src="https://cdn-thumbnails.huggingface.co/social-thumbnails/papers/2512.10950.png" loading="lazy" decoding="async" alt="" class="size-full object-cover object-center opacity-80 dark:opacity-70 dark:invert"></a>

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b flex min-w-0 flex-1 flex-col justify-center p-6"><h3 class="mb-1.5 text-xl font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2512.10950" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer text-balance">E-RayZer: Self-supervised 3D Reconstruction as Spatial Visual Pre-training</a></h3>

			<div class="mb-2"><p class="line-clamp-2 text-sm text-gray-500 dark:text-gray-400">E-RayZer is a self-supervised 3D Vision model that directly learns 3D-aware representations from unlabeled images, outperforming existing models in pose estimation and 3D reconstruction tasks.</p></div>

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b flex min-w-0 flex-1 flex-col justify-center p-6"><h3 class="mb-1.5 text-xl font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2304.11277" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer text-balance">PyTorch FSDP: Experiences on Scaling Fully Sharded Data Parallel</a></h3>

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b flex min-w-0 flex-1 flex-col justify-center p-6"><h3 class="mb-1.5 text-xl font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2006.15704" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer text-balance">PyTorch Distributed: Experiences on Accelerating Data Parallel Training</a></h3>

			<div class="mb-2"><p class="line-clamp-2 text-sm text-gray-500 dark:text-gray-400">The PyTorch distributed data parallel module optimizes large-scale model training using techniques like gradient bucketing, computation-communication overlap, and selective synchronization to achieve near-linear scalability.</p></div>

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b p-4"><h3 class="mb-2 text-lg font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2006.15704" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer">PyTorch Distributed: Experiences on Accelerating Data Parallel Training</a></h3>

			<div class="mb-2"><p class="line-clamp-2 text-sm text-gray-600 dark:text-gray-300">The PyTorch distributed data parallel module optimizes large-scale model training using techniques like gradient bucketing, computation-communication overlap, and selective synchronization to achieve near-linear scalability.</p></div>

			<div class="mb-3 flex items-center text-sm text-gray-500 dark:text-gray-400"><ul class="flex items-center  flex-row-reverse    text-xs "><li class="   -mr-1.5 h-3 w-3 md:h-4 md:w-4 bg-linear-to-br block flex-none rounded-full border-2 border-white from-gray-300 to-gray-100 dark:border-gray-900 dark:from-gray-600 dark:to-gray-800" title="Rohan Varma" style="content-visibility:auto;">
			</li><li class="   -mr-1.5 h-3 w-3 md:h-4 md:w-4 bg-linear-to-br block flex-none rounded-full border-2 border-white from-gray-300 to-gray-100 dark:border-gray-900 dark:from-gray-600 dark:to-gray-800" title="Yanli Zhao" style="content-visibility:auto;">

					<img alt="" loading="lazy" class="size-2.5 rounded-full  flex-none select-none" src="https://cdn-avatars.huggingface.co/v1/production/uploads/6426616ea5ec4a5cbc535634/5IfSFYd9QOxz8K9QmBCst.png" crossorigin="anonymous">

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b p-4"><h3 class="mb-2 text-lg font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2510.19430" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer">GigaBrain-0: A World Model-Powered Vision-Language-Action Model</a></h3>

			<div class="mb-2"><p class="line-clamp-2 text-sm text-gray-600 dark:text-gray-300">GigaBrain-0, a VLA foundation model, uses world model-generated data to enhance cross-task generalization and policy robustness, improving real-world performance on complex manipulation tasks.</p></div>

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b flex min-w-0 flex-1 flex-col justify-center p-6"><h3 class="mb-1.5 text-xl font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2504.19413" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer text-balance">Mem0: Building Production-Ready AI Agents with Scalable Long-Term Memory</a></h3>

			<div class="mb-2"><p class="line-clamp-2 text-sm text-gray-500 dark:text-gray-400">Mem0, a memory-centric architecture with graph-based memory, enhances long-term conversational coherence in LLMs by efficiently extracting, consolidating, and retrieving information, outperforming existing memory systems in terms of accuracy and computational efficiency.</p></div>

					akhaliq</div></div>

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b p-4"><h3 class="mb-2 text-lg font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2504.19413" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer">Mem0: Building Production-Ready AI Agents with Scalable Long-Term Memory</a></h3>

			<div class="mb-2"><p class="line-clamp-2 text-sm text-gray-600 dark:text-gray-300">Mem0, a memory-centric architecture with graph-based memory, enhances long-term conversational coherence in LLMs by efficiently extracting, consolidating, and retrieving information, outperforming existing memory systems in terms of accuracy and computational efficiency.</p></div>

			<div class="mb-3 flex items-center text-sm text-gray-500 dark:text-gray-400"><ul class="flex items-center  flex-row-reverse    text-xs mr-1.5"><li class="   -mr-1.5 h-3 w-3 md:h-4 md:w-4 bg-linear-to-br block flex-none rounded-full border-2 border-white from-gray-300 to-gray-100 dark:border-gray-900 dark:from-gray-600 dark:to-gray-800" title="Taranjeet Singh" style="content-visibility:auto;">

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b p-4"><h3 class="mb-2 text-lg font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2501.07572" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer">WebWalker: Benchmarking LLMs in Web Traversal</a></h3>

			<div class="mb-2"><p class="line-clamp-2 text-sm text-gray-600 dark:text-gray-300">WebWalkerQA assesses LLMs' ability to traverse websites for high-quality data, showing enhancements when combined with RAG using the WebWalker multi-agent framework.</p></div>

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b flex min-w-0 flex-1 flex-col justify-center p-6"><h3 class="mb-1.5 text-xl font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2512.12602" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer text-balance">Error-Free Linear Attention is a Free Lunch: Exact Solution from Continuous-Time Dynamics</a></h3>

			<div class="mb-2"><p class="line-clamp-2 text-sm text-gray-500 dark:text-gray-400">Error-Free Linear Attention (EFLA) is a stable, parallelizable, and theoretically sound linear-time attention mechanism that outperforms DeltaNet in language modeling and downstream tasks.</p></div>

		<div class="from-gray-50-to-white bg-linear-to-b p-4"><h3 class="mb-2 text-lg font-semibold text-gray-900 hover:underline dark:text-white"><a href="/papers/2512.12602" class="line-clamp-2 cursor-pointer">Error-Free Linear Attention is a Free Lunch: Exact Solution from Continuous-Time Dynamics</a></h3>

			<div class="mb-2"><p class="line-clamp-2 text-sm text-gray-600 dark:text-gray-300">Error-Free Linear Attention (EFLA) is a stable, parallelizable, and theoretically sound linear-time attention mechanism that outperforms DeltaNet in language modeling and downstream tasks.</p></div>

			<div class="mb-3 flex items-center text-sm text-gray-500 dark:text-gray-400"><a href="/declare-lab" class="inline-flex min-w-0 max-w-full items-center rounded-full border border-blue-200/70 bg-blue-50 py-0.5 text-blue-700 hover:border-blue-200 hover:bg-blue-100 dark:border-blue-500/20 dark:bg-blue-900/30 dark:text-blue-300 dark:hover:border-blue-500/30 dark:hover:bg-blue-900/50 px-1.5 text-xs gap-1 "><img src="https://cdn-uploads.huggingface.co/production/uploads/626b626405fe1cb65725aca1/grq3rj2uj0WRjjPjAtR1I.png" alt="declare-lab" class="size-3 rounded-sm">
	<span class="block min-w-0 truncate font-medium">Deep Cognition and Language Research (DeCLaRe) Lab</span></a>
				<span class="mx-1"></span>
					<span>Dec 14, 2025</span></div>

	<div class="shadow-alternate group flex h-9 cursor-pointer select-none items-center gap-2 rounded-lg border pl-3 pr-3.5 border-gray-300 bg-white dark:bg-gray-850 w-full justify-center"><input disabled type="checkbox"  class="peer hidden">
